La Sra. Rocio Denís de 18 años de edad está casado hace 3 años con el señor Artemio Rolón de 27 años, la pareja cuenta con un hijo de 2 años.

La señora desde que se casó está administrando el negocio que su esposo había formado para ella, el señor se dedica al corte de madera, con el capital que dispone formaron este negocio, con el fin de aumentar el ingreso de la unidad familiar. Es importante mencionar que a la fecha cuenta con clientela formada gracias a la buena atención y precios que ofrece, le provee a varias mueblerías de la ciudad camas torneadas, juego de comedor, cama tallada y otros, recibiendo siempre el apoyo de su esposo para la buena administración del negocio.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (madera) y así cumplir con todos los pedidos que cuenta de las diferentes mueblerías.

loans.use: To purchase wood, nails and glues.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice A. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Rejoice sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman. Rejoice uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands. With the new profits, Rejoice plans to reinvest in the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Rejoice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale to meet her ever increasing customers' demands.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles es socia del BC “Manos Unidas” y vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanes y arroz chaufa. Desarrolla su negocio en las afueras de su casa, situado en el Jr. 1º de mayo Nº 439. Hace dos años decide iniciar esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos y contribuir a la economía de su hogar y actualmente le va muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo, también comprará cecina y chorizo, los cuales que le permitirán variar los platos a ofertar y atender la petición de sus clientes.
 
Maria de los Ángeles es una mujer entusiasta de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas quienes aún son pequeñas y que además son la razón para seguir luchando y de esa manera poder darles una buena calidad de vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y su meta es retomar los estudios que tuvo que dejar por que tiene una bebé y le es necesario dedicarse bastante tiempo a ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is a member of the communal bank "Manos Unidas" (United Hands) and lives in the San Martin region and province, Tarapoto district. She sells beef and chicken kebabs, grilled meat, jaunes (a tamale-like dish) and arroz chaufa (traditional dish similar to fried rice). She develops her business around her house, located at May 1st Street, Number 439. Two years ago she decided to start this activity based on the need to generate income and contribute to the finances of her home and actually it is going very well.

With this 1,500 Soles loan, which will be paid off in a period of 6 months, she will purchase consumables for the preparation of food, such as rice, sugar, beef, chicken and pork. She will also buy cured meat and sausage, which will allow her to vary her dishes on offer and attend to the requests of her clients.

Maria de los Angeles is an enthusiastic woman of 25 years old. She lives with her husband and their 2 daughters, who are still little. They are also her reason to continue fighting and in that way be able to give them a good quality of life. She is a hardworking woman and her goal is to again start up her studies, which she had to quit because she had a baby and it was necessary to spend a lot of time with her.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, beef, chicken and pork, cured meat and sausage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to produce 'pica pollo'.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in clothing and footwear to keep running a small business.

loans.name: Dik

texts.en:
Dik N., age 43, is married with two children, ages 15 and 17. She sells fish at Phsar Pa Av market, Kampong Cham province. Dik N. purchases fish from the brokers who bought from fisherman and delivers some to the vendors at a market and keeps some for her own stand. She can typically make about $2.50 a day of net income.

Her husband works growing yams, earning around $2 a day. The revenue she and her husband make has to cover the family’s expenses, such as $40 per month on food and $15 per month on her children's tuition. Dik N. and her husband request a loan from KIVA to buy insecticide for their yam crops and to buy more seeds to increase the output.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and seeds to increase their crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Victoria es casada, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, su esposo se encarga de la atención.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Victoria son pagar todas sus deudas, darse unas vacaciones con su esposo, irse de viaje.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Village Bank “Ollantay”. Victoria is 65 years old, married and has four children. Victoria has a stall in the market “12 de Abril” where she sells potatoes and other root crops, an activity which she does every day. Additionally, Victoria has a small store in her home which her husband supervises. Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, rice and sugar. Victoria’s dream is to pay off all her debts, giving her a vacation with her husband, and time to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. sells used clothing and food supplies at Abura. Esther has received senior high school education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Esther has been selling used clothing and food supplies for about 5 years now. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses and other family expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest for the expansion of her businesses.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and food supplies

loans.name: Mr. Sambok Yung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people living in Phnum Lonteach village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sambok Y. is the 29 year old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Nouy Kim Chhroeun, is a duck breeder who owns a poultry business. Now she wants to start breeding pigs; thus, Mr. Sambok Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs and pig feed for his wife’s business. He has two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

Ten members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Arme Du Christ Group

texts.en:
The “Arme du ChriS.” or “Army of ChriS.” Group is a made of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1S. loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 2nd loan.

Though small, the group has a wide range of businesses from food sales and used clothing, to live animals. Nelly M. is one of three representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two children.

The hardworking mom sells a variety of items based on the needs of her clients. She mostly sells food items including sugar, flour, oils, rice, spices, and some vegetables. Her business and family were both able to benefit from the loan because prior to the loan, she says, her children’s meals were not as regular as they should be whereas now, the entire family is able to eat three meals a day.  She hopes to continually grow her business and increase her savings so that she may finish school, go to college and eventually get married.

On behalf of Nelly, Arme du ChriS., and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, rice, oils, and vegetables

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda E. Narváez tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Aleyda tiene 3 hijos todos estudian. La actividad económica de Aleyda es la venta de gaseosas y brinda el servicio de billares. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Aleyda inicio este negocio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Este negocio de Aleyda esta ubicado en su vivienda porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma comarca, Aleyda dice que tiene que trabajar muy duro para obtener el pan de cada día. Los propósitos de Aleyda son de ampliar su negocio y obtener más productos. El financiamiento que solicita es especialmente para capital de trabajo y con este dinero podrá comprar gaseosas, golosinas, pollo y además proporcionarle mejoras a las mesas de billar. Los sueños de Aleyda  son de mejorar cada día con el servicio ofrecido y además con el paso del tiempo convertir su negocio en restaurante.
texts.en:
Aleyda E. Narvárez, 45, is married and has three children who go to school. Aleyda sells soft drinks. She also has billiards tables. She has been working at this for over eight years. Aleyda started the business because she needed a source of family income. Her business is located in her home because the majority of her customers are from her area. Aleyda has to work very hard to earn her daily bread. Aleyda plans to expand her business and get more products. The loan she is asking for is especially for working capital. With this money she will be able to buy soft drinks, sweets, chicken, and also make improvements on her billiard tables. Aleyda’s dreams are to get better every day with the service she offers. In the future she also wants to convert her business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El sr Tomas L. esta casado con la Sra Manuela Figueredo.  Ellos tienen 1 hijo menor. 
Don Tomas se dedica a la fabricacion de menajes de aluminos como vasos, cacerolas, bandejas, champañeras etc.

El sr Tomas tiene su propia fabrica en su domicilio y la venta lo realiza en los comercios de San Lorenzo, Ita, Capiata, y Asuncion.  Esta profesion lo aprendio de su anterior trabajo donde se desarrollaba como empleado y luego decidio independizarse, luego de muchos años de trabajo.
En el futuro sueña con un local mas amplio donde pueda dar mas trabajo y seguir educando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Tomás L. is married to Señora Manuela Figueredo. They have one young son. Don Tomás works at fabricating aluminum kitchenware, such as cups, pans, trays, champagne buckets, etc. Sr. Tomás has his own workshop in his house and he sells his products in the stores of San Lorenzo, Itá, Capiatá and Asunción. He learned this trade at his previous job where he was trained on the job, and later he decided to work independently after many years of work. In the future he dreams of having a larger shop where he would be able to do more work, and to continue educating his son.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang Darmini is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Pangkung Buluh. She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Buluh Sari (DNR.M-0694).

Ni Komang Darmini is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Komang Darmini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs.

Ni Komang Darmini is now requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************

Ni Komang Darmini - (-) merupakan 30 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Pangkung Buluh. Ni Komang Darmini adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 13 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Buluh Sari (DNR.M-0694).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang Darmini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Darmini menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR. Dalam 2007, Ni Komang Darmini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang Darmini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,200,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.


Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El sr. Ricardo se dedica al servicio de transporte, tiene su movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi, vive con su esposa y sus hijos pequeños, en una casita ubicada en Valle de las Flores. Recientemente en sociedad con dos amigos adquirió una empresa de radio taxis, con que están empezando a trabajar, es una persona muy responsable y muy puntual, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora y aparatdo telefónicos para la microempresa y así mejorar el servicio.
texts.en:
Señor Ricardo works at public transit; he has a vehicle which he uses as a radio taxi. He lives with his wife and small children in a house located in the Valle del las Flores (Valley of the Flowers). Recently, he and two friends acquired a radio taxi business which they have begun to operate. He is a very responsible person and very punctual. The loan will be used to purchase a computer and telephone equipment for the business so that they can improve their service.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer and telephone equipment

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros E. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Milagros is married to Wenefredo and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing shoe repair services to local community members and running a sari-sari (variety) store. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200 Philippine pesos (about $25 US) a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Milagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the services provided by the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Houenafa

texts.fr: Houenafa est née vers 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin où elle réside actuellement. Houenafa est mariée au chef du quartier ZOGBO de Cotonou, Monsieur ZOUNGNI Félix. Houenafa est mère de six enfants dont deux sont décédés et seulement deux sont scolarisés. Houenafa a débuté il y a trois ans la vente de nourriture. Houenafa vend du riz au gras aux écoliers d'un établissement privé non loin de chez elle au quartier ZOGBO. Houenafa a ajouté à cette activité, la vente de beignets faits à base de farine de blé. A ces deux activité, Houenafa a ajouté la vente de pâtes de maïs appelée localement akassa accompagnées de poissons frits. Houenafa a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a développé ses activités. Pour renforcer ses trois activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Houenafa sollicite son cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Houenafa was born around 1974 at Cotonou, the economic capital of the Benin Republic, where she continues to live today. Houenafa is married to Felix Zoungni, the head of the Zogbo district in Cotonou. She is the mother of six children of whom two are deceased and only two are currently enrolled in school. Three years ago Houenafa began selling food. She sold fried rice to private school children not far from the Zogbo district. To this business she added the sale of donuts made of wheat flour. She has also added the sale of corn noodles, locally known as akassa, accompanied with fried fish to her business. Houenafa has already benefited from four loans from ALIDe; these loans have been fully repaid and were used to help her develop the business described above. Houenafa is asking for her fifth loan in an effort to grow this business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four 50Kg bags of rice, four 25 liter drums of vegetable oil, and three 100Kg bags of corn.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en:
K. Mehri is 53 years old. She is married with two children. Mehri is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Twelve years ago, she got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family's finances, taking advantage of the space she had available at her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of her animals she keeps. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni. Please be an important part of the growth of Mehri’s business.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es: José Augusto F. A., reside en San Luis Talpa departamento La Paz, Junto a su familia maneja un negocio de venta de  mangos,  ubicado en el mercado central. Con tan solo siete años de experiencia, vive con su esposa y  tres hijastros, todos estudiantes. Actualmente José solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería (mangos), que le permitan generar mayores ingresos  y hacer crecer su negocio, con esta deliciosa y exotica fruta, que es muy demandada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Augusto F. A. lives in San Luis Talpa, in the La Paz region. Together with his family, he runs a business selling mangoes, located in the town's central market. He has only seven years of experience, and he lives with his wife and three stepchildren, all of them students. He is currently requesting a loan to buy new products and raw materials in order to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding his inventory of mangoes

loans.name: Leut

texts.en: Leut R., 27, is a recycler who resides with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. Every day, she walks around with her bicycle to buy recycling items in her village to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2 a day, while her husband is a private company staff member and makes US$ 3 a day to help support the family. To make more money, Mrs. Leut R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 400 to expand her recycling business.

loans.use: To expand her recycling business

loans.name: Elisa Gomes

texts.pt:
Elisa N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do Pais, tem 23 anos de idade casada e mãe de 1 filha de 6 meses de idade, vive com seu esposo na casa cedida pelos sogros. Fez 11ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. 

Saiu de Maputo com os pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços no ano de 2006 e foram fixar se em Boane, onde actualmente encontra se a residir com o seu marido e tem um negocio próprio. Trabalha com seu marido e tem 2 trabalhadores para ajudar na sua actividade comercial. Nesta actividade consegue um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mes e consegue poupar algum no Banco Comercial BIM. 

Nunca levantou empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu esposo que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 13.700.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros produtos, para aumentar o volume do negócio. Tem sido difícil vender no Inverno porque estes produtos têm pouca procura.

O grande objectivo neste momento é responder as necessidades de casa como alimentação, saúde, escola e outros. No futuro gostaria de aceder a mais empréstimos para construir a sua própria casa e fazer o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Elisa N. was born in Maputo, the country's capital, she is 23 years old, she is married and has 1 daughter who is 6 months old, she lives with her husband at her parents in law. She finished the 11th grade, and didn't finished school due to her pregnancy. She left Maputo with her parents were transferred back in 2006 and went to live in Boane, where she currently lives with her husband and has a business. She works with her husband and has 2 employees to help at the business. At the store she is able to obtain 15.000MT a month and is able to save some money at the Commercial Bank BIM. She never requested a loan at any other banks before, she learned about Hluvuku thru his husband who is client of the institution. This is her first loan for 13.700MT which will be used to buy beer, wine, other beverages and products, in order to increase the volume of her business. It has been difficult to sell during the winter because demand is low for those products during the season. The large objective is to answer the necessities of the house like health, food, studies and others. In the future she would like to access more loans to build their own house and attend college.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell groceries and beverages

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years old.  She is engaged in snack vending business and also helps her husband in managing their furniture shop business.  She would like to develop and improve her business by having enough capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 in order than she can earn more  to provide the needs of her family. Currently, she is spending on allowances, tuition fees and projects to her three children: Angeline-17 years old who is college student; Angelo-11 years old elementary pupil and Alexander Jr.-6 years old.

Virginia is married to Alexander Sr. who is making products such as:  cabinet,chair and other kinds of furniture. They are able to generate PHP5000 weekly but then, they still need to double the income to meet then needs of their children. She is hoping that through the support of the lenders, all her business goals will be achieved.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco L. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 47 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Francisco owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, sachets of milk, noodles, soap, toothpaste and other products in the local community. Francisco is just starting this business. In 2009, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 5190 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Jean marie vianey is 30 years old and he is single.  To save money, he lives with his parents in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here Jean marie vianey is the group representative of seven people in a group called Abishyizehamwe.

Jean marie vianey is new to the business of buying and selling spare parts. Though he is a bit of a novice in this industry, his business is running well and he works hard to make it successful, working every day except Sunday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. His business employs two other people as helpers.

The reason why Jean marie vianey is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders is to expand his business by purchasing more and different spare parts for sale. Prior to requesting this loan, Jean marie vianey's monthly profit was approximately 150,000 RWF (~250 USD). If his expansion strategy is successful he expects to earn more profit which he will reinvest in his business.

Jean marie vianey also he plans to get married someday, which is not inexpensive and he is saving for that as well as for having a family.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 36-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with five children and all her children are in school.

Adwoa prepares and serves local food like “banku”, rice balls, etc. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Rice balls are prepared from rice and are also taken with soup. Adwoa has been in business for the last two years in order to feed her family. Her food is tasty and very affordable and, because of that, many buy from her.

Adwoa says the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Adwoa would be grateful for your assistance and has no regrets about her current food business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: Juana María L. C. de 37 años en 1994 decidió  tener un negocio que le permitiera apoyar a sus hijas y estar con ellas es así que decide poner una pulpería. L. a segura que este negocio no es pesado ya que son muy organizadas y se distribuyen el trabajo entre ella y sus tres hijas las cuales estudian una esta es secundaria y las otras dos en la universidad.
texts.en:
In 1994, Juana María L. C., 37 years old, decided to start a business that would let her support her daughters while still taking care of them, so she opened a small grocery store. Ms. L. says that the business is not too demanding, since they are very organized and distribute the work evenly between herself and her three daughters, one of whom is in high school and the other two in college.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains, meat, and other products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”,  Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. Margarita, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desde hace 04 años atrás, que viene dedicándose a la  venta de chupetes, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  Nos cuenta que hoy en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Margarita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres del 2000” in the district and province of Lamas, department of San Martín. She is 37, living with her husband and 3 dependent children. Margarita is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling popsicles from her own home. She provides a well-equipped atmosphere for her clients who come by from day to day for her richly-flavored popsicles. She tells us that she is currently very happy because her business is going so well. With this loan of $475 she will buy the ingredients she uses to make her product, such as kilos of sugar, cartons of milk, and the fruits she needs every day for the preparation of the lollypops. She needs an assortment of products in order to win the best clientele. Margarita feels strengthened to keep working and persevering day by day, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in the middle of their circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make popsicles

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn N. and her husband, Mr. Sran Mi, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support their family. She is a 52-year-old villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. This couple has four children: one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local public school. 

This family has a problem because their rice field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Oeurn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine. She will use the rest of the loan to buy hose to support their rice field and increase their rice yield this year. 

Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hose to support their rice field

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 33 years old and married with two young children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband works at variety of jobs including welding, farming, and construction.  To supply additional income for her family, Wilma is starting a business buying and selling charcoal and wood in the neighborhood.  She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own.


Wilma would like to receive a loan to purchase more charcoal and wood.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Wilma is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.   Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, fund her children’s college education, and construct a more durable home that can withstand flooding common in her town.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make repair to his café

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Paraíso” representado por el señor Armando y conformado por 10 socios que entre ellos son bien unidos, alegres  y muy dinámicos. La señora Inés es la socia destacada del grupo ella se dedica  a la venta D. F. en la zona D. Chimore senda 3 y su esposo Felipe se dedica a la venta D. plátano (saca del chaco para vender) tienen 2 hijos que todavía son pequeños, Inés y su esposo aun viven en la casa D. los padres D. ella, por lo que su mayor deseo es poder comprarse un terreno donD. sembrar para progresar y poder darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría trabaja en lo que es la venta D. F., ropa, frutas y entre los varones se dedican a la mecánica, transporte, construcción y a la agricultura. El grupo en general tiene experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en toda la zona. La competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con  clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus productos y servicios. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. inversión para la compra D. F., compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. los hogares D. los socios. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con el apoyo económico D. la fundación que les ayuda a crecer para tener un hogar mas estable y mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Paraíso (Paradise) Communal Bank is represented by Armando and comprised of ten members. They members are very united, happy, and very dynamic. Inés is the featured member of the group. She sells flowers in the Chimore Senda 3 area. Her husband, Felipe, sells bananas (he takes them from the farm to sell). They have two children who are still young. Inés and her husband still live in her parents’ house. Her biggest desire is to be able to buy a piece of land to plant. She wants to progress and be able to give her children a better future. The rest of the group works at different activities. Most of them work selling flowers, clothes, and fruits. The men work as mechanics, in transportation, in construction, and in farming. In general, the group has experience in the businesses they have. That is why they are well known in the entire area. In general, there is a lot of competition. The group has regular customers who recognize their work and demand their products and services. The current loan will be used as capital to invest in the purchase of flowers, materials, supplies, and work tools that will help to generate better income to support the members’ households. The group’s expectation is to keep working and counting, above all, on the economic support of the foundation to help them grow. They want this in order to have a more stable home and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 35 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol and beer at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a bar.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Ching is married. To make a living, Ching owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, soy sauce, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ching has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ching has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ching is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ching from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Panato Ole

texts.en:
Panato Ole S. is 37 years old. He is married to Naanyu S. and he is the father of two children who are going to school. Panato is a farmer and he has been farming his land for the last ten years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend twenty thousand in buying chemicals and fertilizers for wheat which he has already planted. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in wheat farming.  He is a hard-working man and with the right resources he believes that he can do great.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for his wheat

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, Z. Clémentine est mariée à KOUTON Marcelin. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Il y a près de sept ans que la famille s'est installée à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clémentine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Clémentine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs douze ans que Clémentine mène comme activité, la vente de farine de manioc et de sodabi (boisson alcoolisée locale). Cette activité lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille. Clémentine vend ses produits à son domicile, et s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Clémentine a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qu'elle avait bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Clémentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Clémentine Z. was born in 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, and is married to Marcelin KOUTON. The couple has one child, who doesn't go to school yet. Approximately seven years ago, the family moved in to Agbodjèdo, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Clementine provides for the family together with her husband. She never attended school. For approximately 12 years, Clémentine has been selling cassava flour and sodabi (a local alcoholic beverage). With the income drawn from this business, she provides for the family. She sells her products at her home, and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Clémentine already benefited from two loans, that she repaid without problems. In order to increase her working capital and bolster her business, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Balaba

texts.fr: Balaba G. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING dont elle est la trésorière depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait de la production et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 10 ans. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa production et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Son mari étant malade pendant plusieurs années, son objectif est d'assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Balaba G. is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of 6. She is a member of the DIAOBE MANDING village bank, of which she is the treasurer since the 10th of June 2002. She received loans 15 times and she has been making and selling peanut paste for more than 10 years. Her new loan will allow her to increase her production and to better satisfy her customers. Her husband has been sick for several years, so she aims to pay for the family's daily expenses and her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Felimona

texts.en:
Felomina A. is from the village of Delapa. She is 58 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector in rice production, selling her own harvested rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will used for rice production. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For rice production

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia D. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Alicia is married and has one adult child. Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, candies, and boost food in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun C., 57, is the village bank president having been selected by its four members who are located in Preak Ta Pring village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their particular business.

Mrs. Saroeun C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land that she uses to cultivate onions. She is also a laborer who is able to earn a small salary to support her living.

In order to support her farming, Mrs. Saroeun C. will use the loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to cultivate green onions.

Mrs. Saroeun C. is widow and does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate green onions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is from the village of Luna. She is 45 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. Melanie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used purchase additional products to sell.

Melanie is now requesting her third loan from ASKI, for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Emelinda's Group

texts.en:
Emelinda F. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Emelinda is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emelinda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emelinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Emelinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells the animals she raises.

In 2010, Emelinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to breed.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezl C., 39, is married and has seven children. She is a farmer. She wants her children to finish their studies so she ventured into this business. She is engaged in rice farming. She joined CEVI because it helps her augment her financial capability and she was able to buy fertilizers for her rice field. The loan will be used to buy her farm materials like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.use: farm materials like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis M. E. desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para ampliarla y tener mas espacio. Para poder realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra. José Luis y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora para poder sostener los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Mr. Jose Luis M. E. wants to build a bedroom in his home to have a more living space.  In order to complete his project he needs to purchase building material and he needs to hire a contractor. Jose Luis and his wife work in a factory to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: To build a room in their home.

loans.name: Mourm

texts.en:
Mourm S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. 

S. has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  She is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia  Puno, Departamento Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, estado civil viuda, con cuatro hijos y grado de instrucción superior completa.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar más productos en su negocio de venta de medicamentos (botica). Actualmente tiene otra actividad múltiple entre ellos podemos mencionar venta de artefactos, juguetes de todo tipo y también el engorde de ganados.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/3000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es retomar el negocio inicial, es decir trabajar en su botica.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es intercambiar ideas, conversar y bromear.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the San Salvador Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Capachica, Province and Department of Puno. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has four children. Clementina completed her higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ten years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to buy more products for her pharmacy business. Clementina currently has several businesses which include selling appliances and toys of all kinds, as well as fattening cattle.

Now she is requesting a loan for 3000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her business capital. Her dream is to return to her original business of operating a pharmacy. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the exchange of ideas, the conversations, and the ability to joke around.

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Creciendo Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Creciendo” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata. Las socias comentan que es una oportunidad interesante el poder asociarse para recibir servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud. Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios son diversos: agencia de helados, conductor de movilidad, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, artesanía y transporte, artesanía, elaboración de muebles, venta de papa, construcción, costura de polleras.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Victoria es una mujer adulta de 55 años, madre de 2 hijos (a la fecha sólo vive el hijo varón).  Este es su primer ciclo, la señora Victoria comenta que fue invitada por los promotores de la Institución.   Desde hace muchos años trabaja tejiendo chompas, chalinas, lluchus, guantes, polainas y vende su producción a una organización que compra estas prendas.   Ella explica que necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar lana y elaborar los productos ya mencionados.
texts.en:
The Cresciendo communal bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Focal Center. The partners comment that it is an interesting opportunity to become partners to receive credit, training, and health services. It is formed by nine members, eight women and one man. Their business are varied: ice cream shop, cab driver, general store, food sales, crafts and transportation, crafts, furniture making, potatoes sales, construction, traditional "pollera" skirt making.

The president of the communal bank, Victoria, is a 55 year old mother of two children (only one living son). This is her first cycle. She was invited by the promoters of the Institution. She has been working for many years knitting sweaters, ties, caps, gloves, leg warmers and selling to an organization which buys such items of clothing. She explains that she needs the loan to purchase wool to knit the aforementioned items.

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Mulandi

texts.en:
Mulandi is 38 years old and married to Mwikali. They have two school-going children. Mulandi owns a phone accessories shop. He has been running it for 15 years with an income of about Kshs. 3,000 per month. 

This is his fourth loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use the loan to buy a generator and phone accessories. He hopes to be a supplier of phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy a generator and phone accessories

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
With working capital, Minerva’s sewing business will keep on growing and she will be able to offer good service and meet the increasing demand of her regular customer. Through the support of KIVA lenders, Minerva hopes soon to see changes in her family's quality of living and to see them moving forward out from poverty.
 
She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva amounting of 10,000 PHP to purchase fabrics and to support her sewing business.  The capital will fund further expansion of the family venture to support Minerva’s dreams for her children of completing college degrees and having a decent way of life. 

Her long-term goal is to have a tailoring shop a year from now so that she can give opportunity of employment to others. Minerva aims to maintain a sustainable business over the long term.

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabric to maintain her sewing business

loans.name: Philipp

texts.en:
Philipp T. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Philipp is single. To make a living, Philipp owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Philipp is just starting this business.

In 2011, Philipp joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Philipp is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Philipp from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov M., 25, is married and resides with her child in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. M. sells lotus flowers, earning an income of 4 USD per day. Her husband sells lotus flowers for an income of 3.5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 45 USD on food and 35 USD on other necessary expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more lotus flowers to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. M. appears in the middle of the photograph where she is preparing lotus flowers to sell.

loans.use: To buy more lotus flowers to resell

loans.name: Lucy Magaly

texts.es:
Lucy es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad,  reside junto a sus esposo e hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lucy cuenta con un pequeño negocio instalado en el mercado del distrito de Olmos. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Además ofrece la venta de plásticos sandalias y otros artículos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su negocio ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 35-year-old mother of a family who resides with her husband and children in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial area amidst an agricultural zone in the province of Lambayeque, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Lucy operates a small business installed in the district market of Olmos. Here she offers her customers diverse products of daily consumption, including groceries. She also offers plastic sandals and other articles. The business has been well received due to the quality of the products she offers and her good attention to customers. With the income this activity provides she is able to sustain her family.

The recent demand her business has experienced has made her consider expanding it, acquiring more products. For this purpose, Lucy has found it convenient to request a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols, with which she intends to satisfy the demand of he customers.

loans.use: TO ACQUIRE MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Elgrace

texts.en:
Elgrace G. is a 42-year-old women from Villa Fermin Echague village. She is married and has one school-aged child.  Elgrace owns and operates a general store.  Her business' main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elgrace has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elgrace joined Kiva partner, Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan is Elgrace's first from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI):

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nestor Filomeno

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Nestor; El socio tiene 42 años de edad, el socio es soltero; y tiene a pequeño hijo, el socio es odontólogo de profesión y tiene un consultorio dental; el socio tiene sus ahorros y a esto él socio desea aumentar el monto requerido para poder poner un café internet, él ya tiene el local y le falta comprar las máquinas y accesorios y dar para la instalación y cableado. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el café internet que desea poner.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is a partner of the communal bank “Third Millenium." This communal bank is located in the Urubamba district in the department of Cusco.

Señor Nestor is 42 years old and is not married but he has a young son. Nestor is a dentist by profession and he has a dental practice. He has savings that he will add to the amount needed to open an internet cafe. He already has a locaion but he hasn't purchased the computers, accessories or paid for the installation or the wiring. Nestor is seeking a loan to invest in an internet cafe that he wants to establish.

Señor Nestor is happy to be authorized for this loan and he is committed to complete the payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in an internet cafe he wants to establish

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en: Jaqueline is 42 years old.   She has 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 14 years.  She owns and runs a butcher shop.  She is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to slaughter.  She has done this business for 10 years and has been able to her pay her children's school fees and feed her family as well.  In the future, she plans to buy more cattle in order to sell both cattle and beef.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza forma parte del banco comunal “Barrio Alto”, perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando. Ella se dedica a la venta de periódicos, revistas, cuentos, libros, CDs, DVD, confites y bebidas. Desde hace 5 años. En un local que está ubicado al interior de un supermercado, por lo tanto sus horarios se rigen por la disponibilidad horaria de éste, principalmente durante toda la semana de 9ºº  de la mañana hasta las 21ºº horas. En ésta temporada de comienzo de año, sus ventas han sido bajas, sin embargo igual ha obtenido ganancias, que le han permitido organizar sus gastos. Maritza compra su mercadería  usualmente en una distribuidora de confites.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para su local y un vidrio para arreglar la vitrina de su negocio que se encontraba en mal estado. 
Maritza vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 4 años y su suegra. Su esposo es quien le brinda ayuda en la atención y venta de productos de su local. 
Sus metas son poder abrir otra sucursal, que le brinde más ganancias. Para poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar. Sus sueños a nivel personal es optar al subsidio habitacional, para obtener su casa propia. 
Maritza está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le brindan apoyo y ayuda a personas emprendedoras como ella. Respecto a las reuniones del grupo de socios (as), Maritza se siente a gusto, ya que existe unión y una buena convivencia entre ellos. Los talleres de contabilidad le han sido de gran ayuda para organizar los ingresos y gastos de su negocio. 
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Barrio Alto" community bank which is located in the city of San Francisco.  Her business is selling newspapers, magazines, books, CDs, DVDs, candy and soft drinks.  She has been in this business for five years.  Maritza has premises which are located inside a supermarket so her working hours are dictated by those of the supermarket.  She mainly works throughout the week, from 9.00am to 9.00pm.  During this season, at the beginning of the year, her sales have been low.  However, she has still made profits which have enabled her to organize her expenses.  She usually buys her merchandise at a candy wholesalers.

Maritza will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business and a pane of glass to fix her store window as it is in a bad state of repair.  Maritza lives with her husband, her 4 year-old daughter and her mother-in-law.  Her husband helps her to serve and sell products in her business.  Maritza's goal is to open another branch which would make her more profits and enable her family to live more comfortably.  Her dream on a personal level is to apply for a housing subsidy so that she can obtain her own home.

Maritza is very happy and grateful for the loan she has been granted by Fondo Esperanza as they provide support and help to enterprising people such as herself.  As regards the group meetings of her community bank, Maritza feels very much at ease because there is unity and the members all get on well together.  The accounting workshops have been very useful to her in organizing her business incomings and outgoings.

San Fernando is a city which is located in Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, in the central area of Chile.  The city's economic activity is based mainly on agriculture (vineyards; beet, fruit, tobacco and wheat growing; and traditional agriculture), agroindustry (fruit exporting companies, canning companies, dairy companies, etc.) and trade.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines, books, CDs, DVDs, candies, soft drinks and a pane of glass to fix her store window

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn C., 44, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells groceries, earning an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of around $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Pempa

texts.en:
Pempa O. O. is a 41-year-old married father of five children.  He has been a mixed farmer in Narok for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client  in his area.  Pempa is requesting his first loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the returns from the loan both to reinvest in farming and to repay the loan.

An industrious man who will work hard to achieve his goals, Pempa dreams of becoming a famous farmer in his area and enabling his children to attain a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and bags.

loans.name: Syrgajan's Group

texts.en:
Syrgajan, 52, is the leader of this group. She resides in a town called Toktogul with a population of 19,000 people. She has a college-age daughter and a 17-year-old son. Syrgajan’s husband works in a hydroelectric station, while Syrgajan works hard breeding and selling cattle in order to make a living. Her business was started four years ago with the purchase of two heads of cattle for 8,000 soms. Currently her monthly income is 3,000 soms and it helped the family to get a small piece of land and increase the number of cattle they own. The purpose of the requested loan is to purchase more cattle for fattening and reselling. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es natural de Huancayo, tiene 27 años y es madre soltera que vive con su madre y su pequeña hija en casa de un familiar. A lo largo de su vida aprendió a realizar los bordados de fustanes ya que es una actividad muy cotidiana en su zona y desde hace 3 años decidió realizar este trabajo en bordados artesanales. Es así que en su misma casa ha implementado un espacio convirtiéndolo en taller, abasteciéndolo de herramientas, como: caballetes y bastidores. Su jornada empieza generalmente por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a cuidar de su hija. Disfruta de su trabajo porque se considera una persona muy creativa, ya que aplica novedosos diseños y colores para que sus bordados sean atractivos ante sus clientes; además que lo realiza a mano y eso le da un mayor valor agregado a sus trabajo y por ende es mejor pagado. es su primera solicitud de crédito en MFP y fue por medio de la invitación de una amiga que la animó a formar parte  de su grupo solidario. Con este monto de dinero comprará hilos de diversos colores por conos y telas al por mayor de los colores de temporada.
texts.en:
Maribel, 27, is from Huancayo.  She is a single mother living with her mother and small daughter in a relative’s house.  All along her life she’s learned to make the embroidery on “fustanes” (traditional skirts or petticoats) since this is a very commonplace activity in her area.  

Three years ago she decided to work doing this artisanal embroidery.  She has, therefore, set aside space in her house for a workshop that she’s equipped with tools like: sawhorses and embroidery frames.  Her work period is usually in the morning and she spends the afternoon taking care of her daughter.  She enjoys her work because she considers herself a very creative person for she applies novel designs and colors so that her embroidery will be attractive to her customers.  Besides, being done by hand adds value to her work and it’s thus better paid.

This is her first loan request at MFP; a girl friend invited her and encouraged her to become part of a communal bank.  She will use this amount of money to buy cones of thread in assorted colors and fabric in at wholesale in seasonal colors.

loans.use: to buy thread in assorted colors and bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Serigne Mbacke Sokhna

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur est un commercant qui s'approvisionne en gros en cartes téléphoniques qu'il place chez des boutiquiers détaillants. Il est marié et père d'un enfant.Il a toutefois à sa charge ses 2 fréres  et sa mére.
