Il assure  ainsi l'alimentation, , les frais de location, les factres d'eau et d'électricité, les frais de scolarité de son frére et les frais de consultation et d'ordonnance de son épouse qui souffre  d'un sévére ulcére  et qui est obligée de prendre réguliérement des médicaments avant de manger.L'emprunteur exerce le commerce de cartes téléphoniques depuis 7 ans. Son activité est rentable. Il a ainsi bénéficié de deux prets à l'IMCEC qu'il a remboursé sans aucun retard. Il sollicite aujourd'hui un autre pret de 200000f pour renforcer son activité en achetant notamment 10 cartes téléphoniques orange de 2500f, 05 cartes orange de 5000f, 05 cartes oranges de 10000f, 1 paquet de 100 cartes orange de 1000f, 20 cartes tigo de 1000f.
Les bénéfices tirés de la vente de ces produits lui permettront de prendre en charge les dépenses d'alimentation de la famille, le paiement des frais de scolarité de son frére et des factures d'eau et d'électricité. Il pourra aussi soulager les douleurs abdominaux de son épouse dues à son ulcére.
Au dela de son activité, son ambition est de construire une maison pour sa famille mais aussi et surtout d'acheter un taxi dont l'exploitation lui permettra d'aumenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
The borrower is a businessman who buys telephone cards wholesale and then places them with retail shopkeepers. He is married and the father of one child. He is also supporting two brothers and his mother. He covers food, rent, utilities, school fees for his brother and expenses for seeing a doctor and for prescriptions for his wife who has a severe ulcer and is obliged to take medicine regularly before eating. 

The borrower has been buying and selling telephone cards for seven years. His business is profitable. He has been the recipient of two loans from UMCEC which he reimbursed with no delay. He is now requesting another loan of 200,000 francs to expand his business by buying to buy 10 Orange telephone cards for 2500 francs, 5 Orange cards for 5000 francs, 5 Orange cards for 10,000 francs, 1 pack of 100 Orange cards for 1000 francs and 20 Tigo cards for 1000 francs. 

The profit he makes from the sale of these cards will permit him to be responsible for food expenses for the family, as well as paying school fees for his brother and utility bills. He will also be able to soothe the abdominal pain of his wife due to her ulcer. 

Beyond his business, his ambition is to build a house for his family and also and above all, to buy a taxi whose use would permit him to add to his income.

loans.use: to buy telephone use cards, Orange and Tigo, for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells banku (made from corn) at Elmina. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has been selling banku for 10 years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to cook

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis, tiene 32 años D. edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos D. 14 y 10 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia D. los Ríos. 

Los miembros D. la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas D. ciclo corto como siembra D. maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Jorge  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra D. maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los venD. en el mercado mayorista D. Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra D. abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá D. apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis, 32, is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 14 and 10, in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank JESUS NOS AMA is located in the community of Los Amarillos which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This group is involved in growing short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and Gandul beans.

Jorge also grows corn, rice and Gandul beans. He buys his supplies in Agroquímicos El Copa and sells his produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn crop. The loan will help cover his economic needs and improve his farm activities. He is up against challenges such as crop plagues (red ribbon in corn). His dream is to buy a farm one day.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es: Wilfrido, tiene la edad 45 de  años, está casado y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el cultivo ya establecido y lo que quiere es darle una buena asistencia para obtener mejores cosechas este año. El lo que hará específicamente es comprar abono y materiales necesarios para mejorar la calidad del cultivo. El pretende con este crédito realizar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con el proyecto y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wilfrido is 45 years old, married and lives with his 4 children and his wife who are his main priority.  With the loan he intends to buy supplies to care for his coffee plantation. His coffee crop is already established and what he wants to do is to provide good care so that he will obtain a better yield this year. What he will do specifically is to buy fertilizer and other necessary materials to improve the quality of his coffee beans. He hopes with this loan to earn the income needed to get ahead and provide his family with a better quality of life in the future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no other prior loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has more easily extended credit and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to care for his coffee beans.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past five years, he has operated a mobile accessories business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. John faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of incorporating the sale of mobile phones in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase mobile phone batteries, mobile phone cases and chargers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone batteries, mobile phone cases and chargers.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She currently has two cows and one cattle. She has about 15 years of experience in this field. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Slowly her number of cows has increased, and her clients have started asking for more and more. Her monthly profit from cattle selling is 200 USD. 

With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan. So she is asking for 1000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
La señora Lina tiene 53 años, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y uno en edad escolar. Ella se dedica hace 5 años al comercio, cuenta con una casilla en su domicilio donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, yerba, panificados, bebidas y otros.
En cuanto a su clientela dice que tiene muy buena cantidad D. los mismos, ya que esta ubicada frente a una fábrica y la mayoría D. los empleados D. ese lugar siempre acuden a su negocio a comprar D. ella. Se inició con un pequeño capital ya que antes era vendedora ambulante, y gracias a su ahorro y al esfuerzo que imprime en sus negocios pudo salir adelante y tener lo que hoy en día tiene. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por su familia, ya que desea darles lo mejor y que no les falte nada, brindándoles así una vida digna y decorosa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. mercaderías varias, como ser azúcar, yerba, panificados, bebidas y otros con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Lina is 53 years old.  She is married with three children, two of whom are grown, and one is school-age.  For the last five years she has been working in retail.  She has a small stall in her home where she sells everyday items such as sugar, yerba (a traditional vegetable drink), bakery products, drinks and other things.

As regards her customers, she says that she has a good quantity of them, as she is located opposite a factory and the majority of the factory employees come to her business to make purchases.  She started with a small amount of capital, as she was previously a street vendor.  Thanks to her savings and the effort she has put into her business, she has been able to move ahead and get to where she is today.  She comments that everything she has done is for her family, as she wants to give them the best life possible, and for them to lack for nothing.  She wants to proviD. them with a decent and dignified life.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of various merchandise, such as sugar, yerba, bakery items, drinks, and other things with which she can stock up and meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, yerba (a traditional vegetable drink), bakery products, drinks and other things to stock up her premises.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Doña Angelina tiene 36 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos que dependen de ella y 4 de ellos estudian la secundaria y la primaria. Angelina vende frutas y legumbres en el mercado de su población desde hace 4 años, y dice que emprendió el negocio por que con lo que le daba su esposo no le alcanzaba para mantener a sus hijos, entonces ella un día que no tenia para darle de comer a sus hijos fue a cortar nopales y chiles manzanos que tenia en su casa y salio al mercado y si vendió todo y desde ahí dijo “si me deja buenas ganancias el vender la verdura” y decidió ir a diario al mercado a vender en su cubetita. Platica que todos los días va a la central de abastos a comprar la verdura fresca y después como a las 3 de la tarde se regresa a su casa a atender a sus hijos y esposo. Doña Angelina esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que tanto le gusta, la meta que tiene es poner un puesto afuera de su casa por las tardes para seguir vendiendo sus legumbres y la fruta de temporada.
texts.en:
Angelina is 36, and has five children who depend on her. Four of them are in high school and primary school. Angelina has been selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her town for four years. 

She says that she started her business because what her husband gave her wasn't enough to support her children. Then one day when she didn't have anything to give her children to eat, she cut pads of nopal cactus, and manzano chiles that she had by her house, went to the market, and sold everything.  At that point she said to herself, "Yes, I can make good money selling vegetables", and decided to go to the market every day to sell from her little stand.

She says that every day she goes to the central produce terminal to buy fresh vegetables,  and afterwards, at about 3:00pm she returns home to attend to her children and husband.  Angelina is asking for a loan in oder to continue investing in her business that she likes so much. Her goal is so set up a stand outside her house to keep selling her vegetables, and fruit in season.

loans.use: To sell fruits and vegetables in the street.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 46-year-old enterprising business lady. She is married to Stephen who is a policeman in Kenya. Beatrice has been a tailor for the past ten years with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy materials thus offering a variety for her customers to choose from. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 38-year-old woman, married with three children aged between 3 and 18 years old. She is a hard-working farmer. She lives in Hoima in Western Uganda in her own house built out of her hard work as a farmer. For 10 years now, Daisy has been involved in farming both at subsistence and commercial levels. She started the agriculture business with one acre of land but now has 5 acres of farmland. She has high hopes for the future since she believes her farm will continue to improve. She is requesting for a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and also pay costs for labor working on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy improved seeds for planting, fertilizers, and pay for labor costs for her farmland.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a single woman, aged 43. She is blessed with one child, who is in school. For the last four years, she has been running a printing business to make a living. She is also employed elsewhere. Martha has employed one person to assist in her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy stationery. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stationery.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad, Marcelina tiene una hija de 6 años. Convive hace 7 años con Raydo, quien por trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima. Marcelina y Leidy (su hija) viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. Marcelina, a pesar de su edad se dedica a la agricultura. Actividad que le inculcaron sus padres. Por su parte, ella cuenta con 3 cuadras de terrenos en los que siembra café y plátanos. “El café es rentable, pero su cosecha es una sola vez por año, en cambio, el plátano produce cada 15 días y en esos días gano de 300 a 400 soles”, cuenta. El problema más recurrente que enfrenta, es la falta de capital para abonar sus tierras. Cada 4 meses esparce el fertilizante invirtiendo no menos de 700 soles. Situación que ha sabido sobrellevar. Raydo, su pareja, no descuida a su familia, ya que cada fin de mes viaja a Chanchamayo con capital obtenido de su trabajo en un taller mecánico. Más adelante, Marcelina abrirá una pequeña bodega en su comunidad, en donde expenderá productos de primera necesidad. De esa manera podrá tener el dinero necesario para brindarle a su hija una calidad de vida que ella y su pareja no tuvieron. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Por otra parte muestra alegría por el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, por los incentivos y la oportunidad de desarrollo que el brinda. La temporada de siembra y cosecha para los meses de diciembre y enero serán prometedoras, así que, Marcelina invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de bolsas de abonos. Calcula que gastará 1400 en promedio.
texts.en: Twenty-one-year-old Marcelina has a 6-year-old daughter. She has been in a domestic partnership for the last 7 years with Raydo, who is currently living in the city of Lima because of his job. Marcelina and Leidy (her daughter) live in the house that Marcelina owns in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, Chanchamayo. Despite her young age, Marcelina works in agriculture, which she learned from her parents. She has 3 blocks of crop fields on which she cultivates coffee and bananas. "Coffee is lucrative, but it is harvested only once a year. Banana trees, on the other hand, produce every 15 days, and on those days I make 300 to 400 PEN," she states. The most frequent problem she faces is the lack of capital to fertilize her crops. She fertilizes her fields every 4 months, investing no less than 700 PEN, which is something that she has managed to bear. Raydo, her partner, does not neglect his family since he travels to Chanchamayo at the end of each month with the money that he makes at an auto shop. In the future, Marcelina will open a small general store in her community in which she will sell basic need items. Thus, she will be able to have the money she needs to give her daughter a quality of life that neither she nor her partner ever had.  This will be her fifth loan from MFP, which is why she is committed to being punctual in making her monthly repayments. Additionally, she demonstrates joy working with her communal bank because of the incentives and the business opportunities that it gives her. The planting and harvesting season during the months of December and January seem promising, so Marcelina will invest the loan in purchasing bags of fertilizer. She calculates that she will spend an average of about 1,400.00 PEN.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam, 36, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Nam is a housewife, and her husband is a construction worker. Nam is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, 35, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling chapati (flat bread) door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking-fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking-fat oil.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis has been practicing farming for the last 15 years. She is 48 years old and married to Bethwell, with whom she has four children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by another client. She paid her previous loan well and without any difficulties. She has currently applied for another loan that she plans to use to prepare land and buy seeds for planting.

She hopes to use the profits from her farm to buy an extra piece of land for farming as she is hoping to be involved in large-scale farming.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.ru: Тулганой 53 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж пенсионер, также как и она.  Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 года. Опыт в откорме скота более 20 лет. Её сыновья и дочь находятся  в Казахстане на заработках. Раньше ее муж работал  на заводе их кишлака, и мог прокармливать всю семью. После распада СССР ни осталось ни одного действующего предприятия , который бы мог обеспечивать их небольшое населения в горном регионе. И основным их источником  доходом  является купля продажа скота и денежные переводы с России или Казахстана. Не надеясь на помощь детей Тулганой  с мужем упорно разводят скот, что бы иметь постоянный доход. На новый кредит Тулганой собирается купить коз и овец.
texts.en: Tulganoi is 53 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is a retiree just as she is.  She has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009.  Tulganoi has 20 years of experience in fattening up livestock.  Her sons and daughter are in Kazakhstan for work.  Previously, her husband worked at their village factory and was able to provide for the family.  After the breakup of the USSR, no functioning factory that could support their small population in the mountainous region remained open.  Their primary source of income is buying and selling livestock and monetary transfers from Russia or Kazakhstan.  Not relying on the children's help, Tulganoi and her husband breed livestock in order to have a regular income.  Tulganoi plans to use this loan to purchase goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Lorena has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married and has 3 children.
4 years ago she started her business. She enjoys cooking our national tasty dishes such as dolma, ash, khingal, kabab  etc.
All in her region praise her dishes.In addition to our national dishes, she cooks the dishes of other nationalities.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy kitchen appliances.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Adolphine Yeze

texts.en: Adolphine is 53 years old and married. She has been involved since 1995 in selling women’s clothing and soft drinks. Between 2004 and 2007 she borrowed seven loans from IMF Hope (a Microfinance Institution in DRCongo) for business expansion. Now she applies for $1,000 to buy more women’s clothing and crates of beverages to meet the clients’ high demand in her community. Adolphine wants to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothing and crates of beverages in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Business Description

Agripina started her business using a little money she had been able to save, and she dedicated herself to the sale of fast food and fruit. On the weekends her daughters help her attend to the business. She has been able to maintain her clientele thanks to the high quality of the products she offers.

Loan Use

Agripina wants this loan to buy accessories and improve her location, in order to offer better service to her customers.

Personal Information

Agripina is 50 years old, and her husband is a clothing vendor. They have 4 daughters who live on their own. Her home is of mixed construction (part concrete, part cane). She only completed the first grade in school, so she has not been able to have the best work opportunites. That's why she started her own business. Due to insufficient capital, she has not been able to make these improvements in her location.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Agripina Inicio su negocio con un poco de dinero que pudo ahorrarse dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y frutas. En los fines de semana sus hijas le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Su clientela se ha logrado mantener gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que Agripina ofrece en su negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Agripina desea el crédito para comprar accesorios y adecuar el local para brindar una mejor atención a los clientes de su negocio

Información Personal

Agripina tiene50 años su esposo es vendedor de ropa. Tienen 4 hijas que viven de manera independiente. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta .Por contar solo con el nivel primario de educación. No ha podido tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo .Razón por la cual se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio. Por no contar con suficiente capital no ha pedido hacer mejoras en su local.

loans.use: To buy accessories and improve her location

loans.name: Lucía

texts.en:
Lucia holds the office of association secretary with Pro Mujer. She has been with this organization for 10 years. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she also sells accessories, such as purses and backpacks, which she makes herself. She has had this business for 5 years. Initially she made these items in small quantities, but even after investing in more materials and supplies, her sales still didn't generate enough income.

Lucia is requesting this loan to allow her to continue expanding her business and add a book shop at the same location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia P. Quispe Ella es secretaria de actas de la asociación Escuelitas 2 de Pro Mujer, además cuenta una antigüedad de 10 años en la organización. A la fecha es dueña de una tienda de víveres, donde también vende accesorios de vestir, como ser carteras mochilas y otros que ella misma confecciona, ambas actividades las desarrolla hace mas de 5 años. En principio Lucia confeccionaba en poca cantidad, lo que la llevó a invertir en material e insumos, pero aún esto no generaba los ingresos suficientes. En la actualidad Lucia ya es dueña de un almacén y precisa de mayor capital para poder ampliar su negocio y lograr la apertura de una librería.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas works as a salaried chauffeur for a private family: he also works as a waiter. He lives with his younger sixteen-year old brother: their house is located in the Villa Ingenio Zone in the town of El Alto.

The loan is needed to purchase a kiosk which will be use to sell street-food (french-fries, hamburgers and hot dogs). This is a new activity that Nicholas wants to embark on and thus be able to gain independence and begin his own business. Thanks to El Alto’s characteristics, street-food businesses offer good results: given the rising population in El Alto, the town now has close to a million inhabitants.

This is his second loan with Impro: the first loan was arranged in February of this year and has been completely paid back, the last payment being received in September. This prompt payment allowed the approval of this second loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nicolás trabaja como chofer asalariado para una familia particular, también trabaja como garzón, vive con su hermano menor de 16 años; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un kiosco que será utilizado para la venta de comida al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas y hot dogs). Esta es una nueva actividad que Nicolas desea emprender y así poder independizarse y comenzar su propio negocio. Dadas las características de la ciudad de El Alto, los negocios de comida al paso dan buenos resultados debido al ritmo de crecimiento demográfico de El Alto, la ciudad cuenta con casi un millón de habitantes.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Febrero de este año y fue pagado en su totalidad siendo su último pago en el mes de Septiembre. El buen comportamiento de pago permite que se apruebe este segundo préstamo.

loans.use: Kiosk purchase

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón is 36 years old and married to Mirta Pereira, 29, and together they have two children, who go to school and also help the family business by preparing and selling salted sandwiches and desserts for parties.

Ramón runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like milk, sugar, noodles, fruits and vegetables. He's been doing this for a little more than a year. Previously he worked at a shoe store, but he wasn't earning enough income so he decided to open his convenience store.

Ramón says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings, and now he's planning on selling larger quantities of all kinds of drinks like soft drinks, juices and beer, since summer is approaching and demand for cold drinks will rise considerably. The loan he's requesting well help him meet this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ramón F., tiene 36 años, es casado, su señora se llama Mirta Pereira de 29 años de edad, tienen 2 hijas, van al colegio y además ayudan con los ingresos familiares preparando y vendiendo bocaditos salados y dulces para fiestas.

El Sr. Ramón, administra el negocio familiar, que es una despensa, donde comercializan todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, fideos, frutas, verduras, etc. de esto hace un poco más de un año, ya que antes se dedicaba a la zapatería, pero como no dejaba buenas ganancias decidieron abrir una despensa.

Ramón nos cuenta que les va muy bien, el negocio genera buenas ganancias, y ahora tiene pensado adquirir en grandes cantidades bebidas de todo tipo como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, etc. ya que estamos en temporada de mucho calor y la demanda de bebidas frías aumenta considerablemente. El préstamo solicitado será utilizado para dicho fin.

loans.use: Purchase drinks like soft drinks, juices, mineral water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana is a happy woman in spite of suffering through her husband’s abandonment. With her small son in her arms, she found a way to move forward, thanks to the support of her friends and family, who knew how to help her in that difficult period of her life. She began a business making the fruit crates that farmers use to protect their goods. Her high-spirited happiness was contagious, and her neighbors quickly became her most constant customers; she serves them tirelessly, and knows she’ll always be able to count on them. Even with these innumerable excellent people, she wishes to expand her business and become a fruit producer herself, selling the fruit for herself. She is counting on you participating in her dreams through this loan, and is sure of receiving your support to get this project started so that she can forge a promising future for her little one, being sure above all that he gets a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Juana, es una alegre mujer que a pesar del abandono que sufrió por parte de su esposo y después de haberse quedado con su hijo pequeño en brazos tuvo que salir adelante; gracias al apoyo de sus amigos y familiares, quienes supieron ayudarla en esta dura etapa de su vida. Empezó un negocio de producción de cajones de frutas que los agricultores utilizan para guardar sus productos, su animosidad y alegría han contagiado a sus vecinos los cuales se volvieron en sus más asiduos clientes con los cuales puede contar siempre y trata de servir incansablemente.A pesar de contar con un sin número de buenas personas desea incrementar su negocio, siendo ella misma una productora de frutas y así comercializarlos por su propia cuenta; confía en que usted será participe de sus anhelos a través de un préstamo y está segura de recibir vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha su proyecto a fin de forjar un futuro prometedor para su pequeño y sobretodo ayudarlo a tener una muy buena educación.

loans.use: To quickly become an excellent fruit seller, using her existing fruit crate business.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis is married and has a 19 year old daughter in his care. Luis is a tailor and his wife is a dressmaker. They have a small tailor shop located in their home in the 14 de Septiembre area in Managua. Luis and his wife do work for their neighbors and also they visit businesses to offer their services for contractual work.

Luis has been in this business for many years and thanks to his good service and fine tailoring, he has earned many clients. The loan will help him aquire an electric sewing machine to be able to offer more and better products to his clients. Thanks to this business, Luis can continue to get ahead and support his family with everything that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis es casado, y tiene una hija a su cargo de 19 años. Don Luis es sastre y su esposa es modista, y los dos tienen un pequeño taller de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación en la 14 de Septiembre. Trabajan para los vecinos cercanos a la zona donde habitan, y tambien ellos mismas visitan algunas empresas para ofertar sus servicios y hacer contratos. Desde varios años atrás tiene este negocio y gracias a su servicio y costura fina ha ganado muchos clientes. El préstamo le ayudará para adquirir una máquina de coser eléctrica para poder ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes. Gracias a este negocio don Luis puede salir adelante y apoyar a su familia en todo lo que necesiten.

loans.use: Purchase electric sewing machine

loans.name: Irene Adakou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Irène Adakou A. was born in Lomé on February 7, 1965. She is single but is the breadwinner for 4 other persons. Her business is selling fried yams. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to stock a bigger quantity of yams and oil so that she can better satisfy the need of her customers and increase her income. Her dynamic personality and cleverness make her very likely to succeed in this business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Adakou Irène est née à Lomé, le 07 Février 1965. Célibataire, elle a en charge quatre (4) personnes. Son activité est basée sur la vente de frite d’igname. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui servir de s’approvisionner en grande quantité d’ignames et d’huile pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus. Le dynamise et habileté de cette dame constituent autant d’atouts pour le succès de ce projet.

loans.use:
Stocking yams and cooking oil

Stockage d'ignames et d'huile

loans.name: Kudzovi Agbessi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kudzovi Agbessi A. was born on May 28, 1979 in Agou Gadjagan a village located 110km from Lomé. He is married and has three children. His main activities are publishing and the sale of books. Meanwhile, he also provides photocopies and word processing. His business, named NETO Sarl, is located in the neighborhood of Bè-Kpéhénou in Lomé. This first loan in the amount of 300.000FCFA should allow him to acquire a new copying machine in order to replace the old one that broke down 2 weeks ago.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kudzovi Agbessi est née le 28 mai 1979 à Agou Gadjagan localité située à 110 km de Lomé. Il est marié et a trois enfants. Son activité principale est l’édition et la vente des livres. Cependant, il fait également la photocopie, le traitement de texte. Il a dénommé son entreprise NETO Sarl située au quartier Bè-Kpéhénou à Lomé. Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA devait lui permettre d’acquérir un nouveau copieur pour remplacer l’ancien qui est tombé en panne depuis deux semaines.

loans.use: Purchase of a new copying machine

loans.name: Teddy's Chapakazi A Group

texts.en:
Teddy, age 29, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 4). She has a shop where she sells clothes, which she began 1 year ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $99 from this business.

Teddy has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothing for her shop. Teddy will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell general items, fruits, and vegetables.

In the picture, Teddy is standing second from the left.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products for her small beauty salon

loans.name: Mablé

texts.fr:
Ms. Mablé D. was born in Lomé on September 12, 1973. Married to Mr. Afantchao AGBOSSON, she has three children who go to school. Since 1998, her commerce has been in pagne (traditional print cloth), shoes, and bags in the Agoè district in the north of Lomé. Sometimes she sells her merchandise from district to district as a traveling saleswoman. She is a good entrepreneur who is on her sixth loan and who makes good on her payments. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 20 bolts of pagnes, 2 boxes of shoes, and 15 tote bags.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Mablé est née à Lomé le 12 septembre 1973. Mariée à monsieur AGBOSSON Afantchao elle à 03 enfants qui vont à l’école. Depuis 1998, elle exerce le commerce de pagne, de chaussures et de sac dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Parfois elle vend ses marchandises de quartier en quartier et donc ambulante. Elle est un bon entrepreneur qui est à son 6ème prêt et rembourse bien. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 pièces de pagne, 2 cartons d chaussures et 15 sacs de sortie.

loans.use: To buy pagnes, shoes, and tote bags

loans.name: Mamso Sheiko's Group

texts.en:
This group of soldiers is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000. Their names are: Mamso T., Mamu S., Ibrahim B. M., Abdul Karim K. and Michael S.. They want a loan to give to their wives to add to their current businesses. This is a great help to the soldiers as many of them had wanted to expand their wives' businesses but lacked the required amount of money to enable them do so. They will repay their loans out of their monthly salaries.

Mamso is the group leader. He is 36 and was born in Kambiya, a town bordering neighboring Guinea. He is married with 4 children. Manso will give his loan to his wife who currently sells rice, cassava, and potatoes. She has been in this business for 3 years.

loans.use: Give to their wives to expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase spare parts for an automobile repair shop.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary level four. Christiana sells cassava dough, maize, and other food items at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Christiana uses her income to pay for feeding the family and utility bills. Christiana will use the loan to add to her capital to buy more cassava to use to make the dough and more maize for sale. With the new profits, Christiana plans to save towards the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize for re-sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos.  Desde hace 25 años se viene dedicando a la venta de lechones, es decir, carne de cerdo asada al horno, su trabajo consiste en comprar cerdos de la feria ganadera, la carne la sazona para  enviarla al hornos, los recoge y los lleva a las ferias comerciales, fiestas patronales, etc.,  en las cuales tiene la oportunidad de vender, empezó a dedicarse a esta tarea gracias a los ánimos que le dio su cuñada, refiriendo que era un trabajo rentable, con el tiempo adquirió un puesto ubicado en el mercado principal de Huancayo. Para Carmen es una gran satisfacción  poder emprender su propio negocio, le permite  solventar a su familia.  Realiza todos estos esfuerzos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y seguir superándose, ella desea formar una pequeña empresa en la venta de lechones.  Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más cerdos y condimentos, así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 46-years old and lives with her husband and 7 children. For the past 25-years, she has dedicated herself to the sales of pigs! That is to say, she prepares oven pork roasts. Her job consists of: purchasing the pigs from livestock auctions, seasoning the beef for the ovens, preparing the portions and delivering them to the trade fairs, patron festivals, and etcs… Given the opportunity to make sales, she is dedicated to this task with the encouragement of her sister-in-law, who suggested this profitable work. Carmen’s business is now in a prime location within the main marketplace in Huancayo. Carmen takes great satisfaction in the undertaking of this business, as it has helped her provide for her family. She does all this to ensure that her children continue with their education and that they succeed. Carmen desire to start a small business selling pig roasts and she asks for this loan to be able to buy more livestock, condiments so as to be more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and supplies for the preparation of pig roasts to sell

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Huayna Cápac Nº. 198, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 3 que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, refrescos, aguajes, los cuales le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 docenas de blusas, 3 docenas de pantalón, 2 docenas de zapatos, 2 sacos de aguajes y otros. 

Lili agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada y a Dios por todas las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Lili is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, located in the Jr. Huayna Cápac Nº. 198 disctrict of Manantay, in the province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and a single mother of 6 children, 3 who are grown and 3 who still depend on her. With her first loan of of 300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling candy. She has been working with the Banco Comunal for four years. Currently she sells clothing, shoes, soft drinks, and aguajes (a Peruvian fruit), which earns her the profits she needs to make her loan payments on time.

With this loan of $1000 nuevo soles (US $325), which will be paid in five months, she will buy 2 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen pairs of shoes, and 2 bags of aguajes and other fruit. Lili thanks Manuela Ramos for the help it has given her, and God for all the good things she has experienced in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth and her husband Richard have one daughter, Andrea Lhei, who is 3 years old. They live in the rural area of Brgy. Minallo  Naguillan, Isabela.  Their house is at the top of the hill where they are blessed with rich soil for growing rice and corn products which are their major source of income.  Bernadeth is also raises pigs in their backyard, and Richard does carpentry work.

Bernadeth strives hard to help her carpenter husband in supporting their family's needs. Though they work very hard, their income is limited. She is requesting a loan so her can open her own small sari-sari store (a community variety store). This will increase the family's earnings so they can better their living conditions.

At present, they live with her mother-in-law, but Bernadeth dreams of earning enough money for a house of their own. “I put God first in everything I do so that my daily business routine will be blessed”, says Bernadeth.

loans.use: To open a small variety store to create additional income

loans.name: Soli

texts.en: Soli L., 59, is married with six children.  She doesn't have much experience in the ice cake and salad business. She sells to the village people and public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, so this will be her first loan.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 60 Tala.  SPBD loans are Soli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator to cool the ice-cake

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosbelly

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet, que esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además vende accesorios de celulares, servicio de locutorio, fotocopias, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 personal.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de computadora.
Elizabeth sueña con tener una tienda de accesorios de computadoras y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Elizabeth is single, she is 26 years old and she lives with her parents. Elizabeth owns internet booths located on a main street in the city of Ayacucho, and in addition she sells cellphone accessories, provides telephone and photocopy services, a business she has been running with the help of one employee.

Elizabeth requires a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of computer accessories.

Elizabeth dreams of having a store to sell computer accessories, and to have a second location.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. M., 44, has been running a medium-sized store out of her home for a long time, selling different kinds of groceries such as cooked ingredients and canned food. She normally sells her items to villagers, and is currently earning approximately US$ 3 per day. She is married to Mr. Chem, 35, who is a domestic building worker, and who also helps her in selling groceries.

M. is a mother who has three children; two of them are married and the other one is single and attends school. M. has applied for a US$ 1000 loan to purchase more grocery inventory for sale. The family lives in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith S. is a rice farmer. She owns a 2-hectare lot which she inherited from her parents. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. Her husband, Felipe S., is also a farmer. They grow vegetables aside from rice to support their needs. They have been tilling their land for 15 years. Her harvest is intended for their family's use. Sometimes they sell their harvest for additional income for their family.

She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy for fertilizers and chemicals to increase her yield. The loan will truly help Judith to have a better harvest from her farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start businesses. They are provided with credit, training and insurance coverage to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace medio años se dedica a la venta de comida hecha a base de cerdo, debido a un traspaso comercial, su establecimiento se ubica cerca de una universidad, en el comienzo de su negocio era un riesgo para Nora, pero ha visto que su negocio se ha ido incrementando por la calidad de la comida que prepara y ofrece al atardecer hasta altas horas de la noche. Para ella cocinar es una distracción, disfruta de hacerlo, y ahora más que nunca porque le genera buenos recursos económicos, necesarios para su familia. Además, la comida que actualmente vende tiene mayor demanda entre los universitarios que acuden a consumir sus platillos. Para más adelante, Nora quiere complementar su establecimiento con la venta de jugos y también ofrecer menús durante el medio día para el almuerzo. Es la cuarta vez que Nora tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas más colaboradoras de su banco comunal, siempre está en búsqueda de nuevas mejoras para su grupo. La cantidad que ahora solicita es para mejorar la decoración y ambientación de su local, está decidida a comprar nueva vajilla que mejore la presentación de sus comidas. Y con una parte (110 soles) comprará útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a rented house. For about six months, she has been dedicated to selling food made from pork. Due to a commercial exchange, her establishment is located close to a university. Starting a business was a risk for Nora but she has seen that her business is growing due to the quality of the food that she prepares and offers from afternoon until the late hours of the night. For her, cooking is a distraction which she enjoys doing and now, more than ever, since it generates good income, it is necessary for her family. In addition, the food that she currently sells is generating greater demand among the university students who come to consume her dishes. For the future, Nora wishes to complement her business by selling juices and also to offer service during the middle of the day, for lunch. This is the fourth time that Nora has taken a loan with MFP. She one of the most collaborative people in her community bank. She is always on the lookout for new improvements for her group. The amount that she is now requesting is to improve the decoration and atmosphere of her cafe. She has decided to purchase new tableware to improve the presentation of her food. And a part (110 soles) will go towards buying school supplies for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better atmosphere for her cafe.

loans.name: Lisala Plus Group

texts.fr: Kiki N. est esthéticienne de formation. Elle habite dans un quartier au centre de Kinshasa où elle exerce ses activités commerciales depuis 1995.  Sa première activité de 1995 -1999 fut le restaurant qu’elle ouvrit avec un capital initial de $150 qui se transforma en salon de coiffure en 1999 suite à son état de santé. Le salon de coiffure a bien évolué de 1999-2003 suite à sa spécialité. De 2003 jusqu’à ce jour, Kiki a diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant l’habillement dame dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Elle vend des pagnes, des chaussures dames, robes, etc… Dans le souci de réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un jour un magasin d’habillement importé mixte, Kiki a décidé d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope dénommé « Lisala » en juillet 2008. Elle y a obtenu deux fois le crédit qu’elle a remboursé régulièrement et totalement. Le crédit qu’elle a reçu ce mois d’avril lui a permis d’acheter des pagnes et des chaussures dames en vue de renforcer de son affaire. Actuellement, son capital est de $400. Son activité génère un bénéfice de $60 par semaine. Kiki a 44 ans d’âge, célibataire et mère d’une fille âgée de 16 ans qui est élève.
texts.en:
Kiki N. was trained as an esthetician. She lives in a central neighbourhood of Kinshasa where she has been in business since 1995. Her first business, from 1995 to 1999, was a restaurant which she opened with $150 in startup capital. This business became a beauty salon in 1999 because of her health. The beauty salon did well between 1999 and 2003 because of her speciality. Since 2003, Kiki has diversified her business: she has added women's clothing in order to increase her income. She sells "pagnes" (colourful cloth worn by women and wrapped like a sarong), dresses and so on. In order to reach her goal o fopening a boutique selling imported clothing for men and women, Kiki decided in July 2008 to join one of the groups, "Lisala", of the MFI Hope. She has already received two loans which were repaid on time and in full. The loan which she received in April allowed her to buy "pagnes" and ladies' shoes in order to bolster her business. Currently, her capital is $400. Her business generates a profit of $60 a week. Kiki is 44 years old, single, and the mother of a 16-year-old girl who attends school.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and ladies' shoes to bolster her business

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходуру 32 года, женат и имеет 3 детей. Работает на заводе по производству строительных материалов. Работа постоянная и занят на ней Баходур почти всю неделю. Заработную плату получает вовремя. Но семья растет, и чтобы покрыть все растущие потребности Баходур открыл у себя дома маленький магазинчик по продаже продуктов питания. В качестве продавца работает его жена и мать. Баходур привозит товар один раз в неделю с оптового рынка и в течении недели у местных оптовиков. Баходур планирует приобрести оптовую партию товара и поэтому нуждается в дополнительном финансировании. Также он собирается приобрести морозильник для продажи мороженного и поэтому подал заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Bahodur is 32 years old; he is married and has 3 children. He works at a factory that makes construction materials. The job is permanent and Bahodur is busy at it for almost the entire week. He receives his salary on time. But the family is growing and in order to cover growing needs Bahodur opened a small store in his home to sell food products. His wife and mother work as sellers. Bahodur brings products in once a week from the wholesale market and during the week from local wholesalers. Bahodur plans to get a wholesale quantity of products and needs additional financing. Also he plans to purchase a freezer to sell ice cream and this is why he applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and a freezer

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Kweku A. is married and has four dependents. Kweku did not receive any formal education. He has sold fresh fish and variety of soft drinks in Elmina since 1994. His wife is a petty trader. Kweku uses his income to paying for utilities, such as water and electricity.

Kweku will use this loan to purchase fish in large quantity for resale and also to increase his stock of soft drinks for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kweku plans to save to buy a truck.

loans.use: To purchase fish in large quantity and increase his stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying animals for his land

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.en:
Lastenia G. L. has her own small shop where she sells cold drinks and also runs a taxi transportation service together with her husband. Lastenia has many goals for her drink-selling business--she wants to eventually purchase a larger refrigerator and refurbish her business locale in order to begin selling groceries as well. She also hopes to purchase additional cars for the transportation enterprise she shares with her husband.

Lastenia has two children, one of whom (an 18-year-old son currently studying at a local university) is still dependent on her. She is also raising her 6-year-old niece.

Lastenia is a member, and the official treasurer, of the communal bank Manos Maravillosas (Marvelous Hands) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Lastenia has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2.5 years and used her first loan to start her drink-selling business. Lastenia will invest this loan of 1700 nuevos soles in more inventory for her business. Lastenia is thankful for the support she has received from Manuela Ramos and is very pleased that things have been going well with her business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton S., 49, is a married mother blessed with six children. Two of her children are construction workers and the others sew clothes in the garment industry. Ton's husband is a domestic construction foreman in the village. Since early 2003, Ton has been selling a few produce items to her neighbors from her store in front of her home. She works very hard in order to sustain her business growth. Ton says that her business is running well but she needs the capital facility to upgrade her inventory. She is seeking a loan to accumulate a large quantity of grocery to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a large quantity of grocery to sell

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is a 28-year-old, newly married man who operates his business selling bags in Muthurwa market in Nairobi. He is requesting a third loan of Ksh. 80,000 after successfully repaying two other loans of Ksh. 20,000 and 40,000 to add to his stock of bags. He hopes that one day he will buy both a place to use as business premises and also a home in Nairobi. He describes himself as hard-working, patient, polite, and GOD fearing.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of bags

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente d'oigons à des gens venant du Ghana le pays voisin; elle vend aussi les jours de marchés à Adidogomé, à Lomé et dans sa maison. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2002 et est très connue dans son milieu. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 50 sacs d'oignons. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant; ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge

loans.use: Achat d'oigons

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta P. Vda. D. N., resiD. en Colon en el departamento La Libertad.  Marta tiene 66 años D. edad y por razones desafortunadas D. la vida, quedó viuda hace unos cuantos años. La vida como viuda no ha sido fácil, pero la compañía D. su hijo mayor ha sido D. gran ayuda. Juntos, manejan un negocio venta D. leña y piñatas fabricadas por ella. Ambos solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima y llevar su negocio un paso adelante.
texts.en:
Marta P. Vda. D. N. lives in Colon in the department of La Libertad. Marta is 66 years old and for unfortunate reasons, she has been a widow for some years. Her life as a widow has not been easy, but the company of her oldest son has been a great help. Together, they manage a business that sells firewood and piñatas maD. by her. They are both requesting a loan to buy new raw materials and take their business a step forward.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her piñatas

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is a rice farmer. She owns and tills a one-hectare farm from which she hopes to provide her family with enough income to buy food and meet the costs of daily living. Erlinda's parents are farmers and she learned her farming skills from them.

Now, Erlinda needs additional capital to continue to sustain the family livelihood. She would like to request a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to fund her farm by buying the farming supplies she needs to grow her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is engaged in rice farming business. He is married to Ma. Elena who is working as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW).  They have two children: Dhaphni, a 13-year old high school student and Hyacinth, 12-year old high school student.

Vicente and Ma. Elena hopes that they could continue to support the schooling of their children. He said that he needs to develop his farming business. He said that his income is not enough so he is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP15,000. This will be used to purchase farm inputs and other necessary farming needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice farming business

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda es una madre D. familia D. 53 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, uno D. los cuales es especial, en el distrito D. Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria D. una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado usado en el transporte D. carga y pasajeros) por la cual percibe un ingreso económico que le ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo sufrió un accidente en su lugar D. trabajo y quedó inválido D. una pierna. 

La mototaxi es trabajada todo el día por uno D. sus hijos. El contínuo uso D. su vehículo ha hecho que experimente fallas mecánicas que requieren urgente reparación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es reunir el dinero suficiente para adquirir otra mototaxi, para obtener más ingresos económicos que sustenten a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y que siempre está al pendiente D. los suyos.
texts.en:
Arminda is a 53 year old mother who lives with her husband and 4 children in the District of Cayaltí, located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She owns a motorcycle taxi (used for transporting cargo and passengers). The income she receives is used to cover her household expenses since her husband suffered an accident at work and lost the use of one of his legs.

One of her children operates the motorcycle taxi for the entire day. The continued use of the vehicle has resulted in mechanical failures that require urgent repairs. Due to this need, Arminda requested her first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to raise enough money to purchase another motorcycle taxi so that she can generate more income to maintain her family. She is a very responsible woman who is always thoughtful of others.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair & maintenance of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 30 years old and married with two children. She sells used clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits. The demand for her used clothes is high by those in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Carlota Antonio

texts.pt:
Carlota C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 14 anos de idade, todos ainda vão a escola. Fez 5ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e ainda sustenta 1 neta e irmã que vivem com ela.

Saiu do bairro de Maxaquene com a sua família para o Distrito de Boane ainda muito jovem, onde vive ate hoje. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos conta com uma empregada e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende roupa usada especialmente lençóis tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada) para aumentar a quantidade da mercadoria de forma a satisfazer a demanda dos seus clientes. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 11.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para abrir uma nova banca de venda de brinquedos para crianças.
texts.en:
Carlota C. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of Maputo. She is 37 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children, ages 17 and 14. Both of her children still attend school. Carlota completed 5th grade but did not continue her studies due to a lack of resources. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her granddaughter and her sister who lives with her. She left the Maxaquene neighborhood with her family to move to Boane District when she was very young, and she still lives there today. She has had her own business for the past 20 years. She has one employee and works about 10 hour per day. She sells used clothing, especially linens and sheets. She earns about 5.500.00mt per month which pays for her household expenses and allows her to save some money in her bank account. She has never had loans with other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through friends that are also loan clients. This is her 3rd loan, for the amount of 20.000.00mt that she will use to buy products (used clothing in bulk) to increase her merchandise and satisfy her clients. Her previous loans were for 6.000.00mt and 11.000.00mt and were used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to open a second store for children’s toys.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: used clothing for resale

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Khadidiatou  B. habite dans la localité de Camberene. C’est une femme mariée  de 39 ans qui n’a jamais bénéficié  de crédit  a l’U-IMCEC ou elle est sociétaire  depuis juin 2009.Elle est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle a depuis 20 ans exerce l’activité  de commerce particulièrement  la vente de tissus et prêt a porter. C’est une activité  qu’elle a aime depuis son enfance et elle lui permet aussi de gagner sa vie. Elle emprunte 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandise pour faire face a la demande croissante et diversifiée  de sa clientèle.
Madame B. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou Baro lives in Camberene [by Dakar]. She is a 39- year old married woman who has never yet received credit from U-IMCEC since joining it in June 2009. She is married and mother of three children. For twenty years, she has been engaged in commerce, particularly in selling fabrics and ready-to-wear clothes. This is an activity which she has lliked since childhood and which allows her to support herself. She is borrowing 150,000 francs [about 350 USD] in order to increase her stock of merchandise and to meet the growing and diversified demand of her clients. Mrs. B. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents in such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs. Madame Khadidiatou B. habite dans la localité de Camberene. C’est une femme mariée de 39 ans qui n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit a l’U-IMCEC ou elle est sociétaire depuis juin 2009.Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a depuis 20 ans exerce l’activité de commerce particulièrement la vente de tissus et prêt a porter. C’est une activité qu’elle a aime depuis son enfance et elle lui permet aussi de gagner sa vie. Elle emprunte 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandise pour faire face a la demande croissante et diversifiée de sa clientèle. Madame B. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing stock of merchandise

loans.name: Ntowor Group

texts.en:
Ntowor is a group of five borrowers, led by J. S., who live and work in Westpoint, a very poor neighborhood near downtown Monrovia, Liberia. J. is 42 years old and married with five children aged 15-30. He also cares for his siblings. J. is a 7th grade dropout who had to leave school early because he couldn't afford to pay school fees.

J.’ business is a hardware shop. He buys building tools and materials such as locks, nails, glue, wood planks, etc. at wholesale and then sells them to the residents of Westpoint in a small shop. He has been running his business for 20 years. His dream is to expand his business and build a proper storefront. J. sells from a table in the street now. J. is requesting a loan to buy more hardware and building materials to serve his customers in Westpoint. With the profits from his business, he dreams of sending his children to school so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy hardware and building supplies for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with 2 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Emma plants and harvests bananas to sell. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Emma is requesting her second loan, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her banana business.

loans.name: Mrs. Near Soeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has nine people who all live in Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Near S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the loan members, who use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family. Her husband, Mr. Hung Horm, is a construction laborer. 

In the rice field, they have had some problems because it has a lot of insects and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Near S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to improve the production of rice. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Savalan

texts.en:
Savalan Z. is 43 years old and is married with three sons. He lives in small village of Agsu city and has land for cultivating seasonal fruits. His wife helps him on the plantation.

Savalan now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer, so he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

You could become an important part of his family's life. Savalan deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Carmen Gutiérrez López, vive en la ciudad de Somoto a 35 km de Condega ella trabaja como profesora para el Ministerio de Educación y da clases de nivel primaria, en una comunidad de esa ciudad.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar 12 láminas de zinc y 8 perlines metálicos, esto para construir el techo de la cocina de su casa de habitación. Con esto ella quiere mejorar la cocina que en la actualidad es de madera y ya está deteriorada y en épocas de invierno hay filtraciones de agua por esa razón ella pretende realizar en este momento esta reparaciones. Doña Carmen comenzó a trabajar como profesora desde hace 14 años e inicio dando clases de preescolar, continuo con sus estudios de magisterio  y cuatro años después comenzó a dar clases de primaria y lleva ya 10 años dando clases en este nivel.  Doña Carmen es profesora y da clases de primaria en una escuelita rural, ella viaja todos los días hasta la comunidad donde da clases a niños de esa zona rural que se llama santa Isabel. Doña Carmen antes de dedicarse a esta actividad de trabajo ella estudiaba magisterio por la mañana y por las tardes ella vendía fritanga, Enchiladas en su casa, con eso ella se ayudaba para costear sus estudios y la mantención de sus hijos también tenía el apoyo de su esposo quien hacia trabajos de carpintería.  Con este crédito doña Carmen espera resolver el problema que tiene en el techo de su casa y de esta forma brindarle mayor seguridad y  satisfacción a sus hijas quienes también se veían afectado por este problema, Doña Carmen es casada y madre de dos hijas  una de 17 años de edad que estudia su quinto año de bachillerato, y una  niña de 8 años que estudia tercer grado de primaria. El marido de doña Carmen actualmente está sin trabajo y por el momento esta ayudándole a los trabajos del hogar y continúa buscando trabajo pero se le ha hecho difícil ya que en nuestro país el nivel de desempleo es bastante grande. Doña Carmen lleva 4 años de trabajar con financiamientos con Ceprodel y ha recibido 6 créditos en todo este tiempo. Doña Carmen es una señora trabajadora y que trabaja como maestra pero el sueldo que ella gana es bajo debido a que en nuestro país este sector no es bien remunerado por problemas  presupuestarios y económicos, entonces ella con los créditos ha venido mejorando poco a poco su casa y con su ingreso como profesora cubre estos gasto y los del hogar, de esta forma se le está brindando una alternativa para que ella pueda resolver sus necesidades   y se puede decir que ha mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Carmen Gutiérrez López lives in the city of Somoto, 35km from Condega. She works in this city as a primary school teacher for the Ministry of Education. The loan will be used to buy 12 sheets of corrugated iron roofing and 8 metal beams to construct the roof of her kitchen. Her kitchen is made of wood and is in bad shape. In the winter it leaks, which is why she needs to make the repairs right now. Doña Carmen has been a teacher for 14 years. She started as a pre-school teacher, continued attending teacher college and 4 years later began to teach primary school. She now teaches at a small rural school, traveling everyday to the community of Santa Isabel. Before becoming a teacher, Doña Carmen would go to classes in the mornings, then sell fried snacks like enchiladas from her house in the afternoon. This helped her pay for her schooling and provide for her children. She also had help from her husband, who worked as a carpenter. With this loan, Doña Carmen hopes to fix her roof and provide better safety and satisfaction to her daughters, who are also impacted by this problem. Doña Carmen is a married mother of 2 daughters: one is 17 years old and in her 5th year of secondary school, the other is 8 years old and in the 3rd grade. Her husband is unemployed; he is currently helping out with housework while looking for work, but it is difficult because unemployment rates are high in the country right now. Doña Carmen is a hardworking woman but her income is low because teachers are not well paid, due to budgetary and economic problems in the country. With these loans, she has been able to slowly improve her house while using her teacher's salary to cover household expenses. Thus, she is able to pay for her necessities and can say that she has improved her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 12 sheets of corrugated iron roofing and 8 metal beams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Aurora Boaventura

texts.pt:
Aurora Boaventura M. nasceu no Distrito de Moatize, Província de Tete, norte de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade, ainda não vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque começou a trabalhar e não teve condições para ir avante. Vive na casa cedida pelos serviços com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho e 1 prima que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Moatize para Boane quando vinha visitar seus familiares, acabou ficando para continuar com os estudos. Trabalha como docente e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e recebe um salário de 5.570.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA, decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 21.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, blocos, barrotes, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder concluir a sua residência.
texts.en:
Aurora Boaventura M. was born in Moatize District, Tete Province in northern Mozambique. She is 29 years old, married, and mother of a two-year-old son who does not yet attend school. Aurora finished twelfth grade but did not continue because she began working and was unable to go ahead with school. She lives in teachers' housing with her family and supports a nephew and a cousin who live with her. She left Moatize for Boane when she came to visit relatives and ended up staying to continue her studies. She works as a teacher and has been employed by the Ministry of Education for more than six years. She has no employees and receives a monthly salary of 5,570 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also manages to save some money in her bank account.
