Aurora had a previous loan with Tchuma Credit Union but decided not to continue with them for several reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also customers of this institution. This is her third loan. She is asking for 21,300 meticais which she will use to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, block, beams, cement and other items) to continue construction on her house. The previous loans of 5,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais were for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain her good credit. In the future she would like to ask for more loans so she can finish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (zinc sheets, bricks. beams, cement and other iterms)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has eight children aged 8 years to 30 years old. Three of the children are currently in school. Mary is a farmer from Western Kenya, in Kitale town, where she has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years. Her main products are milk and maize, which she sells to the local market. She also rears sheep which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in this business was when her cow died due to a calving problem. This was a big loss to her dairy farm.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the milk from the dairy cow will her family with milk for their own consumption. The rest of the milk will be sold to earn income that will enable her educate her children. In future she expects the dairy cow will have 4 or 5 other good breeds which will enhance her farming.

She says she has taken the right path to join a Juhudi Kilimo group which assisted her to obtain a dairy cow. She promises to repay the loan accordingly and obtain another loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure  a dairy cow.

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Micaela Bastidas II”, está conformada por 10 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores de comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 2 años.
María Elena, mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta, desde hace 8 meses,  tiene 39 años,  es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 17 años que actualmente se está preparando para postular a la Universidad.
Desde hace 15 años María Elena se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir (Alta Costura), se inicio porque estudio alta costura y sastrería. Con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado poner un taller con tres maquinas (recta, remalladora y recubridora), su gran sueño es implementar mas su negocio y exportar sus productos.
El reciente préstamo, María lo destinará en la compra de mercadería (tela, hilos, cierres, etc.). Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The community outreach program, Micaela Bastidas II, has 10 members who operate small, informal businesses. They have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 2 years. Maria Elena, an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman, has been the president of the group for 8 months. She is 39 years old and a single mother with a 17 year old son who is preparing to study at the university. For 15 years, Maria Elena has operated a tailoring business (Alta Costura) that she started after studying dress-making and tailoring. Working hard every day, she has managed to set up a workshop with three sewing machines (chainstitch, lockstitch, coverstitch). She wants to expand the business and export her products. Maria will use her most recent loan to buy supplies (cloth, thread, buttons, etc.). The loan will add to her working capital so that she can continue operating the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Dorcas Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Felicia describes herself as determined. She is 45 years old and she is the leader of the 'Dorcas' borrower group. Felicia lives in a town near Dormaa and sells dried fish and maize in the community market. She has been running her fish business for 2 years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase one and half baskets of dried fish. 

Felicia is married to a farmer and together they have one child who is 18 years old. She hopes to grow her fish business to be able to provide good education for her child.  

As the leader of the 'Dorcas' borrower group, Felicia ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments. The other women in the group operate businesses selling food, earrings, and fish.

loans.use: To purchase one and half baskets of dried fish.

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny A. is from Iligan City. She is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Liny owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Liny has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Liny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liny is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Liny from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi S. is a 41-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Cham Province. (Her husband appears to the left in the photo.) She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like rice and potatoes. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. Yi S. has five children who are no longer in school and who are employed at a various occupations. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Yi S. does not have enough capital to support her efforts. Yi S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward planting potatoes.

loans.use: To use toward planting potatoes.

loans.name: Ngorn

texts.en:
Mr. Ngorn T., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Chroeb In, 40, have been married for more than 20 years and have one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Ngorn was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead. 

Ngorn has been driving a motor taxi for 20 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 20 years. Besides the motor taxi business, the couple also farms, growing rice on their farmland in the village when they have time. 

They always spend a lot of money on plowing fees; it’s difficult for them to provide enough income to support their family. Hence, Ngorn is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to use for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase cows to use for plowing.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo que estudia en la universidad, Paulina es Bióloga de profesional y trabaja para instituciones pero su meta es tener un laboratorio propio. Paulina vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son en mayor parte al crédito.
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y solicita un préstamo de 1000 para la compra de aretes, cremas y labiales.
texts.en:
Paulina lives with her life partner and has a son who is in the university. She is a Biologist and works for several institutions but her goal is to own her own laboratory. Paulina sells catalogue cosmetics to friends and family for the most part on credit. She is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy earrings, creams and lipsticks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy earrings, creams and lipsticks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her cultivable acreage

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn C. is from the village of Burgos. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Malyn owns and operates a business venture providing a tricycle transport service in the local community. Malyn has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Malyn joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Malyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair another transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items for his wedding and arrange the wedding party

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 61 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa en el caserio Pomape del distrito de Mosnsefú, una zona agrícola situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era muy joven a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado se dedica a criar vacas, de las cuales extrae su leche para comercializarla y adicionalmente se dedica a la siembra de forraje, el cual es utilizado para alimentar a sus animales. Con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades el se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

José desea invertir en la alimentación de su ganado de modo que su producción aumente y pueda percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado y en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de alfalfa.

José es uun hombre que gusta mucho de su trabajo. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y confiable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Jose is a father, he is 61 years old and he lives together with his wife in the community of Pomape, in the district of Monsefu. It is an agricultural region located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Ever since he was a young man he has always worked in agriculture. He raises cattle and sells the milk they produce and he also keeps foraging plantations that he uses to feed the animals.  With the income he earns from these businesses he is able to provide for his family. 

Jose wishes to invest in the purchase of feed for his livestock to increase production in milk and improve his earnings. To this end he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. He will purchase balanced feed and he will maintain his alfalfa cultivation. 

Jose is someone who loves his work. Those that know him consider him to be honest and trustworthy. Previously he has had loans with Edpyme Alternativa and he has been a good and responsible client.

loans.use: To maintain his alfalfa plantation.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., 28, owns a grocery shop where she sells many items including cooking ingredients, sweets and soft drinks. Om retails her inventory to passer-bys and her neighbors. She has been running her grocery business for over three years and earns an average of $4 a day. To ensure financial stability for the entire family, her husband is a local porter. The couple currently have no children. Om hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a $300 loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of grocery items for resale. This will allow her to increase her income to ensure her family attains a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bigger tubs for clothes which have already been washed and to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: ESTER TIENE 47 AÑOS CASADA, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y DOS HIJOS YA CASADOS ELLA TIENE SU TIENDA D. PLASTICOS DOND. TAMBIEN VEND. REGALOS PARA TODA OCACION, ATIEND. TODOS LOS DIAS D. LUNES A VIERNES D. 8:AM HASTA LAS 6:00 PM YA QUE  ASISTE A SU IGLESIA, LOGRO TENER SU NEGOCIO GRACIAS AL APOYO D. SU ESPOSO QUE TRABAJABA FUERA D. GUATEMALA TUVO ALGUNAS DIFICULTADES Y AHORA QUE NO CUENTA CON LOS MISMOS INGRESOS POR LO MISMO NECESITA UN CREDITO PARA LEVANTER NUEVAMENTE SU TIENDA D. PLASTICOS Y  COMPRAR SILLAS PLASTICAS, BOTES D. BASURA, BANOS PLASTIICOS Y RAGALOS PARA TODA OCACION, Y ASI AYUDAR A LA ECONOMIA D. SU HOGAR Y A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: Ester is 47 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two sons who are already married. She has a shop where she sells plastics and gifts for every occasion. She serves in the shop every day, Monday to Friday, from 8am until 6pm as she also attends Church. She managed to set up her business with the support of her husband, who works outsiD. of Guatemala. She has experienced difficulties and now cannot rely on the same income that she received. She needs a loan to re-energise her plastics shop by buying plastic chairs, waste baskets, plastic baths and gifts for every occasion, so that she can help her sons and her home finances.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic chairs and baths, and gifts for every occasion.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old. He is married and the provider for three children.

In 2007 Hassan opened his own food market since there is high demand in his local area. Now he is becoming well-known and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a refrigerator, renovate and install roll shutters for the shop. He is aiming to grow bigger and extend the shop to increase his revenue.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator, renovate and install roll shutters for the shop

loans.name: Chav

texts.en:
Chav S., 48, sells vegetables by using her bike, earning an income of $2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $60 on food, $1 on electricity supply and $10 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband produces traditional baskets to sell and is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny I. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Liny is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Liny owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Liny has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Liny is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Joseph Mutema

texts.en:
Joseph has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 62 years old and is married to Annah Wangechi.  They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

In the future, Joseph hopes to continue with farming and become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for farm

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es socio propietario en el  sindicato de transportistas  Eduardo Avaroa, también es cubicador de madera. El crédito  lo necesita para el cambio de motor y caja de su vehiculo para seguir trabajando en el transporte de pasajeros. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para su familia. Su anhelo a futuro es adquirir una casa propia, para lo cual están ahorrando un poco de dinero cada mes.

Su esposa trabaja como profesora y tienen cuatro hijos. La familia vive en la zona ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto, y pagan un  alquiler mensual. Es primer crédito con Impro y con Kiva.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a shareholding member of the Eduardo Avaroa transportation syndicate, and is also a wood carver. He needs this loan to change the motor and gearbox for his vehicle in order to continue working transporting passengers. This business is his source of income for his family. His wish for the future is to acquire his own home, and he is saving a bit of money every month toward this goal.

His wife works as a teacher and they have four children. The family lives in the Satlelite zone of the city of El Alto, and pay rent every month. This is his first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: the purchase of an engine and a gearbox for his passenger transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
56-year-old Visitacion lives in the town of Surallah with her familiy. She has three children aged 30, 20 and 16. Her 2 younger children go to school and Visitacion wishes for them to finish college and have bright futures.

Visitacion grows rice that she sells to her community. She tills her own land. She also has coconut trees planted on a part of her land. She makes copra out of the coconuts.

Visitacion is in need of fertilizers and seeds. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP which she will use to fund her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta: Violeta; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia es profesora de profesión, ella trabaja en un colegio y la socia a encontrado la manera de alternar su trabajo con otro, ella también es proveedora de instrumentos odontológicos, la socia tiene un cuñado que es odontólogo y debido a que el trabaja en su consultorio y está muy ocupado ella le trae de Cusco los instrumentos y los materiales odontológicos que el requiere y de este modo ella pasa a ser su proveedora, la socia es una joven es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muy buenas ideas del futuro, ella por ahora desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital de trabajo y de este modo seguir ahorrando su dinero para comprar sus cosas poco a poco; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales odontológicos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank “TERCER MILENIO,” located in Urubamba Province, Cusco.
Violeta is 28, single, and an educator by profession.  She works in a school full time, but also maintains a side job selling dental instruments, as her brother-in-law is a dental surgeon and she assists him buy purchasing dental instruments in Cusco and has become the main supplier for his business.  Violeta is young and a hard worker with many aspirations.  In the near term, she wants to gather capital to continue purchasing materials, and this loan will allow her to buy a stock of dental instruments for resale. She is committed to prompt repayment of the credit according to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase dental materials to supply local business

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaias O. P. es un hombre de 62 años que vive en la zona sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allì en su vivienda tiene un negocio de ferreteria lla mado “ferromiscelanea”, que iniciò hace 8 años en compañía de una de sus hijas y posteriormente la comprò y se constituyò en la fuente de ingresos principal del hogar conformado por su esposa y sus 4 hijos,  hoy en las edades de  de 30 a 39 años. En Ferremiscelanea trabaja su esposa y un sobrino que son su gran apoyo en esta gestiòn y vende materiales de construcciòn y elementos de ferreterìa. Isaias està vinculado al programa de microfinanzas de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 12 años en los cuales ha recibido 9 financiamientos y hoy està aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprarà   estanterias y realizarà adecuaciones a vitrinas exhibidoras. Con sus creditos anteriores y el servicio de formaciòn empresarial ha logrado proyectar mejor sus inversiones y adicionar un capital con el que trabaja con el cual genera nuevas utilidades cada vez que lo invierte.  Ahora su gran sueño y tambien desafio es comprar un lote y adecuar una bodega de almacenamiento, para lograr separarlo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isaias O. P. is a 62 year-old man who lives in the southern area of the city of Barranquilla.  He has a hardware store in his home which is called 'Ferromiscelanea'.  Isaias started his business 8 years ago together with one of his daughters.  He then bought it from her and it became the main source of income for his family which includes his wife and 4 children who are currently between the ages of 30 and 39.

Isaias' wife and one of his nephews work in 'Ferromiscelanea'.  They are a great support and sell construction materials and other hardware items.  Isaias has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 12 years and has received 9 loans  He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan which he will use to buy shelving units.  He will also adapt some display cabinets.  Through his previous loans and FMSD's business training service, Isaias has managed to better plan his investments and add capital to his business which he works with and from which he makes new profits every time that he invests it.  Now his biggest dream, and also his biggest challenge, is to buy a plot of land and set up a storage warehouse so that he can separate it from his home.

loans.use: to buy shelving units and adapt some display cabinets

loans.name: Sheila Viviana

texts.es: Doña Sheila A. C. es una señora joven con 34 años de edad, madre de cuatro niños y separada de su esposo. Ella vive con sus hijos en una casa de dos plantas en donde sus padres habitan en la planta de arriba y ella en la de abajo en el centro de Limón. Cuenta con el apoyo de ellos para tomar cualquier decisión para bien. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante sin descuidar a su familia. Primero hace los oficios domésticos, ve sus hijos y luego sale a vender su mercadería. Es el primer préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en comprar ropa y también oro y plata laminada.
texts.en: Sheila A. C. is a 34 year old young woman and the mother of four.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her children in a two story home in the center of Limón.  Her parents live on the second floor and she on the first.  She has their full support.  She makes her sales on foot without missing her family obligations.  First she does her housework, sees her children, and then goes out to sell merchandise.  This will be her first loan and she will use the money to buy clothing and gold and silver jewelry.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Unidad Vecinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIDAD VECINAL” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de comida, venta de ropa, venta de artículos para el hogar, apertura de negocio.

La señora Sonia,  indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella quiere iniciar un negocio de tienda en su zona, por recomendación de un familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la comprar mercadería para la tienda (fideo, arroz, aceite, panes, etc.) que pretende comprar de los mayoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito
texts.en:
The “UNIDAD VECINAL” [Neighborly Unity] community bank began its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Cascada center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors headed by Sonia. The members' businesses in the community bank are varied. Among them we have: selling food, selling clothes, selling household items, opening a business.
 
Sonia indicates that this is the first time that she has belonged to a community bank in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of the promoters. At present, she wants to open a store in her area, on the recommendation of a family member.    

The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise for the store (pasta, rice, oil, bread, etc.). She itends to buy them from wholesalers. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. 
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health and credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy store merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has owned an insurance office since 2000 with 15 years of previous experience in the same occupation. He offers his clients different kinds of insurance (life insurance, health insurance, car insurance, etc.) He cooperates with his brothers to handle the heavy living expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his office and modernize it so that he can receive his clients properly. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: to renovate his office and modernize it

loans.name: Berna Haydee

texts.es: La Sra. Berna  tiene 38 años, es conviviente tiene 1 hija menor de edad de 14 años, quien estudia en colegio estatal, cuenta con casa propia de material noble, Berna se dedica al negocio de transporte  tiene 2 vehículos el cual es alquilado y su cónyuge trabaja en la otra movilidad, realizando el servicio de colectivo para la ruta de Ica- Fonavi San Martín viceversa, las movilidad fueron adquirida con el trabajo que ella realizaba como ayudante de venta de comida, el préstamo será invertido en darle mantenimiento al motor y comprar algunas piezas del mismo, y  así  poder seguir trabajando, su sueño a futuro es de contar con otra movilidad con mayor capacidad de pasajeros para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ocasiónales , Berna esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Berna is 38 years old and has one daughter who is 14 and in high school.  Berna owns her own home which is made from solid building materials and has a transport business.  She owns two vehicles; she rents one of them out and the other is used by her husband who provides a taxi service (with fixed route and fare) on the Ica - Fonavi San Martín route.  The vehicles were purchased with money from the work that Berna used to carry out as an assistant in a food sales business. 

Berna will invest her loan in having the vehicle's engine serviced and she will also buy some spare parts.  This will enable her to continue working.  Her dream for the future is to own another vehicle which can carry more passengers so that she can provide a better service to her casual customers.  Berna is very grateful for the trust that is being placed in her.

loans.use: to maintain the engine of her car and purchase spare parts

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is 28 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 2 and 5 years old. She has five years experience selling local drinks.

Dancille has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying a large quantity of local drinks. Dancille will use the profit generated from this loan to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of local drinks.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth es una joven madre de familia, natural de la zona rural de Huancayo que en la actualidad vive en casa de un familiar  con su pequeño hijo. Hace 1 año decidió tener su negocio de venta de helados que elabora en su misma casa, con ayuda de su nevera que adquirió  con unos ahorros que disponía, fruto de sus trabajos anteriores. Desde entonces aprovecha cada época de verano, donde tiene mayores ventas. Actualmente ha mejorado la calidad de sus helados, y eso le ha generado más ventas, asimismo produce chupetes de crema y de hielo porque ha visto que hay mayor preferencia de su clientes por estos productos. Sus principales consumidores son los escolares de los distintos centros educativos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP,  la cual considera que es de suma importancia para el crecimiento de su negocio, con ello espera mejorar sus implementos y herramientas de trabajo. Es por ello que espera la colaboración de todos ustedes. Por esta razón el dinero lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de su nevera.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a young mother from the rural area of Huancayo and she currently lives with a relative together with her young son.  A year ago she decided to set up a business selling home-made icecream.  She bought a refrigerator with the savings she had from previous jobs.  Since then she takes advantage of the summer season for high volume sales.  She has been in the process of improving the quality of her icecream and this has generated more sales.  She also makes cream popsicles since these are preferred by her customers.

Her main consumers are the students from the schools in the area.  This is her first loan through MFP and she feels it is very important for her business growth.  She hopes to improve her work supplies and equipment and is counting on your support.  She plans to use the loan to repair and maintain her refrigerator.

loans.use: To send her refrigerator to a mechanic for repair.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga, tiene 32 años, es conviviente, tiene mototaxis y cabinas de Internet.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de módulos para sus computadoras. Está en FINCA Perú con éste el segundo ciclo, le gusta porque le entiende, tuvo algunas dificultades saco un préstamo para su suegra y no pago así que ella tuvo que asumir la deuda, pero se está recuperando. Está agradecida por la confianza y oportunidad que le da FINCA Perú. Su sueño es que su negocio se establezca y crezca.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Morenita Huamanga”. She is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a business of renting out motorcycle taxis and Internet booths.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in computer stations for housing her computer equipment. As a member of FINCA Peru, Paulina will be participating in her second loan cycle. She enjoys the understanding she has received since she experienced a few difficulties obtaining a loan for her mother-in-law. She was not able to repay, so Paulina was left with assuming her debt and is still recovering. She is grateful for the trust and the opportunity that FINCA Peru has given her. Her dream is to stabilize her business and see it grow.

loans.use: to purchase computer stations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and handbags to sell

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella tiene 26 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene  2  hijos, vive con su madre en una localidad pequeña del distrito de castilla en el departamento de Piura al norte del Perú. 

 Fiorella se dedica a la venta de comida,hamburguesas ,salchipapas (papas fritas con jod-dog),etc por las noches de lunes a domingos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace bastante tiempo, conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Fiorella esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar los insumos como papa, pan, etc, en mayores cantidades, los cuales son  necesarios para aumentar la cantidad de comida que produce diariamente, para así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Fiorella  desea incrementar sus ventas para obtener mayores ingresos, ella  espera hacerse mas conocida a través de la promoción que le hagan sus clientes actuales. Fiorella tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en sus negocio y salir adelante, para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 26 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She lives with her mother in a small community in the district of Castilla in the department of Piura, located Peru's north.

Fiorella sells foods, including hamburgers, salchipapas (french fries with hot dogs), etc., in the evenings from Monday to Sunday. She has been in business for quite some time and she knows the field perfectly. She has an already established clientele in the region. 

Fiorella requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase ingredients such as potatoes, bread, in larger quantities. These ingredients are necessary to increase the quantity of food she produces daily, which is necessary to satisfy her clients' demands. Her clients have been increasing in the past months.

Fiorella wants to increase her sales in order to improve her income. She hopes to become well-known by word of mouth through her current clients. Fiorella is very eager to keep her business growing and moving forward in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as potatoes and bread in larger quantities.

loans.name: Grace Eposi Ngu Kwende

texts.en:
Grace is married to a lovely husband and they are both blessed with seven children. Only one child is under 15 and some are in school. She lives in Ntasen, an area in Bamenda, in the north-west region of Cameroon.

Her major challenges in life has been the difficultly of her children dropping out of school and inadequate capital to start a business for herself before joining GHAPE. She has also suffered greatly from ill health. Given a loan, she plans to buy pig feed, firewood, medicines for the animals and to pay for the maintenance of her pigsty and the transportation of her newly bought piglets to their rearing site. 

Grace knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training in financial management and pig rearing from GHAPE. She has also chosen to diversify her income by investing some of her capital in a firewood business and she has the land to support a successful business. The loan, if granted, will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates, providing firewood to her neighbors. She joined GHAPE in 2006 and has since successfully borrowed and repaid loans four times.

She will reinvest her profits back into her business and use part to it to care for her family. She will also use the proceeds to finish a construction plan she earlier started, building two new rooms. Her children’s school needs will also be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy feed, seeds, firewood and to pay for the maintenance of the pigsties and transportation of the piglets.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is 51 years old, married with four children, and she takes care of two dependents. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling second hand.  Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on the weekend. Asteria has twenty years of experience in this business.

She requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying various secondhand items for resale. With any profits, Asteria will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase various secondhand items for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last  six years. She is 47 years old and a single mother of one school-going child.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She repaid her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to open up a restaurant in Ndunyu Njeru town which will boost her farm income.

In future, Lucy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area and grow her restaurant and have many branches around town.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Herminio tiene 47 años de edad, está acompañado con la Señora Silvia de 39 años de edad, ellos tienen 4 hijos.
Don Herminio se dedica al comercio de artículos en general. Él se dedica a este rubro hace más de 10 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2000. Comenzó su negocio con un capital que obtuvo por la venta de un automóvil, en la actualidad tiene variedades de productos lo cual hace que tenga una buena clientela en su local. Comenta que su negocio le trae muchas ganancias porque tiene mucha variedad y eso atrae a los clientes. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por darle a su esposa e hijos lo mejor, ya que desea que tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
El utiliza este crédito para la compra de jarras, escobas, palanganas, pelota, zapatillas y otros para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Herminio is 47 years old and is in a relationship with Señora Silvia who is 39 years old. They have 4 children.
Don Herminio has a general trade store. He has been working in this for more than 10 years, approximately since the year 2000. He started his business with capital obtained from selling a car. He currently stocks a variety of products which give him a good clientele at his locale. He says that his business gives him a lot of profits because he stocks a variety of things which attracts customers. He says that he does all that he does to give his partner and children the best as he wants them to have a dignified and decent life.
 
He is using this loan to buy pitchers, brushes, bowls, balls, shoes and other products to stock his business. He thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity provided him as obtaining the loan will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy brushes, pitchers, shoes to stock up his business.

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Aurora, tiene 51 años  de edad, está separada y fruto de esa relación tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad e independientes. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, allí también vende bebidas como agua, sodas y cervezas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 20h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sodas, aguas y cervezas.

Sus sueños es gozar de buena salud y seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the August 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the parish of Andrés de Vera in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Aurora. She is 51 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children who are grown and independent. Aurora is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits that the organization has provided.

She earns her daily living by selling clothing of all types. Her sales are made by going door-to-door. She also sells from her house where she has a small store. There she also sells beverages such as water, sodas, and beer. Aurora works every day from 8am to 8pm. She extends credit to her customers and collects at the end of every week. Aurora buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as needed. She has been in this business for more than four years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, sodas, water, and beer. Her dreams are to enjoy good health and to move forward in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, sodas, water, and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To decorate his store and purchase more products for it.

loans.name: Jerry James

texts.en:
Jerry James is from Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry James operates a transportation service. He has been in this business for over ten years and earns PHP 10,000.00 a month.

Jerry James has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000.00 which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jerry James from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 20, single and lives with his parents and sister in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. 

His father drives a truck, his mother is unemployed and his sister is a pharmacist. 

He started his taxi service business in 2009 with his own car. He loves his business. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to maintain his car for the harsh winter. He is a sharp and hardworking man who said, "I do everything to expand my business. I even have regular customers who just call me when they need a taxi."

He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a wheel rim.

loans.use: To buy a wheel rim.

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama itacuan esta formado por once integrantes, todas mujeres trabajadoras  con ganas de triunfar en la vida y ayudar  a sus familias.
Una de sus integrantes es la señora  Luisa de veinte siete años de edad  es una señora trabajadora llena de vida y de fuerzas  para triunfar en la vida y cumplir sus sueños.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Anastacio  de treinta y dos años de edad , es un esposo trabajador ya que se dedica al campo y ala albañilería desde hace veintisiete años.
La señora Luisa se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace diez años le gusta mucho vender pollo  ya que  cuando le sobra poco ella lo quizá para que se lo coma su familia.
En ocasiones da  fiado el pollo pero a personas  que ella conoce , para que le puedan pagar en la semana.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos una mujer de once años de edad y un varón de siete años , sus hijos le ayudan a matar los pollos y a tirar las plumas cuando su mama termina de limpiar los pollos.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es limpiar sus pollos y destazarlos ya que desde pequeña veía que su mama matada los pollos y echa también le ayudaba.
La señora Luisa termino la secundaria sabe leer y escribir bien pero le gustan mucho las matemáticas  ya que también tiene una tienda de abarrotes  y tiene que dar cambio y comprar mercancía y saber cuanto va pagar y si le conviene  comprar.
Doña Luisa pidió el préstamo para comprar mas pollos para la venta en su comunidad y comunidades vecinas.
Esta muy agradecida con  fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en esta vida ya que si no trabaja no  va poder tener un dinero extra para los imprevistos que se presenten.
Ella nos cuenta que se considera una persona inteligente , trabajadora y muy responsable ya que eso se lo inculcaron sus padres y echa ahora se los inculca  a sus hijos.
Le da las gracias a fundación por  el apoyo que le ha dado a las personas de su grupo para que puedan hacer su negocio mas grande i obtener mas ganancias y ayudar a sus familias.
Las otras personas que integran el grupo son:
María del Carmen- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado
Emma – quien se dedica a la venta de pollo vivo y destazado.
Francisca- quien se dedica a la venta de gasolina.
Elizabeth- quien se dedica  a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Carmen – quien se dedica a la venta de pollo vivo y destazado.
Eufemia Inés - quien se dedica a la venta de pollo vivo y destazado.
Araceli- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Matilde- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Justina- quien se dedica a la venta de de quesos y leche.
Leslie Dania- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Gracias fundación por ayudar a cambiar vivas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Itacuan” and consists of 11 members. All of the members are hardworking women who want to succeed in life and help their families.

One of the members is Sra. Luisa. She is 26 years old and a hardworking woman who is full of life. Luisa strives to succeed in life and fulfill her dreams. She is happily married to Sr. Anastacio, who is 32 years old. Her husband has worked as a farmer and a bricklayer since he was 26.

Sra. Luisa has been selling chickens for 10 years. She enjoys this type of work, but when she has a few chickens she will stop selling so that she can use what she has to feed her family. Occasionally she will extend credit to people that she knows and they will have a week to pay for the chickens. Luisa has two children, an 11-year-old daughter and a 7-year-old son. Her children help with butchering and plucking the chickens and then she cleans them. What she enjoys most about her business is cleaning and butchering the chickens because she watched her mother perform these duties when she was a girl and also got to help her.

Sra. Luisa finished her high school education. She knows how to read and write very well, but she also enjoys mathematics. Luisa has a grocery store, so she knows how to make change, buy merchandise, calculate how much she will pay, and determine whether she should buy. She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens to sell in her community and in the neighboring areas. Luisa is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to her so that she can move forward and succeed in life. If she was not working, then she would not have extra funds for whenever unexpected emergencies arise. Luisa is considered to be an intelligent, hardworking, and responsible person because of the values instilled in her by her parents. She now wants to pass those same values on to her children.

Thanks to the support Fundación Realidad has given to the other members of the group, they have been able to expand their businesses, generate more earnings, and help their families. The other members of the group are as follows: • María del Carmen sells fish. • Emma sells live and butchered chickens. • Francisca sells gasoline. • Elizabeth sells Mexican street food. • Carmen sells live and butchered chickens. • Eufemia Inés sells live and butchered chickens. • Araceli sells Mexican street food. • Matilde sells Mexican street food. • Justina sells milk and cheese. • Leslie Diana sells Mexican street food.

They thank Fundación Realidad for helping them change their lives.

loans.use: to buy chickens to butcher and sell.

location.town: Cruz del Itacuan, Pinotepa Nacional; Oaxaca

loans.name: Tuis

texts.en:
Tuis is 24-years-old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. 

He started his taxi service business in 2010 using his own car. His car is old and rusty therefore nobody wants to sit in his car. He sold his car and is planning to buy a newer car to run his business properly. However he is lacking 1,000,000 MNT to buy a newer car. 

He is an educated young man who says,"I am the only one with the income in the family. Therefore I have to work hard and do everything I can."

loans.use: to buy a newer car.

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is a 52-year old married woman. She owns a small market for daily use products, in addition to baking Saj bread.
Samiha opened her store 11 years ago so she has had long experience in this business.  She seeks to improve her business through increasing the different types of goods she sells. She wants to add fireworks for Christmas and New Year’s celebrations. She will also start selling toys for children, which is a good step forward.That’s why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. 

Samiha is known for the good quality of products she sells, and good customer service. She aspires to give her customers better quality and prices with the help of the loan applied for, and through expanding her business more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has six children, ages 13 to 28; they are in school and live at home. Graced stopped her education in 12th grade. Since 2010, she has been selling chicken, meat, and fish in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, meat, and fresh cassava fish for her business. She started this business with the help of her husband. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, meat, and fresh cassava fish for her business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 46 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her children are between age 10 and 28. Rosalia's husband is a farmer.

Rosalia has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. She sells items like detergent and bath soap, purified water and canned goods. Rosalia earns 4,000 PHP per month from her store. Rosalia also cooks food items such as rice cakes to sell in her community.

Rosalia has requested this loan to buy ingredients and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks. Rosalia hopes to continue earning and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Shirly has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Shirly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a forty-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past five years he has selling timber. Customers not paying on time is a challenge for him however he has a dream of educating his children and owning one of the biggest timber store in town.
Samson needs the loan facility to buy trees for timber making.

loans.use: to trees for timber making.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente finished his first loan with Kiva successfully. He says that his 10 years of experience have been a huge part of his success over the last six months. He initially began in this business shortly after getting married, and when he went to purchase shoes one day, he realized he could do better than most of the shoe salesmen around town. With $50 he opened up his shop and sold to people walking down the street. Vicente’s wife joined him in the store, and they have learned to take advantage of the holidays and weekends because those are the busiest times at the outdoor markets near their house. Mr. Z. has been especially entrepreneurial, seeking out some of the best artisans in his area to make shoes which he sells. However, this level of customization requires cash up front. The relationship between Vicente and his shoemakers is very close as they rely on him to sell shoes so they can maintain their daily subsistence, and it is important to Vicente so he can have a profitable business.

Mr. Z. is asking for his second loan so that he buy athletic shoes, artisan-made shoes, as well as two display cases to show off his inventory.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Mr. Zumba is asking for his second loan so that he buy athletic shoes, artisan-made shoes, as well as two display cases to show off his inventory.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline she is married and has two children. She is educated to level 12 and she has undergone training in Business Management and Loan Use from the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode).

She seeks a loan to expand her retail business, build a good shelter where she can display her goods, and restock a variety of important ingredients such as tomatoes and other vegetables. Her business serves people who are working.

She intends to use the profit to provide medical care for her family, pay school fees and refurbish her house.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ciria

texts.en:
Ciria works selling clothing in the provinces of her neighbohood and to friends. Ciria began her business with the help of her sister who loaned her the merchandise to begin her own business. At the beginning she only sold underwear. Now she sells all types of clothing. Ciria hopes to also sell toys and to earn higher profits so that her business can grow. She would use her loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise and by which turn highe profits. Ciria is single. She is 50 and she depends on her business to support her family and to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ciria se dedica a la venta de ropa en provincias, por su sector y amistades. Ciria empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le facilito la mercadería para que emprendiera su propio negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa interior. Ahora vende toda clase de ropa. Ciria aspira vender juguetes y obtener mayores ingresos para que su negocio tenga crecimiento. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Ciria esta soltera. Ella tiene 50 años, depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in toys.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Business Description

Jacinta started her business with a little capital of her own. Jacinta, along with her husband, started a business buying and selling recycled materials, such as scrap metal from washing machines, refrigerators, and stoves, copper, cardboard, plastics, and other products. Jacinta indicates that she attends her business Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. Jacinta rents a piece of land where she lives and stores all the different recycled materials she sells on the days when she works.

Loan Use

Jacinta is asking for this loan in order to have capital available, because often people come to sell her recycling and she has to pay them on the spot, depending on the weight of their materials in pounds or kilos. Jacinta indicates that this business supports both her and her family, as well as the people who come to them to sell recycled materials.

Personal Information

Jacinta is 38 years old and has 3 children. She and her husband are keeping this business going and they say that, even though it's trash, for them and others who work in this field, recycling is the source of their income. She says that thanks to this business they have been able to buy a plot of land. Her longing is to be able to build a home and to give better food and education to her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Jacinta inicio su negocio con pequeño capital propio. Jacinta junto con su esposo realizan el negocio de compra y venta de materiales de reciclaje como chatarras de lavadoras, refrigeradoras, cocinas, cobre, cartón, plásticos y otros productos. Jacinta indica que su negocio lo atiende de lunes a sábado desde las 6 AM a 20 PM. Jacinta alquila un terreno donde ella vive y almacena todos los diferentes materiales de reciclaje que le van a vender todos los días que ella atiende.

Uso del Préstamo

Jacinta solicita el préstamo para tener capital disponible porque a muchas veces le van a vender reciclaje y tiene que pagarles al momento lo que pesa sea esto en libras, kilos. Jacinta indica que con este negocio ella y su familia tienen el sustento diario y también las diferentes personas que les van a vender lo reciclado.

Información Personal

Jacinta tiene 38 años y 3 hijos. Jacinta junto con su esposo están sosteniendo el negocio y dicen que a pesar de que es basura el reciclaje para ellos y los que laboran en esto son sus fuentes de ingreso. Jacinta dice que gracias a este negocio logro comprar un terreno. Su anhelo es poder construir su casa y darle una mejor alimentación y educación a su familia.

loans.use: To have capital to buy her merchandise

loans.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule is a strong woman and the mother of three children.  She and her family live in Siumu B centre. She is a former employee of a privately owned pharmacy in Apia but had to resign as she had nobody to look after her children while she worked.  She now works from home and helps her husband with their plantation to earn extra money to cover their everyday expenses and to help out with the kids’ school activities. Selling taro from the plantation earns her more money than she earned working full time. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro once a week to the market and now gets between $250.00 - $300.00 per trip.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: "I am happy to be a LAPO client," says Mrs. Rosemary O. who lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks and she has been in this business since 1990. She hopes to buy more provisions and drinks with the requested loan in the amount of US$ 400. Rosemary is 39 years old, married with 7 children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale in her little store

loans.name: Petronilda

texts.es:
Petronilda is 44-years-old, married and lives with their four children in their own home. Her husband, Isabelino, is 50 and his work requires him to travel to the country, leaving Petronilda to take care of the home.

Petronilda runs the family business, renting tables, chairs, tablecloths among other items out for social events, and also makes decorations and sells all kinds of food for parties.

The business is going well. Petronilda says that the most difficult thing to overcome was a fire that destroyed the food supply and curtailed business operations. But little by little they restocked the business with a lot of hard work. The experience has strengthened her and united the family. Now, with more faith than fear, they have decided to enlarge the business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La sra. Petronilda M., tiene 44 años, es casada, su marido se llama Isabelino y tiene 50 años de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa propia. Su esposo viaja de forma permanente al interior del país, por tanto la responsabilidad del hogar lo asume Petronilda.

Petronilda administra el negocio familiar que es el de servicios de alquileres de mesas, sillas, manteles entre otros, para eventos sociales, también realizan decoraciones y comercializan todo tipo de insumos para fiestas.

El negocio marcha muy bien, ella nos cuenta que el momento más difícil que atravesaron fue un incendio que sufrió el depósito de sus insumos y que destruyó totalmente los activos del negocio. Poco a poco fueron reponiendo todo el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Esta experiencia les fortaleció y unió como familia, ahora con más fé que temores, deciden ampliar el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, tablecloths, silverware, etc.

loans.name: Benohit

texts.es:
Benohit is a cheerful and enterprising lady who has worked since a young girl to help her parents out. Her strong desire to realize her goals continues to this day. She has gone through difficult times, including a partner who abandoned her leaving her alone with three daughters. She had to double her efforts to make a living, and so began a partnership with her sister renting cell phones in the capital city. All the while her business in Lima continues, she also sells jewelry, purses and other merchandise. Recently, her sister asked her to make a deposit of their savings at the bank. She was mugged en route and their hard-earned funds were stolen. This event has also affected her physically, as she now suffers from back pain. Despite all these circumstances, she marches on and wishes to increase her inventory of jewelry and purses which she goes out to sell every day accompanied by her eight year old daughter. Let’s join forces with this brave lady who asks for a loan to be able to purchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Benohit, es una dama alegre y emprendedora que siempre a trabajado desde muy niña para ayudar a sus padres y hoy no deja de realizar lo acostumbrado; a pesar de las circunstancias que atravesó frente al abandono de su pareja quedándose sola en compañía de sus tres querida hijas, tuvo que redoblar esfuerzos y realizó una asociación con su hermana para alquilar celulares en la capital; mientras su negocio en Lima está en marcha no deja de trabajar vendiendo joyas, bolsas y demás mercadería que pueda ofertar en las calles.Hace poco su hermana le envió un giro por el banco con las ganancias obtenidas y unos despiadados asaltantes le arrebataron el dinero y la golpearon, este hecho marcó mucho su vida puesto que a consecuencia de ello sufre fuertes dolores en la columna.A pesar de las diversas circunstancias a progresado y desea aumentar su mercadería de joyas y bolsas, las cuales sale a vender todos los días en compañía de su pequeña hija de ocho años.Colabore con esta noble dama que solicita una suma de dinero que invertirá para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería.

loans.use: Capital to purchase additional merchandise (purses and jewelry) to sell.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Isroil G. is 36 years old, has secondary education and is a doctor by profession. He is married and has 3 children. Isroil works as a doctor in the local psychiatric clinic for children. He also has a plot of land next to his house where he plants wheat every year. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He plans to use the loan to buy wheat seeds for sowing of his land. After the harvest he will keep a part of it for to make flour and bread and the rest he will sell to the locals at the below market price. Therefore, the local residents will have an option to buy wheat to make own flour.

Isroil plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гурезов Исроил, возраст – 36 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности врач, женат, имеет 3 детей. Исроил работает врачом в местной клинике для психически больных людей. Также он имеет участок земли рядом со своим домом, на которм каждый год сеет пшеницу, его опыт в этом виде деятельности 10 лет. На поолученный кредит он планирует приобрести семена пшеницы для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая, часть его он оставит для производства муки и выпечки хлеба, а другую часть реализует местным жителям по цене ниже рыночной. Местные жители будут иметь возможность приобрести пшеницу для производства муки.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat

loans.name: Mbalwa B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Janet S.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal shade and increase stock. Janet is 46 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 7 children ranging from age 19 to 28 and her children go to school. Each week, Janet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Janet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Janet is joined in her small group by Florence N., Melisa N., Sarah S., and Mbaga P.. Florence N. has a business in poultry farming and wants to add to her business. Melisa N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase more raw food and furniture. Sarah S. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to add capital and expand the business. Mbaga P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business to bulk selling

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina is very persistent and dedicated to give her children what's needed to get ahead in life, and for this reason she works daily in the fields tending and harvesting potatoes, which afterwards she takes to the city of Tarma to sell. A lot of the time the chores in the fields results in little compensation, and so recently she set up a sales post in her home for fruits and candy, which allows her to tend to her home as well. She wishes to have more capital to invest in her work so she can increase her income and improve her beloved family's well being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Agripina, es muy empeñosa y dedicada a brindar a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su superación, por esa razón trabaja diariamente en sus campos de cultivo y siembra papa que después de cosecharla llevará a la ciudad de Tarma para venderla. Muchas veces las tareas del campo suelen ser poco compensadoras es así que Agripina también ha puesto recientemente en su casa un puesto de venta de frutas y dulces, es por ello que con estos esfuerzos diariamente puede atender y solventar su hogar. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elevar sus ganancias y el bienestar de su querida familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve production / Incremento de capital para elevar su producción.

loans.name: Mwanapembe

texts.en:
Mwanapembe is 20 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 2 years old. Mwanapembe owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Tatu M., who is married and has two children aged five and eight. In 2005, Tatu established her crop wholesaling business. Assisted by her husband, working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $40 every month. Tatu now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and sunflower seeds in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $40. In the future, Tatu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and sunflower seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Mrs. Sandra G. runs a general store inside the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. Ever since she started her business, she has focused on improving it in order to pay for the household expenses.

She now needs to invest in purchasing goods, so she is looking for Ceprodel’s support so that she can obtain a loan in order to buy those goods. It is important to note that she has been a responsible member of Ceprodel, having repaid all her previous loans on time and according to the terms established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sandra Gonzáles se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en la ciudad de Chinandega en el mercado Santa Ana de esta localidad. Desde que inició su negocio se ha preocupado por mejorarlo para llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día con la necesidad de invertir en los productos, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus productos. Es de necesidad destacar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos los créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Hebreo, Group 1

texts.en: Francisca G., 36, is married and the mother of two, aged 2 and 13. She has used her four Esperanza loans to start her own clothing and accessory store, and hopes that her future loans will bring her business growth and her children everything they need. Francisca is a group leader in her Esperanza Bank of Hope, Hebreo.

loans.use: This group of women would like to improve their various businesses, like Fantasia who would like to improve her clothing and accessory business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Mr. Jaime G. owns a low-income dwelling in the city of Nuevo Laredo. He would like to install tile flooring in his house because its current cement floor is quite uncomfortable to live on.

Mr. G. works in a company all day long. His wife is the one who looks after the children. She is pictured above, since Mr. Garcia was at work.

He is requesting this loan from Kiva in order to purchase the materials necessary for the installation of tile flooring in his house because he currently does not have the funds necessary to do so due to his children’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Jaime G. es propietario de una vivienda económica en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo donde desea poner vitropiso en la casa ya que el que tiene actualmente es de cemento y es muy incomodo estar habitando la casa.

El Sr. Jaime trabaja todo el día y la que se encarga de los hijos y la casa es su esposa cuando se realizo la visita solo se encontraba la Sra. Emilia Perez y uno de sus hijos.

El esta solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para comprar el material necesario para colocar el vitroposo de su casa ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material por los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

loans.use: Installation of tile flooring

loans.name: Ena Cristina

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ena A. tengo un negocio de venta de abarroteria y mercaderia en general, este tipo de actividad es mi fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos, los cuales me ayudan a cumplir con los conpromisos y obligaciones que tengo. tengo 3 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar y estudian en la escuela Publicade la localidad, con el credito solicitado me permitira surtir mi negocio y brindar una mejor atencion a los clientes y por consiguiente agenciar mejores ganancias, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de mis hijos.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ena A. and I have a business where I sell dry goods and general merchandise. This is my primary source of income and allows me to pay for my expenses and commitments. I have three school-age children who attend our local public school. With this loan I will buy a wider variety of merchandise for my business in order to offer better customer service and improve my earnings so that I can improve my children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro inició el negocio por necesidades económicas, ya que requería contar con recursos para solventar los gastos de su familia y crearse un patrimonio, así como una forma de subsistir económicamente. Comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo materiales escolares poco a poco fue agregando otros objetos todos ellos de uso escolar así como servicio de copiadora, hasta que logro establecer su papelería.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramiro began his business because of economic needs since he required resources to settle family expenses and create a savings account. He began five years ago selling school materials and little by little adding other objects for school use like copying services and now he has succeeded in establishing his own stationary shop. He needs a loan for $475, which he will pay back in six months, to buy merchandise and be able to make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Mariela Sara

texts.es:
La señora Mariela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en el PSJ. El Parque Mz. D Lt. 12, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Tiene el apoyo de su hija para la atención de su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 8 kilos de arroz, 6 pollos, 4 racimos de plátanos, 2 kilos de azúcar, etc. 

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio ha crecido y gracias a ello su familia se siente contenta por todas las cosas que han logrado en la vida.
texts.en:
Mariela belongs to the Community Bank "Las Flores de Nuevo Eden" (meaning, The Flowers of New Eden) located at PSJ. El Parque Mz. D Lt. 12, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province de Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 35 years old, she is mother of 3 minor children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi. With the first loan she received Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in food sales. She has been 5 years with the Community Bank.

She is still running the same business. She has her daughter's support in managing the business.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 8 kg of rice, 6 chicken, 4 bunches of bananas, 2 kg of sugar, etc.

Thanks to the Community Bank her business has grown and thanks to this her family is happy for all of the things that have happened in their life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 8 kg of rice, 6 chicken, 4 bunches of bananas, 2 kg of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
