Olga, a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank, is 29 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Olga bakes traditional Peruvian bread three times per week in her in-laws’ oven and then sells the bread in various regional markets.

She is now requesting a loan to buy flour, and dreams of increasing her investment capital and owning her own home and oven.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy flour for bread.

loans.name: Chadulu 1 Group

texts.en:
Kuruthum owns a small charcoal store and sells alcohol in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 185 USD. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kuruthum is 29 years old, married, and has two children aged 11 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Emmi and Eliza. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more materials

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Kantuta.
Salome es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Salome tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donD. venD. cereales que adquiere D. las feriantes que le traen a su puesto, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Salome necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pallar, garbanzo, lenteja, arveja.
El sueño D. Salome es mejorar su negocio, surtiendo con mas productos.
texts.en:
Salome is a member of the community bank Kantuta. Salome is married. She is 60 years old and she has 4 children. Salome has a stall in the market of Playa Grau, where she sells cereal grains that she gets from the sellers who come to her stall, an activity that she does every day. Salome needs a loan of 2100 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of butter beans, garbanzo beans, lentils, and peas. Salome’s dreams are to improve her business, carrying more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy butter beans, garbanzo beans, lentils, and peas

loans.name: 08-Đông Hải Group

texts.vi:
* Nhóm 08 gồm 5 thành viên sống tại thôn Ái Sơn 1 xã Đông Hải,là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hoá .Chị Lê Thị N. làm nhóm trưởng ,năm nay chị 49 tuổi ,hàng ngày ngoài việc đồng áng, chị còn tranh thủ thời gian lên chợ mua hoa quả đi bán rong để có thêm thu nhập.Chồng chị là Trần Văn Năm ,làm ruộng.Gia đình chị có 2 người con , con gái đầu đã có gia đình riêng. Con trai út hiện  chưa có việc làm.Chị đang vay mức tiền là 3.079.800 VNĐ~180USD để đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua trái cây để bán.Các thành viên trong nhóm có cùng mức vay với chị.
* Chị N. Thị Hương vay vốn để mua trái cây về bán.
* Chị N. Thị Huệ vay vốn để mua gà giống về nuôi.
* Chị N. thị Kha vay vốn để mua gà giống về nuôi.
* Chị N. Thị Sen vay vốn để đàu tư vào hàng tạp hoá tại nhà.
texts.en:
Group 08 has five members. They live in Ái Sơn village number 1, Đông Hải commune, a poor village in Thanh Hoá province. Mrs. Lê Thị N., 49 years old, is the group leader. Each day, in addition to working in the rice fields, she spends part of her day going to the market to buy fruit, which she then sells door to door in order to earn some more income. Her husband, Trần Văn Năm, is a rice farmer. They have two children, an older daughter who has already married and a younger son who has not yet left home. Mrs. N. hopes to borrow 3,079,800 VND (~180USD) to invest expanding her fruit sales. The other members of the group are requesting loans of the same amount. Mrs. N. Thị Hương will use her loan to buy fruit which she can resell. Mrs. N. Thị Huệ will use her loan to buy breeding hens. Mrs. N. Thị Kha will use her loan to buy breeding hens. Mrs. N. Thị Sen will use her loan to invest in a small grocery shop she runs from her home.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales, breeding hens

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
K. is 48 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. He is the father of six children: two of them are married and live separately, and the other four are students and still need his help. He is married to Yoe, 50, who earns a living planting vegetables behind her house.

K. owns a set of video equipment providing a film show to the local people during ceremonies and parties. He is famous for his good service. Recently because his old electric machine is broken very often, he decided he needs to change it. So K. is taking a loan of US$ 500 to buy a new electric machine for his business. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. K. was not available for the photograph but his wife was photographed instead.

loans.use: To buy a new electric machine for his business

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu A. is 37 years old, divorced and mother of two children. Among her children, one is learning a trade and the other one is in school. Zenabu has sold frozen food in her local community for 15 years now. But she says income from the sales is very low since she pays high rent on the store she operates and the electricity cost is also high as she shares the power with another shop nearby.

She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen food to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself and also to stock her inventory. She also sells Fanti kenkey (a type of dumpling wrapped in leaves) by the road in her community where she lives. She needs the loan urgently and hopes to pay within the time limit. Zenabu belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help’. She hopes to receive a loan to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen food.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 30 years old and married with four children. He is a mechanic and he also sells motor spare parts.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.en:
S. Cao Thi (719020640) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant-aged children. She raises cattle for sale and has been engaged in this business for over 5 years, earning approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

S. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Don Juan Agustin con residencia  en el canton Poxlajuj del departamento D. Totonicapán  desD. joven aprendio el oficio D. tejedor, hoy cuenta con su pequeño taller  con cuatro telares y su principal producción es la elaboracion D. cortes tipicos para damas las cuales los  venD. en los municipio D. Totonicapán, Salcaja, y Chimaltenango, hoy necesita D. un credito para l compra D. materiales ya que tiene un pedido que entregar para el mes D. agosto ya que se celebra la fiesta D. la comunidad,
texts.en:
Don Juan Agustin lives in the Poxlajuj district in the department of Totonicapán. When he was young he learned how to weave. Today he has a small workshop with four looms where he weaves traditional clothes for women, which he sells in the municipalities of Totonicapán, Salcaja, and Chimaltenango. The loan will be used to purchase materials to fulfill an order to be delivered in August for a community festival.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. is the group leader of four who all live in Dei Eth Koh Pohs village in Kandal province.  She is 47 years old, a housewife, and the mother of three children, one of whom is a nurse, another is a laborer and the other is employed in a garment factory.

Her husband, Mr. Khun Sarin, is a construction worker. In his work, he does not have enough money to buy any construction supplies. Thus, Mrs. Chantha S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s work

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina T. is 49 years old and lives in Barangay Nabbotuan Solana, Cagayan with her family. She is married to Abelardo T. who is 48 years old and still strong and able to till their farm lot. They are blessed with 8 children. Josefina says that her children are her treasure in life, however she feels sad that she was not able to provide them with a better education.

Josefina runs a hog raising business to help her husband provide for their financial needs. She dreams of being successful in her business thus, she was motivated to request a loan of PHP15, 000 from Kiva lenders. She will utilize the loan in purchasing piglets, feed and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that the improvement of her business also depends on hard work and perseverance so she is trying her best to maintain those attitudes.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is doing pretty well in her rice farm business. She has been doing this since she got married to Ramel E., a farmer also. She has three children and her only wish is to be able to send all her kids to school and let them pursue a degree in the future.

She needs capital to grow her farm. She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 to be able to buy complete fertilizers and chemicals.

Now, she is actively participating in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides their clients loans, training, and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92658&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.  
Juana sigue  trabajando en  venta productos  de belleza por catalogo, pero ahora vende tres lineas de belleza.   
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza  para su stock. 
El préstamo ayuda mucho por que puede cubrir sus pedidos de sus clientas, por que a ella le pagan cada quince días y ahora ella cuenta con un capital. 
El sueño de Juana es que sus ventas  sigan creciendo y tener un puesto de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92658&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Juana is a member of the Triunfaremos Community Bank. Juana continues to work selling beauty products by catalog. But, now she sells three lines of beauty products. Juana needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beauty products for her stock. The loan helps a lot to be able to cover her customers’ orders. They pay her every 15 days, and now she has the capital. Juana’s dream is that her sales keep growing and that she has a clothing sales stall.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products for her stock

loans.name: Ndeye Adama

texts.fr: ndeye adama L. est une commercante en habillement plus precisemment en thioub.elle exerce cette activite depuis plus de sept ans.avec l'elargissement de son marche elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour aug,enter son fond et ,ieux soutenir sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Mission 7 Nandutu Juliet Group

texts.en: N. Juliet is twenty-four years old married with one boy child and looking after five dependents schooling. She has been selling milk for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase milk from farms for sell to her customers since most of them are on orders and more new other customers who come to her for milk. She is a hardworking business lady and the chair person of her group. Her future plan is to obtain a cow it self so that with time instead of purchasing milk for sale she will be milking from her cow and sell.

loans.use: To purchase milk from farms for sell to her customers

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Perpetua is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Perpetua owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing boating service to local community members. Perpetua has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perpetua joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perpetua is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perpetua from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA y cuatro con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. Con estos préstamos  su negocio a crecido y le a invertido, también sus ingresos se han mejorado.
Nueva mente quiere invertir en comprar mercancía y una refrigerador para la venta de carnes, quesos, lactaos y verduras. 
Pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la invenció y esta solicitando un nuevamente un crédito y es pera contar con su cooperación en esté nueva préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfredo Rodríguez has had two loans with Kiva and four with FVP. He has repaid them punctually. He invested in his business, and it has grown with these loans. Also, his income has improved. He wants to invest again and buy merchandise and a refrigerator to sell meat, cheese, dairy products, and vegetables. But, at this time he does not have the money necessary for this investment. He is asking for a new loan. He hopes to have your cooperation with this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and married with three children. She describes herself as hardworking. She lives and works in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has run a retail shop called Mama JJ, selling household goods, for four years. She previously had a business buying and selling used clothes and currently supplements her income with some small-scale farming. 

She is requesting a loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy sugar, wheat flour, and cooking fat for her shop. Catherine hopes to expand her shop into wholesale and hire many employees as her business expands. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy food items for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: personal use

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
La señora Rubí, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que aun depende de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Rubi is a member of the Communal Bank “Doradinas en Acción”, which is in the District of San José de Sisa, Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of four children of whom three are still dependent.

Rubi was motivated to start a small business selling groceries so that she could contribute to the household income. She obtained very good results from her first loan of 300 soles. From that point, she improved the quality of her products, offered affordable prices, and provided good customer service. Rubi continues to operate her business out of her home to this very day. Her main customers are neighbors from the area.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy more products to restock her business such as rice and sugar by the kilo, crates of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies, packs of sodas, candy, and other items to keep her customers happy. Rubi is very satisfied with her work and the service she provides. She thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work to get ahead. Rubi hopes to continue working for a long time and helping other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing U. is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a business man. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Blessing is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Blessing mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, Blessing helps her husband in meeting the basic needs of the home. She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Violeta Iduvina

texts.es:
Violeta es una madre de familia de 58 años de edad y tiene 7 hijos, vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 30 años que tiene necesidades especiales en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva más de un año a cargo de un restaurante que funciona en un grifo ubicado en la carretera Panamericana (la principal carretera del país que atraviesa la localidad), allí ella ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas a los transportistas, policías y diversos pobladores de la zona que frecuentan el lugar. Violeta nos comenta que antes trabajaba en restaurantes y que su sueño fue tener uno propio, gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio poco a poco, está saliendo adelante.

Violeta desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de bebidas e insumos para elaboración de comida con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio, pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Violeta aspira a seguir creciendo como empresaria y utilizar sus futuras ganancias en hacer mejoras en su casa. Ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable, es muy conocida por la zona en donde vive, sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer activa y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Violeta, 58, is the mother of 7 children. She lives with her husband and a 30-year-old daughter, who has special needs, in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last year she has run a restaurant located in a gas station alongside the Panamerican Highway (country's main highway that goes through the location). She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner to truck drivers, police officers, and various residents of the area that frequent the place. Violeta tells us that she used to work in restaurants and she's always dreamed of having her own. Thanks to her work effort, she has been getting ahead little by little. Violeta would like to enlarge her business buying beverages and ingredients needed to prepare her meals. However, she lacks the capital to do so. Therefore, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles. Violeta aspires to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to use her future profits to do some home improvements. She is a hard-working, very responsible mother who's well known in her area. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be an active woman who is always willing to help others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe se encuentra en la parroquia del mismo nombre, se caracteriza por sus artesanías, aquí que la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, y las personas jóvenes en su mayor parte han migrado al exterior por brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Este banco esta conformado por  mujeres luchadoras que se dedican a la agricultura,  cría de animales y a la elaboración de artesanías, actividades que han realizado desde que eran muy niñas y ha quedado como un legado familiar.

Laura V., vive en el barrio San Antonio en  la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, con quien ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 14, 13, 10, 8 años de edad, tiene casa propia que le fue heredada por sus padres pero su hermano hipoteco la casa para poder salir del país hacia los Estados Unidos llegando allá se olvido de la deuda por lo que su casa ahora se encuentra en remate, ahora tiene sus cosas en otro lugar y solo dejó la cama para cuidar la casa  hasta que la vendan.

Laura se dedica a la cría de animales pollos y cuyes actividad que realiza desde que se caso y los vende en la comunidad, también lava ropa y limpia casas ajenas ya la gente la conoce y a veces trabaja en esta actividad tres días a  la semana.

Se encuentra trabajando con los  prestamos de la fundación hace seis años invitada por su cuñada. Los préstamos le han beneficiado para su negocio de pollos y  con el préstamo que reciba de la institución comprará más pollos, maíz y vitaminas  para su crecimiento.

Su sueño es llegar a recuperar su casa o poder construir otra.

La señora María T. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe hace seis años  invitada por una amiga que ya no se encuentra en el banco,  mantiene una buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, ella vive el barrio San Antonio una comunidad del cantón Cumbe, tiene 47 años,  se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 28, 25, 22, 21, 16 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven en el exterior, solo uno de ellos  le ayuda económicamente,  su esposo también se encuentra en el exterior y con el esfuerzo de todos construyeron su casa propia.

 Ella se dedica a la cría de animales cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos los compra para engordarlos y los vende en la feria libre del  ganado, esta actividad  la  realiza hace mucho tiempo y le ha permitido estabilizarse un poco  económicamente.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va a pagar  los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos comprándoles uniformes nuevos y algunos libros que les hace falta, y con lo poco que le quede va  a comprar unos pollitos para criarlos.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos aprovechen el esfuerzo que realiza y que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Communal Bank is located in the village of the same name, which is known for its handicrafts. The majority of the population works in farming and cattle ranching and most of the young people have moved abroad to provide a better future for their families. The members of the bank are very industrious and work in farming, raising animals, and making crafts. They were raised with these activities and have maintained them as family traditions. Laura V., lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Cumbe and is 32 years old. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. They have five children, ages 17, 14, 13, 10, and 8. She lived in her own home, which she inherited from her parents, but her brother mortgaged it to be able to go to the United States. Once arriving in the States, he forgot about his debt and now the house is going to be auctioned off. She currently has her belongings in another location and only her bed remains in the home, taking care of it until it is sold. Since being married, Laura has raised chickens and guinea pigs to sell in her community. She also washes clothing and cleans houses, and often does this work three days a week. She was introduced to the foundation by her brother-in-law and began receiving loans six years ago. The loans she has received have helped her develop her chicken business, and she will use the current loan to purchase more chickens as well and corn and vitamins for their proper development. Her dream is to get her home back or to be able to build another. María T. has been a member of the Cumbe Communal Bank for six years. She was invited into the group by a friend who is no longer a member. She is good friends with the members of the group and is 47 years old. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Cumbe and is married. She has five children, ages 28, 25, 22, 21, and 16. Her two oldest children are married and live abroad, but only one of them helps her financially. Her husband is also abroad and his hard work has enabled them to build their own home. María raises guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs. She buys them to fatten up and sells them at the livestock fair. She has done this for quite some time and it has provided her some financial stability. She will use the funds from this loan to pay her children's school fees, purchase new uniforms, and some books that they need. She will use the remaining money to purchase some chicks to raise. Her biggest dream is that her children benefit from her efforts and finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, corn, and vitamins

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary R. is 36 years old and married to Martin Karanja. They have three school going children.  She has been manufacturing detergent soaps which she sells to her neighbors and friends in Naivasha town for the last year.  She now wants to open a cereals shop to run side by side with the detergent business hence increasing her income.

Mary was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She plans to use this money start another business of selling cereals in  the town of Naivasha. She plans to increase her soap detergent making business and start producing on a larger scale thereby serving more clients and increasing her future income.

loans.use: To open a retail shop to sell cereals as well as continue making detergents to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Ángel es casado con la Sra. Mirian ellos aun no tienen hijos se han casado hace poco tiempo viven en su casa propia.
Ángel se dedica a la venta de ropas femeninas y masculinas de varias marcas, venden en forma ambulante.
El 95% de sus ventas son a crédito tienen aproximadamente 150 clientes en toda la zona.
El se inicio en esta actividad con la ayuda de su Sra.  Que trabajaba en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Junto un poco de dinero que gano con mucho sacrificio realizando todo tipo de trabajos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Ángel is married, and his wife's name is Mirian. They have only been married a short time, and they do not yet have children. They live in a house that they own. Ángel's work is selling men's and women's clothing of various brands. He goes around to different places to sell his merchandise. 95% of his sales are on credit, and he has approximately 150 customers throughout the area. He began this activity with the help of his wife, who was working in a clothing store. He gathered together a little money which he had earned through much sacrifice, doing all types of work. Ángel has already had other loans with our organization, and he has fulfilled his obligations in an excellent manner.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing women's and men's clothing such as dresses, blouses, pants, shorts and shirts

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda T. is a 36-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is the mother of three children who are all of minor age. She is married to Wilfredo T., a vendor, and the salary of her husband is insufficient for their daily needs.

As a mother with big dreams, in 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a Microfinance Institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She started selling small items and it really helped them to meet their needs. 

Now on her ninth loan, she requests the amount of 20,000 pesos to purchase more inventory of her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for remote controls, antennae, playing cards, lighters, manicure sets, cotton buds, nail cutters, mirrors, tooth brushes, and other supplies.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her three children in school. She also dreams of building a concrete and durable house of their own.


About ASHI: Ahon SA Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her sales business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo C. Dávila es un productor que reside en una comunidad a unos 30 km de Condega lugar conocido como san jerónimo, donde él tiene una finca y se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agrícolas al cultivo de granos básicos frijol y maíz para comercializarlos y al cultivo del café, este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas 6 quintales de abono y 6 quintales de urea, este cliente con este crédito quiere comprar estos insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café en lo que se refiere a aplicación de productos que sirven para darle y asegurar sus cosechas. Este productor comenzó esta actividad de trabajo cuando en la década de los ochenta el estado le dio dos manzanas de cultivo de café con el programa de la reforma agraria que se dio en esa década. Este cliente actualmente se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agrícolas y ganadera siendo la actividad agrícola su principal forma y rubro de trabajo el siembra 4 manzanas de frijol y dos de maíz en épocas de invierno,  y al cultivo del café una vez cada año,  ya que su finca esta ubicada en una zona montañosa y de altura con condiciones para este tipo de cultivo del café,  todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividades de trabajo ya que desde pequeño el realizaba este trabajo en una pequeña finca de sus padres a quien él les ayudaba. Don Reynaldo C. con este financiamiento el espera poder darle a sus cultivos la asistencia que necesitan y de esa forma poder cosechar más y de mejor calidad, con esto el obtendrá mejor oportunidad de vender sus productos a un mejor precio ya que estos cultivos sobre todo el grano del café es un rubro de mucha importancia de comercialización ya que es un producto de exportación. 
Don Reynaldo C. es casado y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos están en edad escolar y estudian la primaria. Desde el año 2005 a don Reynaldo se le han otorgado 6 créditos para esta actividad de trabajos de campo. El impacto y beneficio por cada financiamiento recibido  este cliente es importante porque le ha permitido incrementar su actividad de trabajo cosechando más y mejor mejorando su nivel de vida, en todo este tiempo el logro construir su casita, comprar 4 vacas paridas 2 toretes, y de igual forma ha venido comprando más terreno ahora el tiene 4 manzanas de café y 6 manzanas para la agricultura y 4 de bosques. De esta manera se puede ver el beneficio que ha tenido este cliente y el crecimiento de su actividad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Don Reynaldo C. Dávila is a farmer who lives in the community of San Jerónimo located about 30km from Condega. He owns a small farm there and grows crops such as beans, maize and coffee which he then sells. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as 6 quintales (unit equal to 100lb) of fertilizer and 6 quintales of urea. Reynaldo will use these products on his coffee crops to ensure a good harvest. He began farming when, in the 1980s, the state gave him two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of land on which to grow coffee as part of the agrarian reform program. Nowadays he raises animals as well as growing crops. He sows beans on 4 manzanas and maize on 2 manzanas in the winter. He also sows coffee beans once a year as his farm is located in a high mountainous area with appropriate conditions for growing coffee. Reynaldo has done this kind of work since he was small, starting out by helping his parents on their small farm. With the loan he hopes to use the products on his crops so he can get a bigger and better-quality harvest. Then he will get the chance to sell the products for a better price, especially the coffee which is very important since it is an export crop. Don Reynaldo is married and has three children, two of whom attend primary school. He has had six loans since 2005 and used the money for his farm. The impact and benefits have been important as they have allowed Reynaldo to expand his farm, increase the harvests, and improve his quality of life. During this period he has built a small house, bought four cows that had recently given birth, two bullocks, and also more land. He currently has 4 manzanas growing coffee, 6 manzanas growing other crops, and 4 manzanas of trees. It is very clear that this client has benefited greatly from the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 18-year-old Hilda Ashery G. from Morogoro. She is single, with no children. Hilda has been running a tailoring business since 2008. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women.

She works at this business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Hilda is requesting a loan of  300,000 TSH in order to purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business  in order  to expand her business. Hilda thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mary Muthoni

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, 28 years old and a mother of one child. Her husband Edwin is a businessman. She lives at Pangani area near town. 

Mary operates a stationery shop along Kirinyaga Road in town. Her main customers are the offices in town and businesses within the area. She has operated the stationery shop as her primary business for about four years now.
 
Mary got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to buy items like box files, printing paper, writing pads, and other stationary.

She hopes to expand and grow her business, especially now that she has access to capital.

loans.use: To replenish her stock with items like writting materials, printing papers, photocopying papers, pens etc.

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business since 4 years. She is a LAPO client and she has a good repayment record. She is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is a police man and he also supports their home. Philo is very determined and wants to expand her business in order to make more profits. She requesting for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Philo says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana Luz Gómez Hernández tiene 53 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, es casada y tiene dos hijos mayores, actualmente vive solamente con su esposo.
Ana Luz se dedica desde hace 16 Años a la compra y venta de ropa, para adultos y niños como son (camisas, pantalones, camisones, piyamas, toalla y otros), tiene su puesto en  el Mercado de Jucuapa, ella  muy temprano de  6:00 am - 5:00 pm ofrece  sus productos a personas que visitan el lugar,  así  obtiene ingreso que le ayudan a sostener su hogar el cual le ha servido para sacar a delante a sus hijos y con algunas ganancias mantener el negocio. 
Ana aspira mejorar su venta de Ropa por lo que necesita el préstamo el  cual le servirá para compra de diferentes prendas como son vestidos, faldas, para ofrecer variedad de prendas con estilos nuevos, esta inversión es  una oportunidad para que Ana pueda mantener su trabajo  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Luz Gómez Hernández is 53 years old, she lives in the town of Jucuapa, in the Usulután province; she is married had has two adult children, and she now lives with her husband only. Ana Luz has been working in the clothing sale business for 16 years: she buy clothes for adults and children (shirts, trousers, nightgowns, pyjamas, towel and other), she has her stall in the Jucuapa market, and she works form 6 am to 5 pm, offering her products to customers visiting the town; this way she gains the money that helps her support her family, give a good education to her children and keep the business running. Ana wants to improve her clothing sale business and this is why she is asking for a loan: she will use it to buy different garments like dresses, suits and skirts, in order to offer a variety of clothes with new styles; this investment is an opportunity for Ana to be able to keep her job and to improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is from the village of Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a business selling clothing. Ruth has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

 In 2008, Ruth joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken  out by Ruth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ready to wear clothes to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Bwaloni Group

texts.en:
Cleophas P., aged 42, is married and has three children aged 13, 16 and 21. For the past eight years, he has worked as a cameraman taking and selling photos. He works from 8am to whatever time required – he can work up to midnight or beyond because he sometimes gets a contract for an occasion such as a wedding. He is able to make a monthly profit of around $47.
This will be Cleophas’ second motisha (motisha is to motivate good payers) loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to buy a camera. He is now requesting a loan to improve his office.
Cleophas will share this loan with his loan group, Bwaloni, which is made up of eight men and women from his community. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Cleophas is third from the left.

loans.use: To improve his office

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en: Ma. Liz P. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a bakeshop, a general store and a meat and fish vending business. Her husband, Kenny P., age 39, works as a dive master to earn his living. They have five children who are 10 months to 16 years old. Ma. Liz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 6 years ago because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Ma. Liz has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her increase her monthly profit to 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital primarily for her bakery and also for her other business activities. She will continue to save up for the future and improve her family's living conditions. Ma. Liz P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Jairo Rolando

texts.es: Jairo Rolando es un joven muy emprendedor y luchador, Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la elaboración de pastes, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues gracias a ellos es que ha mejorado. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, sus inicios comenzaron desde joven con su esposa, el siempre le enseña a sus hijos que deben de trabajar fuerte para obtener lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de hilos, telas, tijeras y bejuco producto esencial para la elaboración.
texts.en:
Jairo Rolando is an enterprising and determined young man who has three dependent children. His business involves making bath scrubbers. This is not the first time he has received a loan and he has been able to make improvements using these funds. Jairo started this business with his wife more than five years ago when he was just a young man. He always tries to teach his children that they should work hard to obtain the things they need.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy thread, fabric, scissors, and “bejuco” (a natural plant fiber). These products are essential for making his products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making bath scrubbers

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BENNO est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de huit (8) femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Madame Astou D. au milieu debout au milieu sur la photo a était considérée comme absente du fait que son visage n’apparait pas. 

Ndiagna D., debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo, vêtue de grand boubou wax multicolore, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants et elle est aussi responsable de 06 enfants de sa jeune sœur. 

Elle vend de la bouillie de mil qu'elle prépare de ses mains. Elle vend également des tissus et des chaussures pour dames qu’elle achète à Dakar. Elle a une expérience d'environ de 10 ans dans ce domaine d'activité.
Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter de la marchandise en quantité plus importante pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. (Acheter du mil, des tissus et des chaussures pour dames)

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture et ses neveux. Et renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Benno was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 8 women who are all from the same neighborhood. They know each other due to friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Astou D., standing in the middle of the photo, is considered as being asbent because her face is not visible. Ndiagna D., standing on the far right of the photo, wearing a Grand Boubou made out of multicolored Wax (a colorful cloth), is the group's leader. She is 50 years old. She is divorced and lives with her 3 children and she also takes care of her sister's 6 children. She sells millet porridge that she makes herself. She also sells fabrics and women's shoes that she buys in Dakar. She has been doing this for 10 years. Her new loan will allow her to buy more merchandise so she can increase her profits. (She wants to buy millet, fabrics, and women's shoes.) Her goal is to take care of her own children and her nephews, as well as increase her savings.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase millet, fabrics, and women's shoes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda B. is from the village of Namabbalan Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling banana chips in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Razia Abdul Sattar's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married to A. S. who runs a grocery shop in his local area. She lives with her family in the mid-sized Pakistani city of Vehari, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in this city since her marriage many years ago.
Razia is a seamstress and sews clothes for customers in her neighborhood in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She learned her sewing skill from her mother and started working independently after her marriage. Her mother was unable to provide Razia with an education but she gave her a skill that will benefit her at every step of life. Razia is also a very good housewife. Alongside her business she deals with her responsibilities as a mother and wife very well.
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries for his grocery shop to increase his sales and income. Razia hopes that this investment will bring a good profit to add to her family's income and that they will be able to enjoy a better standard of living.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Katia Judith

texts.es: La señorita Katia es soltera no tiene hijitos, vive en la casa de su Mama, es independiente. Cuenta con un capital de trabajo propio, su actividad económica es el servicio de fletes de trajes típicos y otros, ella también borda los trajes y los confecciona se encuentra instalado en una tienda  que esta en alquiler. Tiene bastantes clientes en especial tiene contactos con los colegios quienes usan estos trajes en las distintas actividades festivas. El crédito que solicita es para aumento de capital para poder surtir más su negocio, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Katia is single and she has no children. She lives with her mom, although she is independent.  She has her own source of income. She makes traditional clothing and other garments. She also embroiders clothing in a shop she has rented. She has a good client base, especially because she has contracts with the schools that use uniforms and outfits for various festivities. The loan will be used as working capital to purchase inventory for her business. She is very grateful with the organization for the support provided.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make uniforms.

loans.name: Paul Kipkalum

texts.en:
Paul Kipkalum K. is 47 years old and married to Kosgei, who is a housewife. They have three school-going children, aged seven, 10 and 12 years old, respectively. Their residence is in Tuiyo Eldoret, Kenya. He has been in the business of selling milk for 15 years and earns a monthly profit of 25,000 KES.

Paul learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy milk for resale. With the anticipated profits he plans to expand his milk business.

In the future, Paul wishes to have rental houses. His deeper desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es un joven padre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su pequeña hija en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la comercialización de artículos de respuestos para bicicletas, el cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda donde suele ofrecer en venta su mercadería a los vecinos de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente de aves de corral, el las cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde reside.

Reynaldo desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales adquiriendo más aves y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 22, is a young father.  He lives with his wife and daughter in Lagunas, a rural area in Lambayeque province, about an hour and a half from the Peruvian city of Chiclayo.

Reynaldo has operated a bicycle parts business for more than two years.  He has a small shop in his house where he sells his merchandise to customers in the neighborhood.  He also operates a poultry business, raising and selling young birds that he keeps in a poultry yard behind his house.  When the birds are ready for sale, he sells them to the wholesalers who pass through the neighborhood.

Reynaldo wants to expand his poultry business, buying more birds and a balanced feed, so that he can increase his sales and, in turn, his earnings.  To meet his goal, he is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a S/.2,000 new soles loan.  

Reynaldo is a responsible man, ambitious to get ahead.  Those who know him like and respect him.

loans.use: Buy birds and feed for poultry business.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
la señora Claudia Lorena C. V. esta casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se  dedica  a la elaboracion de sal.
Claudia tiene una pulperia ubicada en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta en su casa de habitacion. ahí vende carnes, pollo, granos basicos, refrescos de botella, jugos y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
sus clientes son personas que vivien cerca de su casa y amigos que ella tiene, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
 
su meta para este año nuevo es reconstruir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Lorena C. V. is married and has two children.  He husband works making salt.  

Claudia has a small store located in the neighborhood of Buena Vista in the city of San Lorenzo.  The store is located in the house where she lives.  She sells beef, chicken, basic grains, bottled sodas, juices and everything related to basic family needs. Her customers are people that live near her house, as well as her friends.  The store is open from Monday to Sunday. 

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to stock her store. 

Her goal for this year is to reconstruct her house.

loans.use: Buy soap, eggs, toothpaste, toilet paper, pills, candles, matches, hot sauce, beans, rice, sugar, cinnamon, flour, bread, coffee, crackers, lard, oil, margarine, meat and dairy products

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nélida; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia
alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de sabanas, colchas, cobertores
entre otros más, la socia tiene su stand en el centro comercial El Molino la cual trabaja
conjuntamente con su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nélida belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Nélida is 52 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sheets, bedspreads, quilts, etc.  She has a stand in the El Molino shopping mall and she works there together with her family.

Nélida is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (sheets, bedspreads, quilts)

loans.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en: Erdene-Oyun T. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works for a brick making factory and her two young children both attend a local kindergarten. She currently operates a grocery trading business out of a stall at a local market. She started her business in 2008 selling only ice cream. After years of successful operation, she has expanded her business by increasing her product line to include a variety of food products. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to grow her business and have her own shipping container. Her earnings have enabled her to start building a house in her yard. She says, "I hope to finish building my house by this coming spring." She is requesting a 1,950,000 MNT loan in order to import more fruits from China at wholesale price.

loans.use: To import more fruits from China at a wholesale price

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred O. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Mildred is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mildred joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mildred from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while the others are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over 10 years, she has operated a business selling lesos/khangas (traditional African cloth) from home to her neighbors. In addition, she has real-estate houses for rent, which contributes to her other source of income. Mauwa faces a major challenge of competition from other cloth sellers. She hopes to increase stock and get more profit in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bale of lesos/khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of lesos/khangas (traditional African cloth) for resale

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 42 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El cultivo de la arveja, papa y maíz es la actividad a la que se dedica Benedicto, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos son muy peligrosos. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más, para aumentar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de arveja, que necesitará para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Benedicto, 42, is an unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house and what he most wants is to work hard to get ahead in life.  Benedicto is a pea, potato and corn farmer.  Every day he rises early to go work his fields with the only end to insure that his crops are of good quality.

What he enjoys most about the work is cultivating the land.  He’s been in this occupation for 20 years and considers the most difficult part fumigating the land because the chemicals are very dangerous.  In time he hopes to plant more to increase production.

This is his 5th loan with MFP.  He knows that he must repay on time if he wants to access future loans.  He is a very responsible, active member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more pea seeds that he will need for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: Trouk

texts.en: Trouk H., 48, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. H. raises pigs, earning an income of $3.3 USD per day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 USD on food and $60 USD on other necessary expenses. H. is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more pigs for resale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. has been selling fried fish at Jukwa near Abura (Cape Coast) for 10 years. Married to a farmer, she and her husband have four children. They rely on her earnings to pay school fees and the household utility bills. She buys her fish from Elmina, which has a major fish market and plans to use her loan to purchase more fish to increase the volume of her sales. She intends to save the extra profits for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, in the Mvumilifu group. For nine years, he has been operating a retail shop and cafeteria. He serves a good number of customers each day. He also does farming for extra income. He has been able to educate his five children with the income from his business. Paul has managed to grow his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy soda, bread and mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.use: to buy soda, bread and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 36 años, vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia. Noemí se dedica a la agricultura en donde tiene por objetivo sembrar maíz, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, por lo que también le resulta muy rentable. De esta manera vende todas sus cosechas a un precio que le permite recuperar lo invertido, sabe que en cada jornada de trabajo es arduo tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, por ello necesita contratar mano de obra de jornaleros, quienes la ayudan en este trabajo esforzado; asimismo su familia la ayuda en esta actividad. Para ella es importante invertir éste último crédito en la preparación de sus terrenos, de dar los nutrientes suficientes para que sea más fértil y asegurar una buena producción, es por esta razón que continuará adelante con esta actividad. Es su crédito número 5 que tiene con MFP, se encuentra entusiasmada de ver un crédito de manera grupal porque considera que aprendió bastante para el beneficio económico de su familia. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Noemí, 36, lives with her children in her own house.  She is a farmer and her objective is to plant corn, a product that has high market demand which makes it very profitable.  She sells all her harvests at a price that allows her to recuperate her investment.  She realizes that each work day is hard both during planting and during harvesting so she needs to hire laborers to help with the most strenuous tasks; her family also helps out with these activities.  For her, it’s important to invest this latest loan in the preparation of her fields, to provide sufficient nutrients to make them more fertile thus assuring a good crop yield.  Because of this, she’ll continue to go forward with this activity.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is excited to be in a group loan because she feels she’s learned a lot for her family’s benefit.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure for her next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Afoussetou

texts.fr: Mme Afoussetou est âgée de 35ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants et est mariée à un militaire. Elle revend des produits de premières nécessités (savon, lait, sucre, huile végétale, riz…)   au marché de Kégué après l’avoir acheté au grand marché de Lomé. Elle fait cette activité depuis 2006. Ce second prêt lui servira  à acheter des produits de premières nécessités afin d’accroitre son activité et s’occuper en partie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Afoussetou is 35 years old. She is the mother of two children and is married to a military serviceman. She re-sells basic necessities (soap, milk, sugar, vegetable oil, rice, etc.) at the Kégué market after buying these items at the grand market in Lomé. She has run this business since 2006. This second loan will serve to buy basic necessities in order to enlarge her business and thus contribute in part to the care of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell primary necessities (milk, sugar, rice, etc).

loans.name: Kidemi Turpesio

texts.en:
Kidemi Turpesio N., 27-year old, single, and supports his parents. He has been a farmer for the past four years, with a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Kidemi was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He paid his first loan back well and he applied for his second loan, which he will use to buy farm inputs. 

With the profits generated, he plans to expand his farming efforts and venture into a livestock keeping business. He dreams to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol tiene ya mas de tres años de dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes en su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto el frente de la casa ya que actual mente tiene el negocio en su propia casa y es muy incomodo atender así a su cliente porque no tiene toda la mercancía en exhibición. 
Pagara el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso. 
Desea tener un espacio solo para su negocio e independiente de su casa.
texts.en:
Marisol has been selling groceries from her home for more than three years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can build an extra room in the front of her house since her business is currently located in the house itself and it is very uncomfortable having to serve her customers this way because she doesn't have all her merchandise on display.

Marisol will repay her loan with some of the profits that she makes in her business since it is her source of income.  She would like to have a space which is just for her business and separate from her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her premises

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, 36, is married with four children. He has had his own agriculture business since 2009, specializing in plowing fields, transporting water and in construction materials. Hasan works hard to provide his children and wife with living necessities, working in several areas to make sure he can cover their needs.

Hasan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles and is in good standing. His previous loan had a good impact on his business and his family's situation. This time, Hasan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy tools needed for his tractor, such as a machine that can be fixed on the tractor and spread antibacterial medicines over planted areas.

Hasan works hard on improving his transportation business to stay loyal to his clients and fulfill their needs. He hopes to buy all the agricultural machines that will help to expand his work.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for his tractor.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana de 42 años convive co Roberto de 47 años, juntos tienen 2 hijos, Jonatan de 22 años, Yeison de 7 años; ellos viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Feliciana desde muy niña siempre estuvo inquieta, no le gustaba estar sin hacer nada, ella cuanta oportunidad se presentaba los ayudaba a sus padres en los quehaceres de su hogar. Desde hace 25 años se dedica en la venta de ropa, para todo público en general. Recuerda que en su primer año le fue difícil, en el  segundo año se empezó a nivelar, después de los años siguientes fue muy bendecida, por que sus ventas se incrementaban. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Para el futuro espera ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de posicionarse en el mercado. Este será su primer empréstito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea adquirir más prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 42 years old and lives with her partner, 47 year-old Roberto.  They have two children: 22 year-old Jonatan and 7 year-old Yeison.  The family live in their own home in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.  Feliciana has always been restless since she was a little girl; she never liked sitting around not doing anything.  When the opportunity presented itself, she would help her parents with their household chores.

For 25 years now, Feliciana has been selling clothes to the general public.  She recalls that her first year was difficult, in her second year she started to get things on an even keel and from then on she was very blessed because her sales increased.  In general, she works on her own but she sometimes receives help from her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store with the goal of positioning herself in the market.

This will be Feliciana's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She would like to use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casada e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais nao lembra as respectivas idades so que todos sao maiores de idade. Não estudou. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os netos que tambem vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Marracuene, e comerciante permanente a mais de 22 anos e tem um rendimento de 24.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem e cliente e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, ferro, blocos, areia , e outros ).
sonho e concluir a sua obra,e mobiliar para propor mais conforto a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Felismina was born in the district of Marracuene in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 7 children whose respective ages she she doesn't remember, only that they're all adults.  She did not go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her grandchildren that live with her.

She never left Marracuene.  She has had a business for more than 22 years.  She makes 24,000 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her first loan in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (stone, cement, iron, bricks, sand, etc.).

Her dream is to finish her home and to furnish it to provide more comfort to her family.  She plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku to do this.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, cement, iron, bricks, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa is a single mother of two children. She sells aluminum basins in Elmina by moving around the area.

Abenawa wants to increase the quantity of basins she sells and so needs a loan to buy more basins. With her increase in profits, Abenawa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more basins to sell.

loans.name: Juana Candelaria

texts.es: Juana Candelaria D. 39 años D. edad, habita con su esposo Manuel D. 35 años y su hijo D. 14 en casa familiar. Juana es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar D. residencia. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo D. varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Juana lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza D. muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a su hijo una mejor calidad D. vida y sabe que la única fuente D. ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no pueD. descuidarse D.  el, por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo D. productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y D. más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que D. esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Juana Candelaria is 39 years old and lives with her husband, Manuel who is 35, and their 14 year old son in a family home. Juana is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Some years ago she decided to start her own small business in her home. The business is a small store and with much work and dedication she has been able to keep it running for several years. Juana has a lot of customers since for her they are very important, she always takes care of them with a smile and kindness and also has what they need which is why she has been able to get the trust of many of her customers around her neighborhood. Juana dreams of giving her son a better quality of life and knows that the only source of income is her small business which is why she can’t neglect it and each day she works hard to keep it active. This is why she needs the loan from INTEGRAL, to be able to invest in her store and stock it with all types of products like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent and other appealing products for her customers. Juana trusts that this is the way that she will be able to see her dream come true.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
María de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace unos 4 años aproximadamente María se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc), verduras y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
