Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y verduras, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su hogar.  María es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades y mejoras para toda la familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. The house has no basic services and is located in the rural district of Olmos in the department of Lambayeque. This area is known for its agriculture and livestock production.

For about 4 years Maria has been selling groceries (products used on a daily basis such as: milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.), vegetables and beverages. For her own safety and comfort, she has set up the business in her own house. With the proceeds from the sale of her products she tries to cover all her costs and improve her family's standard of living.

In order to carry out her business, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy more goods and vegetables, with the sole purpose of growing her business, having more products available for her customers and meeting her loan obligations and household expenses. Maria is a responsible person, dedicated and hard-working who cares about providing more household amenities and improvements for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy more goods and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, he wants to purchase cloth materials to sell during the festive season. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials to sell during the festive season.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is  a hardworking businessman aged 27 and he is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a pharmacy to earn a living. He has been able to retain his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years, he wants to open a clinic. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 22 años vive con sus padres en Cayambe que está a media hora de Otavalo en el norte de Ecuador. Yolanda se describe como una persona muy responsable en su trabajo.

Trabaja con sus padres en el ordeño de vacas para vender la leche. Es su segundo crédito que le solicita a Fodemi el cual va a ser utilizado en la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción y sus ventas lo cual le ayuda considerablemente para mantener a su familia.

Su sueño es poder construir un establo para poder tener mayor cantidad de vacas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Cayambe which is half an hour from Otavalo, in the north of Ecuador.  Yolanda describes herself as somebody who is very responsible in her work. 

Yolanda works with her parents milking cows so that they can sell their milk.  This is the second loan that she has requested from Fodemi and she will use it to buy a dairy cow to increase her production and her sales.  This will help her a lot in supporting her family.

Yolanda's dream is to build a stable so that she can keep a larger number of cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante para poder mejorar su calidad de vida, ella es casada tiene dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad; la Sra. Ana tiene su propia moto taxi la cual alquila, lleva alquilando su moto por mas de 3 años con una rentabilidad muy buena. Ella con sus ahorros pudo comprarse dicha moto y así poder tener una renta para su hogar, el crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de una cocina por necesidad personal. La Sra. Ana tiene el sueño de tener su casa propia y tener un restaurante. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que es un gran apoyo para su hogar.
texts.en: Señora Ana is a determined, hard-working woman with great desire to succeed and improve her standary of living. She is married, with 2 children aged 8 and 7. Señora Ana has her own moto-taxi for hire. She has been driving her moto-taxi for more than 3 years, and making a good profit. She was able to buy the moto-taxi with her savings, and thus bring an income into her home. She is going to invest the loan in buying a kitchen for her own use. Señora Ana has the dream of having her own house and owning a restaurant. She is very grateful for the credit extended to her because it means a great improvement for her home.

loans.use: to purchase a kitchen

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for two years, starting with 1,200,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His vision is a wholesale business plus a model family home. Godfrey needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Payka

texts.ru: Пайка проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем. У них двое детей. Ее муж строитель. Сама она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Payka lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Payka has a small plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for over 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and electricity.

For the past five years, she has operated a beauty salon and cosmetic business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passers-by. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.  

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics to improve her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es:
Erick Alexander   vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business

Erick es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, él  trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano haciendo taxi en su moto.
Él es un hombre perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de salir cada día adelante. 
Erick empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en el servicio de transporte, por lo que es mas rentable y económico, ganando semanalmente S/.250 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 6 días a la semana. No ha tenido créditos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000 que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Erick invertirá su crédito para la compra de su propia moto y así tener mayores ingresos y poder así ayudar a sus padres que son de avanzada edad. También su crédito permitirá a Erick a desarrollarse en el futuro, él sueña con tener su propia casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y puede pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Erick Alexander lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Erick is a single 29-year-old man who offers an urban transportation service; he provides a taxi service on his motorcycle.
He is a persevering and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead every day.
Erick started his business in 2008. Transportation is more profitable and economical. He makes 250 nuevos soles per week. He works about ten hours every day, six days a week. He has never taken out a loan. With this loan of 1000 soles, which he will receive thanks to Kiva, Erick will invest in buying his own mototaxi in order to make a better income and to be able to help his aging parents. This loan will also allow Erick to develop himself in the future. He dreams of having his own home and offering his parents a better quality of life.
His credit assessor believes that he is an excellent client and will be able to repay his quotas punctually.

loans.use: to purchase his own mototaxi.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 40 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sopheap sells food. Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase two cows to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy two cows to raise for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a mother of five children. Two of the children are still schooling and the rest are adults. She is aged 43 and has been active in farming for 10 solid years selling farm produce such as maize, milk and vegetables to the local market.

Agnes has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will boost her farming income and enable her to advance her farming business with a modern zero grazing unit as well as buy better breeds of animals.

She laments the high costs of farming inputs and unreliable rainfalls.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ma. De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Ma. de Jesús  es soltara y vive en una localidad muy bonita ella es soltera y vive son una hermana.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  y venta de pollos en donde lleva trabajando  tres años  y dos meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a mejorado muchos su ingresos  para su hogar.
  
   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que  también  quiere tener sus propios ingresos para apoyarse con algunos gastos que se generan  en la compra de sus alimentos.
    
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando para  tenr sus ingresos necesarios para su familia con la que vive.
texts.en:
Ma. de Jesús is single and lives in a very pretty community. She lives with a sister. 

She asked for the loan to invest in buying and selling chickens. She has been doing this for three years and two months and she remarks that it is going well for her since it has really improved the income for her home.  
  
Her inspiration for this activity started because she wanted her own income to pay for some expenses for food. 
    
What she wants the most with this small activity is to keep working to have the income she needs for her family, with whom she lives.

loans.use: to fund buying and selling chickens.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 37-year-old business lady who is married to John. They are blessed with three children. 

She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Monicah will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a wholesale shop that will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El joven Ariel es soltero, tiene 20 años, a pesar de su corta edad tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y buscar un capital propio para su negocio, no tiene hijos, el vive en casa de sus papas en la localidad de sacaba zona central, el  joven  Ariel se dedica a la venta de repuestos de movilidad  todos los días de 08:30 de la mañana a 18:30 de la tarde y se toma un día de descanso que son los días domingos esto para aprovechar y estar con sus hermanos y compartir con su familia,  el préstamo lo invertirá para aumentar su stock de repuesto ya que tiene varios pedidos de talleres de mecánica con quienes trabaja, el Joven Ariel es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que le echa mucho empeño a su trabajo ya que es u única fuente de ingresos para sustentarse.
texts.en:
Ariel, 20, is single.  Despite his young age he very much wants to get a head and seeks capital for his own business.  He does not have children and lives in his parents’ house in Sacaba, Zona Central.  

Young Ariel sells auto spare parts every day from 8:30am until 6:30pm and takes just Sundays off to rest and to spend time with his siblings and his family.  He will use the loan to increases his stock of spare parts since he has several pending orders from repair shops that he works with.  Young Ariel is an enterprising, hardworking person who puts a lot of effort into his work since it’s his only source of income for his support.

loans.use: to increase his stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Omuhereza

texts.en: Omuhereza is a 51-year-old married woman with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a produce store and has been operating it for 21 years now. She started with a retail shop and later ventured into a wholesale produce store. She lacks enough capital to purchase in bulk all the necessary grains for milling and her desire is to have two stores. Omuhereza intends to use the loan facility to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pago matricula y mensualidad de universidad de hija

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business'stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy matchboxes, plastic utensils, laundry detergents, beverages for her  retail shop

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy T. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 young children.  Tuy T. rents a home and earns $2/day, while her husband rents cars and earns $17/day.  Tuy T. will use this loan so that her family can own another car to rent out.  As her husband's business continues to grow, their family would like to keep purchasing cars for rental and eventual sale.  T. is confident that she will be able to send her children to university, and she hopes one day they can build a brand new home.

loans.use: To buy a car for daily rental

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
S. Alijon has been in business for 7 years. He is married and has 2 children, both in school. His wife is a housewife. They live with his elderly parents and of course care for them.

S.'s stall is located in the center of Panjshanbe market. The turnover of his business is fast. He started receiving loans 4 years ago and has slowly increased the loan amount from US$ 100 to US$ 1000. He buys rice from constant suppliers every month in 300kg lots. He wants to increase the turnover of his business and plans to buy rice with the US$ 700.

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Gapé, Togo. She is married and mother of 10 children. Her ne’er-do-well husband is drives a motorcycle taxi but scarcely manages to support his family. Born into a poor family, Mrs. A. began early with the business of preparing beans and gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple food) for sale. This is her main business undertaking and she works hard at it in spite of her meager resources.

A. would like to expand her micro-business, but she does not have the necessary capital to do so. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 600 which will allow her to build a shed and to purchase raw materials for her production of basic staples for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akossiwa est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Gapé. Elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Son mari malafoutier et conducteur de taxi moto arrive difficilement à supporter sa famille. Issue d’une famille pauvre, Madame A. Akossiwa s’est adonnée très tôt à la préparation et à la vente du haricot et gari. Cette activité est la toute première qu’elle exerce avec bravoure malgré son infirmité.

Elle cherche aujourd’hui à renforcer cette activité mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $600 qui va lui servir de construction d’un hangar, à l’approvisionnement des matières premières pour la préparation et la vente du haricots.

loans.use: build a shed and buy raw materials for her staple food production

loans.name: Rossen

texts.es:
Doña Rossen is 29 years old. Her mother passed away when she was still very young, but thanks to the good example and values taught her by her father she is successful in her work supported by the strength given to her by her 2 young children.

At the present she is selling watches/clocks from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. at the busy Túpac Amaru market, and thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to cover the basic needs of her family.

Doña Rossen and her children live with her 2 sisters and her model father who help her take care of the children while she is working. Her business is profitable and she believes she can get better economic benefits if she can increase the merchandise and thus offer a higher life quality to her affectionate family.

She is asking for a loan of $275 so she can invest in buying more watches/clocks and offer more variety and she plans to repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Rossen tiene 29 años de edad y quedó huérfana de madre cuando aún era muy jovencita, gracias al buen ejemplo y valores que su padre le inculcó está sobresaliendo en su actividad con la fuerza que le emiten sus 2 niños menores. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de relojes en el mercado Túpac Amaru, lugar muy concurrido de su ciudad debido a ello realiza la labor a la que diariamente se dedica de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación en este trabajo ha podido apaciguar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Rossen y sus niños viven junto a sus 2 hermanas y su ejemplar padre, quienes la apoyan en el cuidado de sus hijos mientras ella trabaja; considera que el trabajo que tiene es rentable y cree que obtendrá mayor beneficio económico aumentando la cantidad de su mercadería y con este ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su afectuosa familia. A raíz de este hecho solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares, dinero que le permitirá invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de relojes y se compromete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock and buy more variety of watches/clocks

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
We found Maria assiduously taking care of her small business, located inside a relative’s home. She provides an arcade of sorts with great responsibility for the children of her community. With the support and initiative of her husband, she undertook this venture a few years ago. She demonstrates love and determination not only in her business activities but also in her role as a homemaker. Her job fills her with joy and satisfaction since it permits her to guide and contribute to her beloved family. Thanks to her daily efforts, she recently bought a small plot of land, and for this reason, she works diligently with one goal in mind: to be able to start construction on the house that she so greatly yearns for. In order to make her objective concrete, this exemplary mother wishes to improve the services she offers, upgrading her machines and expanding her shop with the aim of offering better comfort to her customers. Let’s help Maria in achieving her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Expansion of shop and upgrading video game consoles

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is an entrepreneurial woman with great desires to grow her business so she can support her family and at the same time, have a higher standard of living with better income.

For 10 years, Maria Auxiliadora has dedicated herself to the sale of chemicals and base products. Her sales increased since she has been enlarging her store and improving the structure of it. Her seed capital was $1000, which was obtained through a loan.

Maria Auxiliadora has been working with CEPRODEL for three years and she feels very content with the loans that have been lent to her at timely moments. The loans helped her to meet her business's needs and satisfy her customers' daily demands. She has a record of 15 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Maria Auxiliadora es una mujer Soltera emprendedora con grandes deseos consolidar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia y al mismo tiempo tener un mejor nivel de vida con mayores ingresos económicos.

Desde hace Diez años Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de productos de embase y químicos, sus ventas incrementaron, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de U$1,000.00 (dólares) los cuales obtuvo a través de un préstamo.

Maria Auxiliadora trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Tres años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Quince créditos.

loans.use: invest in her business

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Gulmurod S., 53, is married and has 8 children. He owns a piece of land where he plans to grow wheat. Gulmurod has been growing wheat for 6 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel. Gulmurod’s customers would then be able to purchase wheat at lower-than-market prices and make flour and bread. Gulmurod S. plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сохибназаров Гулмурод, возраст – 53 года, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Гулмурод имеет участок земли на котором планирует посеять пшеницу. Клиент уже в течение 6 лет занимается посевом пшеницы. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести семена пшеницы и горюче-смазочные материалы для трактора, который будет вспахивать его землю. Кредит даст возможность клиенту купить все необходимое для засева участка, а также после сбора урожая метсные жители смогут приобрести у него пшеницу по ценам ниже рыночных и использовать ее на переработку в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel

loans.name: Javid

texts.en:
Javid M. has been reselling cars for 10 years. He is an expert mechanic. In his business, he purchases one car at a time, performs a tune up, and any major repairs that are necessary. Then he details and resells the car for profit.

Mr. M. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam and his business is in Baku. He is married and has two children. The car pictured is a good vehicle that will bring him a substantial profit, but he needs this loan to buy used spare parts. Javid is a community man who provides reliable vehicles to other IDPs in his community.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Francisco Higinio

texts.es:
In Chinandega city, specifically in the Villanueva area there are many convenience stores near each other that service their customers with different products. Knowing this, Mr. Francisco Calderón has offered a variety of products in his store over the past 7 years.

Today he has the responsibility of supporting his family, a wife and three children, with their only income being that from the convenience store. It is important to note that his wife and children greatly support him and the business and with a united family their quality of life is better.

IN spite of the adversities that have happened they have bettered their quality of life and the need they have today is to acquire financing to invest in products for the store. For that reason they have sought the support of CEPRODEL to get a loan that will enable them to buy products to then sell in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente hablando del municipio de Villanueva existen muchas pulperías cercanas que atienden a sus clientes con diferentes productos. Muy consiente de esto, el señor Francisco Calderón se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su sector ofreciendo variedad de productos desde hace 7 años.

Actualmente posee la responsabilidad de mantener su núcleo familiar que consta de sus tres hijos y de su esposa siendo su único ingreso el de la pulpería. Es importante recalcar que su esposa e hijos le apoyan grandemente en el negocio y por ello la familia unida hace que sus condiciones de vida sean mejores.

A pesar de las adversidades que han transcurrido han mejorado su condición de vida y la necesidad que atraviesan actualmente es la adquisición de recursos económicos para invertir productos al negocio. Por tal razón buscan apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que permitan obtener los productos para luego comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in his store

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. sells shoes, sandals, shirts, and others. She is divorced and has 5 dependents. She is running out of stock.

She is requesting additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en: Rashida is married to S. A., who is 35 years old. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in kindergarten. Her husband is in the leather business. He buys leather goods and sell them in various places for the sake of profit. Rashida is applying for a loan of $1,250 to help with her husband’s business.  She has been joined in her loan group by a few more local businesswomen:  Razia wants a loan for her clothing business; Ghulam wants a loan to make more decorative embroidery; Abida wants a loan to start a clothing business; Rani wants a loan to start another decorative embroidery business; and Sughran also wants a loan to start an embroidery business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en:
Falilatu is a forty-six year old business woman. She is married with six children. Falilatu is a very hard working and resourceful wife and mother.

Falilatu supplies firewood to food vendors and canteen operators in Obuasi. Firewood is very cost effective to food vendors compared to other energy sources.

Falilatu always seizes good business opportunities. She obtains a supply of firewood from the surrounding villages of Obuasi to serve her customers.

Falilatu wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of firewood to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of the profit to pay her children’s educational fees.

She belongs to the community group called ‘Ntoboase’ (meaning slow pace) Trust Group. In this group, group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

The photograph of Falilatu was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of firewood.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
The San Roque association is part of the Los Andes business center. With the help of their credit advisor, they work very responsibly in all their group activities. Almost all married with large families, they tell us that the daily expenses of their homes exceed the income from their business, because of their large families and the increasing requirements of growing children.

Most of the group is in business selling various products by mobile sales. For example, Mrs. Monica sells candies and chocolates and Mrs. Delia sells cleaning products. They also sell school supplies, fruit, and other things. They say that with this type of sales, the products are handled and become battered and sometimes they have to throw them away. Therefore they want to invest capital in order to obtain fixed stands in the markets or on the principal streets where they will have steady sales and maintain their products in the best condition. In this way they will improve their income and the economic stability of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La asociación San Roque pertenece al centro focal de Los Andes, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy responsables en todas sus actividades de grupo. Casi todas casadas, con familias numerosas nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares sobrepasan al ingreso que obtienen en sus negocios ya que su familia son numerosas y sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan mayores necesidades. La mayor parte del grupo se dedica a comercio, de variados productos, venta que la realizan de forma ambulante, por ejemplo, la señora Mónica vende golosinas y chocolates, La señora Delia vende productos de limpieza, también se dedican a la venta material escolar, fruta y otros. Afirman que este tipo de venta, por el manipuleo hace que los productos se maltraten y en ocasiones deben desecharlos por lo que ellas desean invertir capital para poder obtener puestos fijos en mercados o en principales calles donde obtengan ventas seguras y mantengan sus productos en optimas condiciones. De esta manera mejorarían sus ingresos y estabilidad económica en sus hogares

loans.use: Capital to buy or rent fixed stands or shops

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children who are aged 10, 7, 4 and 2. She has owned a small food shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $350 from her sales.

Sada now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, sugar, wheat flour, and salt for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her business

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun H., 44, is farmer who grows rice and raises pigs, typically earning US$3.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Touch, 43, is a farmer who also cooks for wedding parties, earning around US$4.00 per day. They have three children at home, all of whom are students, and they live in Snam Pras Commune, Pursat Province. 

Because of pig business is going well and is an excellent source of income, Yoeun needs to purchase more piglets and to buy food to fatten her existing pigs so that she can sell them on time for a high price. Hence, she would like to request a loan $1,100 USD. She plans to buy twenty piglets and pig food. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. 

Yoeun's husband is pictured, because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy twenty piglets, pig food, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat K. is a 54-year-old widow who breeds pigs and grows fruit trees on her farmland for a living. She has three children, two of whom are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh, while her third child lives with her at home and attends school.

Her business is doing very well, but she wants to expand the business to generate even more income. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan in the amount of US$600 to purchase more piglets to breed, and any remaining loan proceeds would be used to purchase insecticide and fertilizer in order to protect her fruits.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more piglets to breed as well as insecticide and fertilizer to protect her fruits

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that will be dispersed to five members.

Mrs. Hak C. is 32 years old and raises pigs for her income to sustain her family. She started her business in 2005 and can earn approximately US$5 each day. Her husband, Mr. Eang Lonh, 35, makes a living farming and specializes in rice and vegetables crops. They have four children, two of whom are in secondary school. Hak is seeking a loan of $200 to purchase food for her pigs. Hak leads an entrepreneurial group with four other members

Mrs. Samath S. is 30 years old and works as a rice farmer. She is asking for a $200 loan to buy more food for pigs.

Mrs. Sokhoeun C., 35, makes a living as a farmer and is also applying for a $200 loans to buy pig food.

Mrs. Sokhuor H. is 36 years old. She is a farmer who raises rice crops. Sokhuor needs $150 to purchase a female pig.

Mrs. Oeun M. is a 58-year-old widow who makes a living growing rice. She requests a loan of $200 to purchase a cow for plowing a field.

loans.use: Purchase food for pigs

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Mrs. Phem V., 30, and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Lorn, 34, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1995 and have five children; one son and four daughters. Three of the children attend school. 

Phem has been farming for 10 years. She grows tomatoes, spinach, and other crops on her farm, and rents some plots of land from neighboring villagers to grow crops. She sells her products to a middleman in the village, who sells it in the Phnom Penh markets. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver and also farms with her.

Phem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a water pump, pipe, and to pay fees for renting farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, pipe, and to pay for renting farmland.

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Mr. Phirum C., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Kong, 44, who live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1994 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home.

Phirum and his wife have been farming for eighteen years. They grow many types of vegetables in their farmland in the village. They sometimes sell their products in the village and sometimes sell at Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Phirum is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to use for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To use for growing vegetables

loans.name: Jenitt Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jenitt es socia del Bancomunal Las Amigas. 
Jenitt es casada, tiene 33 años, dos hijos de 6 y 11 años ellos estudian en la escuela, ella se dedica a venta de ropa.  Llegó a Lima por el trabajo de su esposo, él es chofer profesional, vio la necesidad económica que había en su casa, es cuando empieza a trabajar en la venta ropa  desde hace varios años, le va bien. Cuando viaja a Lambayeque a ver a su familia aprovecha y lleva ropa para venderles.

Se compró su terreno hace un  año y  lo ha construido de madera machihembrado  todavía no tienen pared  de ladrillo.
Tiene dos años en Finca, encuentra mucho apoyo económico, pudo invertir, ha aprendido a organizarse  a no sacar un crédito por sacar, Le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal, sus compañeras son responsables  y muy solidarias.
Jenitt necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para invertir en la compra de uniformes escolares, polos, chompas, pantalones, camisas.   
El sueño de Jenitt  es construir su casa  y tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Jenitt is a member of the communal bank Las Amigas. Jenitt is married, 33 years old, has two sons aged 6 and 11 who are studying in school and she is dedicated to selling clothes. She arrived in Lima because of her husband's work; he is a professional driver and when she saw the economic need in her house she began to work selling clothes and for several years she has done well. When she travels to Lambayeque to see her family she takes advantage of the opportunity to bring clothes and sell them. She bought the land a year ago, it was build on grooved wood that still doesn't have a brick wall. She has spent two years on the farm, found a lot of economic support, was able to invest and has learned to organize themselves and not take credit from outside. She likes the meetings in Bancomunal, her partners are responsible and very supportive. Jenitt needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of school uniforms, polo shirts, sweaters, pants, shirts. Jenitt dreams of building her house and having a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jenitt needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of school uniforms, polo shirts, sweaters, pants, shirts.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sueli  semakin semangat dan gesit dalam mengembangkan usaha warungnya, warung makanan ( Menjual gado-gado, es dan makanan ringan  )miliknya kini semakin ramai di kunjungi pembeli . Untung yang di dapatpun kian meningkat hal ini tak terlepas dari bantuan pinjaman dana yang di peroleh dari Kiva melaluiYayasan  Dinari. Peranan Ni Wayan Suweli yang dibantu oleh anak perempuanya dalam mengelola warung ini juga sangat mempengaruhi perkembang dari usaha ini.Pagi tat kala Ni wayan Suweli pergi mencari dagangan ke pasar induk di Negara, Anak perempuanya dengan setia menunggui warung sampai Ibunya balik dari pasar. Begitu juga sore harinya disaat Ni Wayan Suweli mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah tangga kembali giliran anak perempuannya yang jaga warung, begitu seterusnya. Sehingga warungnya selalu buka tiap hari. 
      Dengan keuntungan yang di dapat oleh Ni wayan Suweli cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari –hari keluarga bahkan sebagian di pergunakan sebagai modal , sehingga Ni wayan Suweli bisa mengurangi jumblah pinjaman dari 2 Juta Menjadi 1 Juta Rupiah Di Perioda Ketiga ini , yang rencananya akan di Pergunakan Untuk membeli mesin Kulkas untuk membuat es,dan menyimpan sayur mayur yang masih sisa sehingga tidak cepat rusak.    Dengan begitu Ni Wayan suweli bisa menekan kerugian dari barang dagangan yang cepat busuk. Dan yang terpenting Adalah bisa Meningkatkan keuntungan yang di peroleh.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sueli is very motivated in growing her small food vending business. She sells gado-gado (Indonesian Salad), ice, and other snacks. As her client base increases, so is her profit. She was assisted by an earlier loan from Kiva and DINARI foundation. Ni Wayan Sueli is helped by her daughter in managing the kiosk. In the morning, when Ni Wayan Sueli goes to the market to purchase foods to sell, her daughter takes care of the kiosk until her mother comes back. Also in the evenings, when Ni Wayan Sueli is performing her household chores, her daughter also take care of the kiosk. Therefore the kiosk can remain open longer during the day. With the profit, Ni Wayan Sueli managed to fulfill her daily family needs and pay down her loan from $200 to $100. In this third period, Ni Wayan Sueli plans to use the loan to purchase a refrigerator to make ice, keep vegetables and perishable items. Hopefully she can improve her business profitability with the improvements.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more refrigerator

loans.name: Toussaint

texts.fr:
Né en 1955 à Abomey, A. Toussaint réside dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. AÏDOTE Toussaint est père de six (06) enfants dont quatre (04) sont scolarisés. Toussaint est un technicien en électronique et en a fait son activité principale. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. Mais l’électronique est une activité qui nécessite de grands moyens et Toussaint ne dispose pas de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre d'acheter le matériel nécessaire pour son travail. Pour rendre plus performant son atelier afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle Toussaint sollicite un crédit.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1955 in Abomey, Mr. A. Toussaint lives in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. Toussaint is the father of six children, of whom four are in school. He is an electronics technician and has made this trade his principal work. It brings in the revenues that help him to earn his living. Since electronics is a field requiring significant means, he lacks enough funds for allowing him to satisfy the large number of customers he has. To make his workshop more competitive, so as to satisfy his customers better, he’s requesting a loan. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronics equipment

loans.name: Jossy

texts.es: Jossy tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Tiene su propio negocio de venta de jugos de frutas desde hace medio año, empezó con este negocio debido a un traspaso que le hizo uno de sus familiares. En la actualidad brinda su atención durante todo el día a su establecimiento porque está de vacaciones, pero cuando estudia, su madre la apoya con su negocio. Este año Jossy estudiará de noche para que todo el día esté abocada en su juguería, de ese modo podrá lograr la meta que se ha trazado de ser una buena profesional que administre una cadena de juguerías. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a ser parte del banco comunal que actualmente integra, además tiene muchas expectativas de ser un buen elemento integrador de su grupo. La cantidad requerida la invertirá en la compra de vitrinas y mostradores para mejorar la presencia de su local comercial.
texts.en:
Jossy is 21 years old and lives with her parents and her siblings in her parents' house. She has had her own business selling fruit juices for half a year. She got into this business by taking it over from a friend of hers. Currently she gives it her full attention all day long because she is on vacation, but when she is studying, her mother helps her with the business. This coming year, Jossy will be studying at night so that she can tend the shop all day long. That way she would be able to achieve the goal that she has drawn up to become a good professional at running a chain of juice stands. This is the first time she has applied for a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She was invited to become part of an existing communal bank but she also has high hopes of becoming an important part of her group. The requested funds will be used to buy display cases and counters to improve the appearance of her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cases.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is fifty eight years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children. Her three remaining children, who still live at home, are in school. Victoria has been working to help her husband to support their children. She bakes bread and fries dough nuts to sell at the elementary schools in her community. 

She buys the necessary materials in the city of Accra. Some of the ingredients she uses are flour, sugar, oil, etc. She has been in business for twenty two years. Victoria wants to use the loan to procure the materials in bulk to cut down on transportation costs. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Iku shi Allah”, where the members guarantee one another as collateral and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Wiastini

texts.en:
Ni Kadek Wiastini - (DNR.M-0667) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Candikusuma - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Kadek Wiastini owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Kadek Wiastini has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Kadek Wiastini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Kadek Wiastini is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby animals to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out from DINARI by Ni Kadek Wiastini. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate family members.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Kadek Wiastini - (DNR.M-0667) merupakan 38 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Candikusuma - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Wiastini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Kadek Wiastini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Wiastini menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Kadek Wiastini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Kadek Wiastini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Kadek Wiastini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva."

loans.use: to purchase baby animals to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Magali Del Rosario

texts.es: Magali del Rosario U. tiene 44 años de edad, Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y estudian. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 11 años que inicio este negocio. Con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo,  Magali es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora a pesar de que su trabajo no le genera muchas ganancias, ella dice que le gusta mucho atender a sus vecinos y en sus pensamientos esta el seguir adelante con este negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos básicos para su pulpería. Su deseo es incrementar sus ingresos par que sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Magali del Rosario U. is 44 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children, both of whom are in school. Her business is a pulpería (convenience store) that she started more than 11 years ago; she began with very few products because she did not have much working capital. Magali is a very modest and hard-working woman, and even though her business doesn’t generate much profit, she says that she enjoys attending to her neighbors and thinks she can get ahead with her business. She plans to use the loan she is requesting for working capital and to purchase basic products for her store. Magali’s wish is to increase her income so that her children can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Azra Parveen Abdul Majeed Mughal Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. 
Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy wood for making wooden boxes to sell. 
Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 
Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. 

Azra parveen baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband, A. M. M., runs a scrap business in the community. Azra baji has received no formal education because the community where she lives is very conservative and people don’t like to send girls to school. She was deprived of the education blessing. But she learnt the art of sewing clothes from her mother and now she is taking advantage of this skill to make money. She saves her income and plans to renovate her house with the money. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: In the photo, Azra baji is displaying a dress that she is sewing.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Christiane

texts.en: Christiane is a 32-year-old woman living with her parents. She has owned a small copy center since 2007 to improve life conditions for her parents. Today, Christiane is requesting to borrow $500 to purchase an additional small photocopy machine to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase an additional small photocopy machine

loans.name: Ochabonu

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Очабону - пожилая женщина 1950 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 6-х детей. Очабону живет с двумя младшими сыновьями и невестками. Очабону откармливает скот дома, а невестки помогают Очабону в откармливании скота и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Очабону продают их на скотном рынке. Очабону кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. Она успешно закончила 4 предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Очабону планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. На фото отражена старшая невестка и внук Очабону, которые помогают ей. Очабону очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Ochabonu is an elderly woman, born in 1950. She is a widow and has 6 children. Ochabonu lives with two of her younger sons and daughters-in-law. Ochabonu raises livestock at home. Her daughters-in-law help her with feeding the livestock, and, once the livestock is ready, her sons sell it at a livestock market. Ochabonu has been a client of our organization for 2 years. She successfully repaid 4 previous loans and now wants to obtain another loan. Ochabonu plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family's profits. The photograph shows her oldest daughter-in-law and Ochabonu's grandson, who both help her. Ochabonu likes our lending conditions very much, and she is glad that such organizations that support the public exist.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es: Jovita U., cuenta que es parte de la Asociación Comunal “Illimani” hace 3 años, ingresó por la necesidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo, ella tiene un taller de carpintería, trabaja junto a su hijo quien elabora los muebles y su hija vende los mismos, en esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar madera. Al igual que Jovita las demás integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de cosméticos, ropa, dulces, camisas, comida, pasteles y tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan del préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería.
texts.en:
Jovita Ilo states that she has been part of the “Illimani” Community Association for three years. She became a member because of the necessity of increasing her working capital. She has a carpentry workshop. She works with her son, who makes furniture, and her daughter, who sells it.

On this occasion, she needs the loan in order to buy wood. Like Jovita, the rest of the members have different businesses such as the sale of cosmetics, clothing, sweets, shirts, food, cakes, and neighborhood shops. They all need loans for investing in their businesses and buying merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and divorced, with four children aged between 10 and 26 years of age. She lives in a three-room house with her children and additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water in the house. The family receives three meals a day.

Mary sells a variety of soaps, including toilet soaps and bath soaps. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, an area in Uganda, and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to an average to 35 customers a day, and she works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and medication. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Mary has been with MCDT for 9 years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more items. Mary has aspirations of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria M. A. reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, y vive con su hija de 10 años y su padre Don Pedro de 83 años de edad. Debido a la avanzada edad de Don Pedro, Ana Gloria lo cuida y mantiene. Ana maneja un taller de costura y venta al por mayor, donde trabaja el día entero y se gana la vida.  En este momento solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y nuevos materiales para expandir su negocio y crecer comercialmente.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria M. A. resides in the municipality of Apopa, in the San Salvador area. Gloria is 52 years old, and lives with her 10-year old daughter and her 83-year old father Don Pedro. Since Don Pedro is of advanced age, Ana Gloria supports and cares for him. Ana manages a clothing workshop and wholesale business, where she works the entire day to earn her living. She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase raw materials and new material in order to expand her business and grow commercially.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Vizminda

texts.en:
Vizminda I. is from the village of Panta-on Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vizminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops ("kamoting kahoy"). The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Vizminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vizminda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vizminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and save for future needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La señora MARIA JUANA V. D. M. , tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. Secundaria.  Es casada  y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores quienes la apoyan económicamente y están atentos a ella.
MARIA se dedica a la confección y venta D. calzado para niñas.
Actualmente se encuentra fabricando pedidos para  eventos especiales como: Promociones, Primera comunión, Navidad, etc.
Los fabrica con el apoyo D. su esposo y los venD. con el apoyo D. su hijo quien viaja hasta Tumbes y Bagua a vender el calzado.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. cuero y pegamento para la fabricación del calzado.
Este crédito D. 1,200 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra D. más material como: cuero, hilos, plantillas, dulopio, etc.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas y empezar a vender al por mayor en cuidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Juana V. D. M. is 54 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas” (Courageous Women). Maria completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She is married and has two adult children who already support her financially and attend to her needs.

Maria manufactures and sells footwear for girls. She currently fulfills orders for special events such as school promotions, first communions, Christmas, etc. Her husband assists her with making the shoes while her son helps her when she travels to Tumbes and Bagua to sell her goods.

Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase leather and adhesives for making shoes. This current loan of 1200 soles will be used to buy more materials such as leather, thread, insoles, foam rubber, etc. Maria dreams of increasing her sales and becoming a wholesaler in the nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin has been in the auto repair business for five years. He is married and has one child. Elchin was born in 1976. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his auto repair business. He lives in Fuzuli region.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: La señora Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene  37 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.Paquita,  nos cuenta que en su vida paso por muchas dificultades, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva ya 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Paquita, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Paquita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Paquita, 37, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and her son, who is a student and still dependent upon her. Paquita relates that her life has passed through many difficulties but the enterprising spirit that has always charaterized her and her desire to get ahead in life, have served to inspire her to start her own business selling prepared meals and she has been involved in this occupation for 5 years now. Paquita sells her meals in her own house, a space that's well equipped to serve her customers. Little by little se became better known among her customers, who are her neighbors, friends and family members, for the good flavor of her meals and her sales are good. She offers meals twice a day: mornings and afternoons. With this 3,000 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her meals like: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens, flats of eggs, bunches of bananas, pastas and oil by the dozen as well as kitchen utensils to provide better quality service. Paquita, like she is refered to affectionately, feels empowered to continue with her food sales. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her reaching her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Audilio

texts.es:
Audilio R. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, tiene 6 hijos.El quiere el préstamo para invertirlo en el mantenimiento del café y de un almácigo que tiene, para así poder tener una mayor producción en la próxima cosecha.Don Audilio se dedica a la producción del café desde hace muchos años, tiene el café sembrado en dos hectáreas y medias.El desea poder tener el próximo año una buena cosecha por lo que desea darle el mantenimento necesario para conseguirla.
No es la primera vez que don Audilio se financia con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para el, además, el siente que esta modalidad de crédito le genera un ahorro.
Las metas y aspiraciones que el tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y tener una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Audilio R. C. is 53 years old. He is married with six children. He applied for the loan to invest in maintaining his coffee farm and a tree used for transplanting new trees. He hopes to increase production for the next harvest. Don Audilio has worked as a coffee producer for many years; he has two and a half hectacres planted with coffee. He hopes to have a good harvest next year which is why he needs to keep his farm well maintained. It is not the first time that Don Audilio has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms of the loans, which are accessible for him. He feels that this form of credit has allowed him to save. His goals and aspirations for the future is to be able to help with his children's education and to be more stable economically. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining coffee farm

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells bags of melon and garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers. Melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup in Nigeria. She has been in the business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of melon and garri to sell.

Felicia is 55 years old and married with six children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Felicia is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) and melon to sell

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: Manuel tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad.  El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos fruto de las ganacias de cada dia,tiene más de 5 años dedicados a esta actividad del transporte. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, ya que a diario vive distintas experiencias. Manuel y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia ya que el terremoto les destruyo su vivienda, ahora están comenzando nuevamente y gracias al apoyo de su suegra están avanzando, Manuel por ese motivo es que se encuentra viviendo en casa de la madre de su esposa, Manuel destina todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Manuel sueña  ver su casa construida y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old and has been married for the past seven years. He has a six year old son. He got the “mototaxi” (a motorized taxi cycle) with the money he earned daily. He has been transporting people for the past five years. He has a lot of experience and gathers more each day. Manuel and his life’s partner dream of having their own home, after the earthquake destroyed their old home. Now they are starting over and making progress, thanks to his mother-in-law’s help. Manuel is currently living at his wife’s mother’s home. Manuel uses his earnings toward his son’s education. Manuel dreams of seeing his home built, being able to provide for his young son’s security and well-being, and seeing that he is able to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a taxi service

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica en las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, tiene extensiones de terreno donde cultiva los principales productos de su zona; como la papa, maíz, arveja, habas y cebada; pero también siembra alfalfa para la alimentación de sus vacas y toros.
La venta de animales la realiza en la feria ganadera de su localidad, también ofrece la leche que sus vacas producen. 
Jaime desea seguir trabajando en su establo y en sus tierras agrícolas, “hasta donde le sigan sus fuerzas”, menciona, pues es lo que quiere dejarles en herencia a sus hijos.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y se siente muy contento de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de madera para la mejora y ampliación de  su establo.
texts.en:
Jaime is sixty years old and lives with his wife in their own house.

He has been growing crops and raising livestock for twenty years. He has stretches of land where he grows the main products of his area, such as potatoes, corn, peas, beans, and barley, but he also grows alfalfa to feed to his cows and bulls.

He sells his cattle in the local livestock market, where he also offers for sale the milk from his cows.

Jaime wishes to keep working in his cowshed and agricultural fields "for as long as he has his strength", he says. These are also what he wants to leave to his children.

This is the third time he has had a loan from MFP, and he is very happy to continue working with his community bank. The money that he is requesting today will be used to buy lumber to improve and extend his cowshed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his cattle sheds

loans.name: Merlyn's Group

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from the village of Labinay, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Merlyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merlyn is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business of raising pigs for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $70 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Néné S. est une dame de 34 ans qui évolue dans le commerce de légumes et de condiments pour la cuisine depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle habite Bambilor. Elle  est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 13 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Son désir est d’éviter l’oisiveté et d’ avoir la possibilité de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter les produits qu’elle commercialise. Son intention est aussi d’acheter de l’encens pour diversifier son commerce. Ce crédit lui permettra aussi d’agrandir  son lieu de travail dans le marche.
texts.en:
Néné S. is a 34-year-old lady who has been active for over 10 years in the trade of vegetables and food condiments. She lives in Bambilor. She is married and the mother of four children, aged between 1 and 13. In January 2010 she became a member of the Bambilor branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. She wants to avoid idleness and be able to provide for her needs. Néné applies for a loan amounting to 100,000 CFA francs to buy products that she trades in. She also intends to buy incense to diversify her inventory. In addition, the loan will enable her to increase the size of her vending space in the market.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en: Jovelyn V. is from the town of Bautista, San Agustin. She is 41 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn V.'s Group. Jovelyn is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Jovelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy M. (pictured on the right) and Mr. Soeurn Khut (pictured left) are married and have three children. Two of their children are cleaners, while their other child is currently learning how to repair radios and telephones. The family resides in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo Province. To earn a living, Mrs. Chhoy M. is a noodle seller in the local village, while her husband is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land on which he cultivates rice in order to support the family.

Unfortunately, the family does not have enough money to pay for their child's repair school. Thus, Mrs. Chhoy M. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to pay for the school. With the remaining loan proceeds, she would like to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Phanice Anyolo

texts.en:
Phanice Anyolo P. lives in Nambale Busia, Kenya with her family. She is 41 years old and married with six (6) children. She sells clothes; a business she started in 2006 after quitting a fish business. She buys her stock in Nambale once every two weeks.

Her dream is to educate her children; something she believes will be possible but only with increased income. To do this, she first needs to expand her business by increasing her stock. She wishes to get a loan worth Ksh.10,000

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise, ingredients and work tools.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 25 años de edad, comparte su vida con esposo Joel de 28 y sus 3 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida en un puesto que tiene cerca a un paradero de buses, ofreciendo variedad de platillos como salchichas a la parrilla con mayonesa, papa rellenas, anticuchos. Rocío esta muy contenta con su trabajo,  puesto que le da los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que el sueldo de obrero de su esposo a veces no le es suficiente. Confía en que ambos puedan salir adelante y sabe que lo hará trabajando para llevar un ingreso extra a su hogar. Su mayor anhelo es comprar un puesto en algún mercado, que sea muy concurrido, para así ganar más clientes y aumentar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos y además reestructurar su puesto de venta para que sea más cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocío, 25, shares her life with her husband, Joel, 28 and their three children; they all live together in their own house. She sells prepared meals in a stand she has near a bus stop. Her menu includes a variety of dishes like: grilled sausage with mayonnaise, stuffed potatoes, anticuchos (grilled, skewered beef heart). Rocío is very happy with her work because it provides enough income to meet household expenses since her husband’s earnings as a laborer are often insufficient. She trusts that both will be able to make progress and she knows that they will if she works to bring extra income into the home.
