Her greatest wish is to buy a stand in a busy market so that she can have more customers and increase sales. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of ingredients for her dishes as well as to remodel her stand so that it will be more comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes and to remodel her sales stand.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily A. N. is forty years old, married and has three children to whom they hope to give a good education. Her business is located at Kibuye market in Kisumu. She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, rice and millet for the last three years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is fluctuating market prices, which is why she sells her products at low prices. However she works very hard so her business does well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business. She hopes to have many business outlets and supply her cereals wholesale to different parts of the country in future. Emily wants to grow her business and describes herself as humble, hardworking, trustworthy and understanding.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old. Madiore is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Madiore owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Madiore has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.  She says she experienced a lot of difficulties but she still hopes to be successful someday.

Madiore joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madiore has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Madiore is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Madiore from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Roy James

texts.en:
Roy James N. is from the village of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Roy James owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Roy James has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roy James joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roy James has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Roy James is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Roy James from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y el menor de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 25 años siembra papa nativas de su zona, además vende animales como ovejas y vacas; actividades que la han generado ingresos económicos, necesarios para mantener a su familia. Manifiesta que le agrada su trabajo, aunque muchas veces suele ser sacrificada porque  requiere de mucha fuerza física, además hubo varias oportunidades que tuvo pérdidas por la inestabilidad de precios en el mercado, que no le  permitían buenas ganancias. Con el tiempo ha sabido superar estos inconvenientes, buscando alternativas para que sus ganancias sean satisfactorias apoyándose con la venta de animales. Por esta razón continuará adelante con el objetivo de mejorar su producción agrícola. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono e insumos que ayude a controlar la plaga de insectos que puede afectar su plantación.
texts.en:
Patricio, 43, lives with his wife and the youngest of his 4 children in their own house. For the past 25 years he has grown potatoes that are native to this area, and he also sells animals such as cows and sheep. This work has generated income that is necessary to support his family. He says that he is grateful for his work, although often it is a sacrifice since it requires a lot of physical effort. Also there have been times that he has had losses because of the instability of the market which doesn’t give him good earnings. With time he has been able to get over these issues, looking for alternatives so that his income improves by taking advantage of the sales of the animals. That is why he will continue with his aim of increasing the agricultural production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support. Besides he enjoys being part of the communal group because all of the members are responsible and supportive. He thanks the people who will offer the loan that he is requesting because it will be very useful in the progress of his business. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer and products to control the infestation of insects that can affect the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and products to control insect infestation

loans.name: Fredys Edenilson

texts.es:
Fredys  tiene 21 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, Departamento de Morazán vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de la edades de 6 y 2 años, un sobrino. el trabaja como panificador en un panadería.
El trabaja en la panadería en donde hace la función de panificador en hora de 1:00pm- 5:00pm y 7:00am-9:00am, el necesita un préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción, como son lamina, clavos, alambre, para cubrir al rededor de la casa la cual actualmente esta cubiertas de varas de bambú. Este préstamo ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, protegerlos de la lluvia, menos riesgos con esto contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de estas personas.
Los sueños a futuro son construir la casa de ladrillo para vivir de una forma digna al lado de la familia.
texts.en:
Fredys is 21 years old and resides in Delicias de Concepción in the Department of Morazán. He lives with his life partner, his two children (ages 6 and 2), and a nephew. Fredys has a job making bread at a bakery.

He works at the bakery between the hours of 1:00pm-5:00pm and 7:00am-9:00am. Fredys needs a loan to buy construction materials such as boards, nails, and wire to cover the sides of his house which are currently shielded by bamboo poles. This loan will help improve his living conditions, protect his family from the rain, and reduce any health risks by improving their quality of life.

His dreams for the future are to build a brick house and live a decent life alongside his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boards, nails, and wire to cover the sides of his house

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene D. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in their own apartment in the Darhan-Uul province in northern Mongolia. She also takes care of her mother and younger brother since her parents are divorced. Her husband works as a chef in a local fast-food restaurant.

Oyun-Erdene started her clothing retailing business in 2003 at a stall outside of Darhan -- the local biggest market -- with the working capital of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT), or about $750. She was able to rent a stall in Darhan Nomin after two years of successful business operation. By this time, her working capital reached 2,000,000 MNT (or about $1,500). 

Oyun-Erdene is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well-known by her customers. For the future, she says, " I am trying my best to afford my younger brother's tuition fee and I would like to have another stall to expand my business and increase my sales." 

She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items for 2,000,000 MNT and a large number of shoes at 2,000,000 MNT from Ereen, a border city of China, for her business.

loans.use: To import more clothing

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
Gulzar lives with her family in an area named 77-15L, which is located in a mid-sized city Vehari, known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She is a house wife, stays at home and take care of her family. Her husband's name is M. H. who runs a grocery shop in the market. He offers a variety of daily use items to his customers and fulfills their requirements by selling the items they request. He started this business five years ago and his was the only shop in market, as a result of which, he earned a good daily income.

But now he is facing high competition from other grocery shops because they are offering a variety of items according to the need of the customers. It will become difficult for him to manage the financial expenses of his family if he loses his customer base. Gulzar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy the groceries in bulk to meet the requirements of his customers so he may improve his business condition. Gulzar is hopeful that with this investment in the business, her husband will be able to compete with other grocery shops and successfully retain his customers.

Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Gulzar”.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk quantity for grocery shop

loans.name: Marcos Aurelio

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos,vive junto a su madre en la zona urbana del distrito de Nueva  Arica, una comunidad dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace mas de 5 años, el cría animales en un ambiente situado en su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive y en una feria que toma lugar en el distrito de Cayaltí una vez por semana. 

Marcos desea adquirir algunas calaminas (láminas de metal utilizadas para techar viviendas, son utilizadas por personas de bajos recursos debido a su bajo precio) con las cuales piensa realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alquien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Marcos is 27 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives with his mother in the urban zone in the district of Nueva Arica, a community mostly dedicated to agriculture, which is locoated more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He works raising and selling small animals for more than five years.  He raises the animals in a room located in his home.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area where he lives, and at a market that happens in the Cayaltí district once a week.

Marcos would like to get some calaminas (pieces of metal used as roofs of houses, used by people of limited means because of their low price).  He would like to make some improvements to his parent's house and improve their quality of life.  To do this, he has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time.

He is a quiet and responsible person.  The people that know him consider him honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase corrugated iron to improve the roof of his house

loans.name: Yator Peter

texts.en:
Yator Peter T. is a businessman, 32 years old;  he operates a retail shop as a primary business and also he manages a mini-bakery and sells the cakes to customers who normally come to his shop. He is married to Rebecca T., and they have four children aged 13 years, 10 years, eight years, and six years respectively. He runs his business in Kapsowar-Eldoret Kenya and has been in this business for about four years.

Yator was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has no history with any other MFI .He is applying for a third loan of Kshs 45,000 with KADET LTD which he plans to purchase 20 bales of wheat flour flour for baking, 40 liters of cooking oil and three boxes of baking powder to expand the bakery business and to serve his customers well.

He hopes to expand his business to other towns in the surroundings of Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bales of baking flour, 40 litres of cooking oil, and three  boxes of baking powder

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es: Historia de kiva Esta foto fue tomada en la tortilleria de la sra Soledad M. B. V. Una integrante del grupo 25 de Julio, que esta ubicado en el estado de Puebla en Mexico. Se ve el grupo al que pertenece y parte de la maquinaria con la que elabora tortillas, ella se dedica  atender esta tortilleria, negocio que inicio hace seis años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de maiz y Harina para la elaboracion de tortillas. Sus clientes prefieren comprar con ella por que consideran que son de buena calidad y estan muy bien elaboradas y cumple con la exigencia de sus clientes aparte de tener buenos precios y un trato personalizado. Al momento de solicitar su credito ella se siente agradecida. Tiene treinta y cinco años de edad y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria es casada y tiene tres hijos dos mujeres y  un varón. Le gustaría en un futuro hacer la ampliacion de su negocio y dentro de sus proyectos personales ella quiere aperturar una cuenta de ahorro para asegurar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Soledad M. B. V.'s tortilla bakery.  Soledad is a member of the “25 de julio” (25th of July) group which is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  You can see the group which she belongs to and also some of the machinery which she uses to make her tortillas.  She serves in her tortilla bakery which she set up six years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and flour to make her tortillas.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because they consider her tortillas to be good quality and very well made.  She fulfils her customers' demands, offers good prices and gives all her customers individual attention.  As she requests this loan she is feeling very grateful.  She is 35 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married and has three children; two girls and one boy.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and one of her personal plans is to open a savings account so that she can guarantee her children's studies.

loans.use: To buy corn and flour

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
Ángela de 48 años, tiene un puesto de comida. Vive con sus tres hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Empezó con una mesa y una silla a vender alitas de pollo y platos de comida a las personas que pasaban por su casa. Poco a poco ha incrementado platos con varias recetas y ya tiene un local donde alquila mensualmente. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 17h00pm hasta las 21h00pm todos los días vendiendo alitas asadas, arroz con menestra y pollos mas bebidas. Con el préstamo quiere mejorar su casa para darle una mejor vida a sus tres hijos comprando con el dinero cemento, arena, bloques. 

En el futuro quiere comprar una cosas en otro sector y hay ubicar un local para su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
Angela is 48 years old and has a food stall.  She lives with her 3 children in a semi-urban zone that has all of the basic services.  The area is located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, surrounded by a marsh. 

She began with one table and one chair, selling chicken wings and plates of food to people that passed by her house.  Little by little she has added other dishes and recipes and now has a location that she rents monthly.  Currently she works from 5pm to 9pm every day, selling grilled chicken wings, rice with vegetables and chicken, along with drinks.  With the loan she would like to buy cement, sand and cinder-blocks to improve her house and give her 3 children a better life. 

In the future she would like to buy a house in another area and have a place there to sell her food.

loans.use: Cement, Sand, Cinder-blocks

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah N. K. is a married lady. Her husband is an accountant. They have three children, ages 6 to 19, that they hope to educate to the university level. Her business, Princess Exhibition, is located in the Nairobi Central Business District and is well known. She sells clothes such as blouses, suits, handbags, and shoes. Her clients include both men and women who walk in. She also has repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable. Her only major challenge is that the business is seasonal, which means that sometimes business is slow and profits are fewer. However, she works very hard every day from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes in preparation for the Christmas holiday. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own a boutique. She describes herself as patient and visionary.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. sells provisions at Abura. Ama has attained a senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Ama has been selling provisions for three years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house within his parents' fence. Her oldest son attends a primary school while her youngest daughter is handicapped. 

She and her husband operate family businesses that include a grocery shop and an internet service center. They opened their grocery shop in 2008, and after years of successful operation, they were able to open an internet center with fourteen computers and a Canon printer in the next room of their shop. They have found success in both of their businesses and purchased the printer with profits from their previous loan. 

Battsetseg is a talented business woman and says, "All I wish is for my daughter to become healthy." She is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase three computers for her internet center.

loans.use: To purchase three computers

loans.name: Micheki Mirithu

texts.en:
Micheki has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 51 years old, married to Felista Nduta and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fouth loan. He has paid for all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to to buy fertilzer and seedlings for planting.

In future, Micheki plans to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Doña Luz, tiene 39 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 6, 11 y 21 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas,  dicho negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a él, con este negocio doña Luz a logrado mantener a sus hijos y cubrir todos sus gastos.
Ella necesita por el momento comprar mercadería para el negocio (frutas), pero no cuenta con la solvencia económica para disponer de dinero y realizar la compra, por lo que solicita un préstamo. Esta inversión mejorara el negocio, ya que su inventario está lleno de diversas frutas y verduras de los cuales los clientes pueden disponer.
Si proyección es mejorar y aumentar el negocio, las ventas y sus ingresos, por ello trabaja arduamente todos los días sin descuidar el negocio y la familia por quienes también está pendiente de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old and lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel.  She lives with her family.  She has three children who are 21, 11, and 6 years old.  

She has worked selling fruit for 15 years.  Her business is located in the local market and it supports her family and covers her expenses.  

She needs to purchase merchandise for her business, but she lacks the ability to provide money and make the purchase, so she is asking for a loan.  This investment will improve her business, since her inventory is full of a variety of fruits and vegetables that are available to her customers.  

She plans to improve and grow her business, her sales, and her income, so she works very hard every day without neglecting the business and her family, who also rely on her.

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz J. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Luz is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish like sardines & mackerel in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Luz is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like salmon and sardines. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell like salmon and sardines.

loans.name: Eunice Del Socorro

texts.es:
Eunice Castellar  es una mujer que vive en la ciudad de  Cartagena muy cerca a escenarios deportivos, allí    en esta bella vende mercancías variadas, negocio con el apoya los ingresos del hogar  conformado por  su esposo  y dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años.
Eunice inició aprendió esta actividad  con su mamá, cuando viajaba al departamento de la Guajira y traían mercancía que vendía en un mercado muy doméstico,  es decir entre parientes y vecinas cercana;  y una vez su madre se retiró de su negocio, ya Eunice había logrado consolidar un mercado mayor y logró con su trabajo obtener un pequeño capital,  este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, pues   tiene encargadas entre sus clientes y algunos nuevos a los que está conquistando; Eunice  dice que su negocio ha logrado tener una independencia económica con sus ingresos teniendo en cuenta que ella y su esposo tienen muchos sueños  de brindar bienestar a su familia y cuando sus hijos crezcan, darles oportunidades de estudios superiores. Ahora su meta es diversificar porque su clientela pide cada día otros productos como el calzado deportivo y quiere vendérselos a ella mediante sistema de crédito también. 
Su principal desafío es la falta de capital para responder a la demanda del mercado por eso está solicitando un financiamiento a la Fundación mediante con el cual comprará ropa femenina e infantil y también para caballeros.
texts.en:
Eunice Castellar is a woman living in the city of Cartagena very near to sports venues.  She sells assorted goods in this beautiful place.  The business helps meet household expenses.  Her family consists of her husband and two children who are 3 and 6 years of age.

Eunice initially learned this occupation from her mother.  They would travel to the La Guajira Department to bring merchandise to sell at a very domestic marketplace, that is, among family members and nearby neighbors.  Once her mother retired from the business and Eunice had managed to secure a larger market she managed to amass a small bit of capital.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy clothes for women, children and men because she has pending orders from customers as well as new customers she’s winning over.

Eunice says that income from the business has provided her with economic independence since she and her husband very much want to provide wellbeing for their family so that when the children grow up they can provide higher education for them.  Her goal now is to diversify because her clientele is asking for other items every day like athletic shoes, for example, and she wants to sell them on credit.

Her main challenge is the lack of capital to respond to market demand.  This is why she’s asking the Fundación for a loan to be able to buy clothing for women, children and men; this is the reason for her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, children and men.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Kiambu where he does dairy farming. Besides this business, he operates a butcher shop. George is married and blessed with two children. He hopes to fully establish his business in the future.

He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya under Mwihoko group. Through the group, he has managed to get loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has used his previous loans to improve his farming.  He has requested another loan of 70,000 Kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jesús Es Mi Confianza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús es mi confianza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ruth Pavón de 24 años tiene una tienda de ropa la cual puso hace 5 años. Ella inicio vendiendo por encargo y luego con su arduo trabajo puso su pequeña tienda.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial cosméticos y su sueño es tener un tramo en el mercado.
Las otras integrantes son Blanca Rosa M. de 30 años quien vende ropa desde hace 4 años y Rosa T. de 24 años comercializa cosméticos y ropa desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The group “Jesús es Mi Confianza” (Jesus is My Confidant) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women. One of them is Sra. Ruth Pavón. She is 24 years old and has managed a clothing store for five years. Ruth started her business by accepting orders and later she worked hard to open a small store. She will invest her loan in merchandise, especially cosmetics. Her dream is to have a booth at the market.

The other members are Blanca Rosa M., who is 30 years old and has been selling clothes for four years, and Rosa T., who is 24 years old and has been selling cosmetics and clothing for three years.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: El Sr. Ovidio es un comerciante muy activo y trabaja mucho para darle gusto a sus clientes, el se dedica  a la venta  de  chicharrones en su domicilio y los vende por toda la ciudad,  es muy conocido con muchísimas personas que ya son sus clientes desde hace algunos años y en esta temporada va a invertir en  mercancía para ofrecer el servicio  a su publico  que lo sigue por el rico sabor y sazón del producto, debido a esto desea el crédito para poder surtir suficiente y  abastecer al publico  ya  que  gracias a  este  ingreso  el  puede  sacar adelante  a su  familia.
texts.en: Ovidio is a very active salesman and he works hard in order to please his customers.  His business is selling chicharrones (pork crackling).  He sells from his home and all over the city.  He is very well known by a lot of people who have been his customers for years.  This season, he will invest in supplies so that he can continue to offer a service to his customers who buy from him because of the rich taste and flavor of his product.  He would like a loan so that he can stock up with enough supplies to serve his customers since this income enables him to get his family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making chicharrones (pork crackling)

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La señora Santusa se dedica  a la agricultura y su esposo es productor lechero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semillas, como perejil, papas, etc. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la población de Palomar; es casada y tiene un hijo. Santusa se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos por que le ayudaron a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Santusa works in agriculture and her husband is a dairy farmer. The loan will be used to buy many types of seeds including parsley and potatoes. She lives in her own home which is located in the town of Palomar. She is married and has one son. Santusa is very satisfied with her loans because they have helped improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy parsley and potato seeds

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Del Rimac Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal “Los Triunfadores del Rimac” tiene 10 integrantes. Gladys es una D. ellos tiene dos hijos y actualmente esta separada. D. forma  ambulatoria venD. empanadas y productos D. chocolateria que ella misma prepara, tiene el apoyo D. sus hijos que actualmente ya realizan trabajos D. practicas profesionales, adicionalmente da en alquiler algunas habitaciones D. sus casa para estudiantes universitaR. ya que su vivienda es aledana a una universidad muy concurrida por jovenes provenientes del centro del pais. 
Para facilitarse y lograr producir sus productos que ofrece en venta Gladys invertira el credito en la compra D. un procesador D.  alimentos.  La Alcancia Comunal “ Los Triunfadores del Rimac” es una D. las primeras del programa en la zona y siempre estan demostrando su afan por salir adelante con sus familias, ellos estan agradecidos por el apoyo a sus negocios. En la fotografia se presentan a todas las socias incluso con sus hijos menores, el unico ausente por motivo D. trabajo fue el socio cesar.
texts.en:
The “Los Triunfadores del Rimac” community bank has ten members.  Gladys is one of these members.  She has two children and is currently separated.  She sells empanadas and hot chocolate that she prepares herself as an itinerant street vendor.  Gladys has the support of her children who are currently working as interns.  In addition, she also rents out some rooms in her home to university students since her home is near a university that is very popular with young people from the center of the country.

In order to make her work producing the products that she sells easier, Gladys will invest her loan money in buying a food processor.  The 'Los Triunfadores del Rimac' community bank is one of the first in the program in this area and its members are always demonstrating their desire to get their families ahead in life.  They are grateful for the support they are receiving for their businesses.

In the photo, all the members of the bank are present, including some of their children.  The only member who was absent, for work reasons, was Cesar.

loans.use: to buy a food processor

loans.name: Odzi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 55 year old Gloria (holding the yellow file) from Masvingo.  She is widowed with four children with one attending school.  

Gloria runs a retail business selling clothing as well as poultry.  The business has been in operation for 10 years and employs one person.  She says the main challenges are the defaulting of debtors.  Gloria has requested a loan of $400 to increase stock.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family.  In the future Gloria plans to operate an outlet as she has been eyeing this for some time now.

loans.use: to increase stock

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, por lo que se siente muy independiente al obtener este medio de ingreso. Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos naturales, pues tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos de medicamentos, el vive en el municipio de la Virgen en donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el precio de sus medicamentos son muy favorables. Con este crédito el comprara vitaminas, suplementos, pastillas, pomadas, inyecciones entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Juan Alberto has been in his business for more than six years and so feels very independent with his way of earning a living.  His business is selling natural medicines.  He has a wide range of customers who make orders with him for different medicines.  Juan Alberto lives in the village of La Virgen, where most of his customers know that the prices of his medicines are very good.  He will use this loan to buy vitamins, supplements, pills, ointments, injections and other products that people are requesting.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, supplements, pills, ointments and injections

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad económica ya que la mayoría de sus clientes saben del buen carisma que ella ofrece. Inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, pues tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado en donde circulan una gran cantidad de clientes. Este es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, bolsos, ropa en general, toallas.
texts.en: Juana Maria is 53 years old and she runs a general store. She has been engaged in this activity for more than 30 years, she is a very responsible person and she enjoys her job as the majority of her customers choose her for her charisma. She works form 7 am to 7 pm, as she owns a small stall in the market attended by a great number of customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, clothes and towels.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, clothes and towels.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman who owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs.

Saumu has real estate houses which she has rented out for the past ten years to tenants. She also owns a private school which provides another source of income. Saumu faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her school in the future.

Saumu plans to use this KES 80,000 loan to renovate her real estate houses and to purchase cement, sand and blocks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her real estate houses and to purchase cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, desde su centro se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable y cálida, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, cinco de ellos son casados e independientes, su último hijo tiene discapacidad, también se encuentra a cargo de dos nietos uno está estudiando en el colegio y otro en la escuela. Su esposo labora en la construcción y la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa labora en la agricultura, lo que siembra para su consumo, como pasa en su casa cría  gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y gallinas. 

Su meta es  criar más animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Union Progresista", meaning "Progressive Union". She lives in the Parish of Santa Ana. Beautiful scenery can be admired from this Parish and the population is kind and welcoming. They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors and they are agriculturists and farmers.

Rosa is 50 years old and she is married. The fruit of her marriage is 6 children. They are all grown, and five of them are married and independent. Her youngest son is handicapped. She also has two grandchildren in her care. One of them is in high school and the other is in primary school. Her husband works in construction and the house in which they live is their own property.

Rosa works in agriculture and what she plants is for their consumption. And because she spends her time at home, she raises poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs which are sold within her own community. 

She is on her second loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of pigs and poultry.

Her goal is to have more livestock to raise.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Gonzalo Enrique

texts.es:
Gonzalo Enrique tiene 28 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa e hijos, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra en el sector La capilla, comunidad cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 25 minutos, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, construcción y ganadería.

Gonzalo Enrique se dedica a la construccion y ejoramiento de vivienda, ademas al comercio de chochos, tambien a la agricultura siembra de maiz y trigo tambien crianza de anilames de corral. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, alimento para los animales.  El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia, los precios y daños en los cultivos. Su sueño es contriur la casa y comprar terrenos para cultivar. 

Le gusta escuhar musica y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Enrique is 28 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda, in Bolivar province.

The members of V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA (V.R.C. NEW HOPE), are located in the sector La capilla, in the Four Corners community in the canton of Guaranda.  Within 25 minutes of each other, the members of this group work in agriculture, business, construction, and stockbreeding.

Gonzalo Enrique works in constuction and home improvement, as well as selling chochos (bean-like seeds), planting corn and wheat and raising animals.  He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda.

He requests the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed.  The loan will help allow him to compensate for his financial needs and improve his farming practices. He faces challenges such as competition, prices and crop damage.  His dream is to build a house and buy land to cultivate.

He enjoys listening to music and celebrating the carnaval.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 45 years old and married with six children. He does mixed farming, i.e., rearing sheep, goats and also he is a wheat farmer which he has been doing for the past ten years.

He learned about Kadet through a KADET staff member. He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 which he plans to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more animals.

With  the anticipated profit made he plans to educate his children. He dreams of expanding both his businesses.

loans.use: to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Adan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves, vacas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Adan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad de que logren su objetivo trazado.
texts.en:
Adan, who is 33 years old, lives with his wife and children in their own home, which has only light service, located in the rural area of the district of Zaña which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. This area is dedicated to agriculture, raising animals and tourism.

Adan, for some years, has been dedicated to raising and selling barnyard animals (poultry, cows and pigs). His pens are found behind his house, which is appropriate. He feeds the animals with balanced feed, pasture and natural grains so that his animals reach the optimal growth so that he can sell them in different markets in the area and obtain good earnings so he can pay his bills.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 new "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more animals and their respective feed. With the earnings that he'll obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan and have a better quality of life. Adan is a person who with effort and hard work has gotten his family ahead and achieved his objectives.

loans.use: to purchase animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan, de 65 años, habita en la Ciudad de León, esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos, el es comerciante se dedica a reparar bicicletas aunque el aprendió el oficio de  mecánico de aviación, trabajo en el aeropuerto hace 45 años pero al cumplir cierta edad lo despidieron entonces decidió poner su propio negocio y puso su propio taller de reparaciones de Bicicletas.    
Solicito el préstamo para comprar accesorios, repuestos para todo tipo de bicicleta y hacer mejoras su negocio. Este inversión le ayudara adquirir inventario de repuestos que necesita, a vender mas piezas de bicicletas que le son de mucha demanda y darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio para hacerlo mas atractivo. Su próxima meta a seguir es pintar su negocio y ampliarlo mas.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 65 years old and lives in the city of Leon. He is married and is the father of 3 children. He is a businessman and repairs bicycles although he trained as an aircraft mechanic. He worked at the airport for 45 years but on reaching a certain age he was fired. He then decided to start his own business and set up his own bicycle repair workshop. 

He is asking for the loan to buy accessories and spare parts for all types of bicycles to improve his business. This investment will help him purchase parts he needs for his inventory, sell more bicycle parts which are in big demand and give his businesss a better appearance to make it more attractive. His next goal is to paint the business premises and expand it more.

,

loans.use: to buy accessories, spare parts for all types of biicycle to improve his business.

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Top (in the photo) and her husband, Sophea, are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. The couple hopes to continue their farming business because it’s a main source of income. Hence, Top is asking for another loan of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides.

The couple has been married since 1985 and they have two daughters. One is a garment worker and the other is in school. They are living in a village along National Road Number 5, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a forty-two-year-old married woman with four children who go to school. Her husband Boniface is a driver who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Jane has operated a green grocery for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and hawkers (peddlers). She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from the market to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it serves rural area clients.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.
